Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qF2oszTTzZkTk6qXLhe8qQ.text: Amazing food - had the chicken and waffle sliders and it was Amazing! Also split the Mac n cheese balls and my god were those good!  Whoever is creating this menu is creative and knows how to concoct unique and tastefully delicious items! 10 out of 10!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r_F7-BX4JmfaosIJ-ye_gA.text: Beer and champagne flat. No bubbles in the champagne. Food looked good but did not try

nBZZYG_ftcUM07H3Klr5WA.text: We had dinner here. The food was ok. Our server Umberto was awesome!!!  The atmosohere was cool and modern with a hip foodie/designer cocktail vibe  We tried the brussel sprouts  which weren't great. Umberto took them back and got us the fried Mac n Cheese.  Those were much better. Crispy outside and creamy cheese We had a "Big sexy" Wagyu burger that was meh at best.   The French dip was killer though. The horseradish sauce was excellent with the perfect amount if bite

b_QVzISG6fdU0nMQrm0YkA.text: Cool vibe!  Excellent service.  Unique food.  Red velvet waffle and chicken, fried mac and cheese, and French dip sandwich all great.

NnSeDfofh3Hl_DhHMlkhEg.text: This place is cozy with super cute modern industrial interior and a hint of glam. We showed up around 9pm with a group of 7. The place appeared as though there was no where to seat us since it was packed, but to my surprise there was an upstairs, and we were sat immediately. Everyone working in the restaurant was super friendly and greeted us as we walked passed.   I chose the chicken and red velvet waffle sliders due to all the rave reviews, and sad to say I was disappointed. The portion size was huge and filling, which was a plus. The flavor is where I felt the dish was lacking. The chicken was too salty, and the salt overpowered all of the other flavors besides the syrup.... But I didn't buy this to just taste syrup. The red velvet waffles had a cake consistency, but no red velvet taste. I also wasn't a fan of the "slaw" which was torn pieces of lettuce with sauce, but then again I was expecting southern slaw which was probably the wrong assumption.   I think this dish is a great idea and the presentation is beautiful, but I felt the execution was poor. Maybe the flavors vary based off who cooks it. More prominent, balanced flavors would do this dish justice.

JzTEhcvrYa_5ESKRNBCw1w.text: This is my new favorite bar in Las Vegas, the food was amazing and the service was out of this world. I went for lunch and loved it, then I went this past weekend at night for drinks and the experience was just as great. This place is a must for anyone visiting downtown.! 5 stars isn't enough.!

W1rO_xUU5MfCiB-zC1Y8cg.text: Update:: Recently moved here to Vegas from Cali. As a thank you, I took my "helpers" to Therapy for dinner/drinks. My brother & I LOVED the food before and we wanted to try it again to make sure it wasn't just good before because we were starving or chocolate wasted. ONCE AGAIN, the food was amazing!!! We ordered Devils on Horseback, Crab Artichoke dip, omg the Cuban sandwich was sooooo good and tasty, the Big Sexy and Korean pork belly plate - everything was tasty as hell!  Brandee (with 2 Es!) was an excellent server and on top of it! My only complaint was...I forgot my leftovers!!  P.s. For those of you that are complaining about noise level...YOU'RE ON FREEMONT STREET....IN LAS VEGAS!!! If you want lower noise level, take your ass out of the downtown area or Strip and go west or to Henderson, Vegas is not for you!

EGO-e1VCkpsEpuTewZ0fkQ.text: The food here is awesome! The service is even better. Our server Gloria immediately explained the menu to us, was very nice, prompt and knowledgeable. She answered questions I didn't even know I had yet. Fantastic place. If you're in DTLV, check this place out and ask to be seated in Gloria's section.

USf6O1n5Vr0wzlS6TyhaHg.text: This place is definitely worth trying!   We went with some friends who were familiar with the menu- so perhaps we had an unfair advantage, but it worked in our favor. We sampled several dishes, but my favorites were the "big Sexy," the mac and cheese bites, and the Red Velvet sliders. The service was OK, and all in all, the night was good.  It wasn't amazing or life-changing, and I'm not really sure that I would go back.  But it was worth trying.

TlMzbBx2Ix7PU8H8QEXr1Q.text: Fantastic restaurant! From the moment we stepped in the hostess made us feel welcome. There were eight of us, with 7 different meals, four side dishes/appetizers, and a dessert. Almost all of the food was unique, flavorful, well prepared, and beautifully presented. Brandee did an excellent job keeping up with our needs! We were all highly satisfied and satiated.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yJHK1V7RuHbqOXFvi4GFhg.text: We reserved a table for 8 for 7pm on a Friday. Our table was available as soon as we walked through the door and the hostess was waiting to welcome us. Our server, Jonathan was attentive and helpful. Our drinks and food were delicious (empanadas, I'm looking at you!). We'll be back!

77dI6ExOIQhF83BIVM4dCQ.text: Ordered  Brussels sprouts (good) Bacon wrapped dates (pretty tasty) Chicken and waffle sliders (good) Banana bread pudding (too rich but the banana sorbet it came with made the dish)  I'd recommend trying their sorbets for dessert.  Everything was good but I wouldn't come back.  It wasn't bad but it wasn't memorable.  My wife loved the dates especially the sauce.  That's the only dish I'd come back for.  Located and end of Fremont street so had a good late dinner then enjoyed the busyness of the street.  Can easily walk to Golden Nugget from here.

R_znjjdxGmSgztoHQEz0BA.text: Ahhhh how delicious can a dinner be? This delightful restaurant sent my palate into the pleasure zone tonight. And our amazing server Jonathan was right on top of everything. Need more water--right there; more drinks--yes ma'am; can he make a suggestion--oh boy--yes he can!  Thank you Jonathan!  The #MexicanStreetCorn off the cob--so good OMG! Loved the beats--you cant beat them(I know, I know)!  My Big Sexy Burger that comes with fries and I added the bacon and egg was so delish!  My hubby got the Ricky Ricardo and loved it! I drank the St. Therapy and the hubs had the Therapy Duck Ale--both fabulous drinks!  We will be back here again!

Eu-ZhMQOO29_nW6QNl6NSQ.text: I can not find a fault with the place, the food was great the waygu burger was cooked to perfection and the pork chops are amazing and generous portions even the mash was perfect. The service was equally impressive too Nigel and Michael looked after us very well. Have great recommendation's on the food and knowledge of the local area. If I'm ever back in Vegas I will definitely be back.

Izghucbt7Z5DUf4br2j2wA.text: Was here last night w/the wife prior to wandering Fremont a bit, had read good things and wanted to give it a go. A really great experience overall. We split the Fried Mac n Cheese, Crab dip, and Charred Brussels Sprouts. As always, here come the good n bad:  Positives: 1) server was attentive and not over/under bearing - awesome job (apologize for the lack of a name), 2) Brussels were flavorful and a good-sized portion, 3) Fried Mac had a spicy srirach that was awesome by itself and the bacon jam seemed to take some of the heat off the dish, a great accompaniment, 4) Crab dip was solid and tasty, just outplayed by the other dishes.  Negatives: 1) $6 for a Miller Lite is a little steep for off strip, other than that - zippo.  Will absolutely be returning.

eS7aIHzFh6_lOJslPiCLhg.text: Went to Therapy on a friend's recommendation this past Sunday. The ceviches with shrimp and tomato base sauce was WoW.  The 1/2 chicken with mashed potatoes was great and the dessert (white chocolate cheesecake ) was great. Everything was fresh and delicious.   But the service was unparalleled.  JONATHAN was great. The old bartender in me knows good service and he was on top of things. Best service I have had in LV in a long time. I love downtown LV and I will be back sooner than later.

6rCc5zW31vR9aMMATxpdJg.text: Wandering through Fremont street we decided to check out one of its newest restaurant, Therapy. Its in a perfect location mixed between a lot of bars with not very vast menus and an atmosphere to set it apart from its surroundings.   The food and bar menu is impressive, a great selection and even picky drinkers and eaters can find something to enjoy. After much deliberation we picked a few different plates to try and share, I highly recommend the French Dip and Smores! We tried the meat platter, the pretzel bites, and Mac and Cheese and no complaints about any of them. The food is perfectly seasoned and all the sauces, dips, and gravies were mouth watering making you want more food for the dipping!  With drinks, a full meal, and dessert our bill was under $100. We were sat right away with friendly staff who offered recommendations. The music was great, all the servers and busses were very friendly. I loved the chairs at the table, you should be comfy while you eat! This will be a great sports bar and a highlight this football season.

wIp0QFzit839TsMj1H1j-w.text: I am unsure if we just came on the wrong day. The only reason I upped my score to 2 stars is because the decor/ambience is very cute and fun. If you care about this- the waitresses are nice to look at, all very attractive. But the food was awful, every thing I tasted was not good. The service was friendly but inefficient. I am not sure what the management is doing or thinking at this place. It took me between 15-20 mins just to get an iced tea. I am not even all that sure who our server was. We had 4-5 different people helping at all times. Not too sure who I am tipping. Overall- bad good, friendly people, cute atmosphere, slow service.

U24fA7pzN3Vwh6r92QTrfA.text: Therapy is absolutely amazing. Great ambiance, amazing food, and the service is fabulous. Jason took great care of us and got us the best table in the place. Georgie is one of the most friendly servers around. The drink selection is perfect and the fried chicken and waffles are to die for. I've been here many times before and I'll be here many times to come!!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cozy yet hip. Amazing food. Fabulous drinks. Super attentive service. Ask for Georgia.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!!

ApDCerH4J2xC9cFBzHwXqQ.text: Had a great dinner. Great presentation and the flavors were diverse. The French dip was tasty, tender and complemented by crisp truffle chips.  Street corn was excellent.  The pork chop was thick and juicy my father in law was pleased and shared bites with everyone.  The meatballs were well seasoned but a tad dry. Overall it was enough to bring us back.  Atmosphere was an A and service was on point.  We will come back to try the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Umdk0fmEoz1SoXD_mOhRHQ.text: We came here for a mid week date night and loved every moment. I walked in a felt like I was back home in NYC with the layout and decor. Robert was a fantastic waiter and really knew the menu like the back of his hands. We split a Caesar salad, In the "gnudi", the nightly steak special (skirt steak with chimichurri sauce topped with fried onions), Mac and cheese and smores dessert. Everything was wonderful and more than enough for two people. Robert highly recommended the carrot cake but It really wanted to try the smores instead. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese very cream and good!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nightly special: skirt steak with chimichurri sauce topped with fried onion strings. Sooooo good

GqiYGiihKj7zlpy3cUuOiA.text: The food was amazing and such a surprise considering this restaurant is so close to Fremont Street. I'm not sure if they were understaffed at the time but our service was a little slow and we did have to wait for awhile to get our food, otherwise I would have given 5 stars. Options for vegetarians here too which I really appreciated.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mN4o45utp9FnGIAXrWLR4g.text: The Ceasar salad came as a few huge lettuce leafs which was fun with the freshly grated Parmesan, and the drinks were delicious. Very hipster esque

pdt9Hz3ys-izQR6FkmYNXA.text: This place is bomb! I ordered the shrimp scampi and veggie empanadas and they were amazing! I loved the atmosphere and my server Chantay was very attentive to all my needs. She was very nice and funny too! :) will def go again!

OPA721WrEREVilUS06_ZlA.text: I would barely give this place one star.  Double thumbs down.  Boo!  Really, their food/menu is sooo mediocre, sooo overpriced, and small quantity.  You would think they would make it up with a positive customer experience, but our server just could not even check the kitchen for a simple request of blue cheese.  This place is all hype and no good vibe.  Need I say more

1eoMTtmxesbiu_Z6wdPsSg.text: After seeing the reviews, my boyfriend and I decided to check it out before sightseeing at the Fremont Street experience. My boyfriend ordered the red velvet chicken and waffles and he absolutely loved it. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak sandwich and it was salty and very generic. I've had better at chain restaurants. We also tried the truffle Mac and cheese but the truffle taste was so overpowering, you couldn't taste much else. The ambiance was nice aside from the big screen TVs playing children being operated on for cleft palates. Extremely distracting. Service was okay but not excellent. If I lived in Vegas, I wouldn't return.

yzbrkUE2HWnmi48cri6N2Q.text: The best Caesar salad I've ever had. Amazing food all around. The best cocktail I've had in a while, too (the smash!). Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The smash cocktail.

PQ7r5tdGitgQRuU23fsREQ.text: Walked in and was sat at a 2 top. Asked to be in a booth but all of them were apparently reserved for two hours later. Understood.. until our server sat a couple at the booth right next to us. What??? Chix waffle was alright. The Cuban sandwich was good until I saw a hair on the platanos. Looked over at the kitchen and saw the chef with a beard. Only makes sense. They gave us 25% off our bill which I guess evens out for parking we had to pay. Bartender seemed nice though!

Xpvi0EA_w5o7gFmIJY0D7Q.text: We came with a party of 8 and seated within 10 mins. Get the Brussels sprouts and street corn! You won't regret it. All 8 of us were extremely happy with our dinners!! Our server Jonathan was great! Best sense of humor!

c5aJOOoUJUyKrxqIXSJYlw.text: Our supper club, The Dining Divas picks a new restaurant every month. I almost want to ONLY chose Therapy.  We had amazing time. Roger, the owner took personal care of us the entire evening. The service, the food, the drinks, the music....everything was absolutely amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eJnq7MTi2g1ydH7NW6d8Tg.text: This is a great hip place for the younger crowd, although i did see plenty of older folks enjoying it as well. The staff was super friendly and definitely cared about the service and their food. We met Kevin the assistant manager, who was very nice.  Onto the food. Every dish has great modern flair. We had the Caesar salad, with what tasted like home made Caesar dressing. Then the pretzel bread with a great tasting dipping sauce. My husband had the French dip, which was very flavorful. I had the chicken with red velvet waffles, which were amazing! They also have a good selection of beers. Highly recommend!

ajcTgpAGF-za1xJomYkqGw.text: Tuesday night. Not busy. Ordered their Empanadas and Brussel Sprouts. Both of these were excellent however after 2 minutes on the table (not even enough time to share half of one of the apps) the OWNER, who apparently is also the food runner, brought our main courses which sat at our table and died for 12 minutes while we enjoyed the rest of our apps. Listen, this place is cool and has some decent food and drink but if the owner is running food like that, good luck. We had a nice seat up front of the restaurant where a carry out type "open" sign was trashily blinking in the corner of my eye all dinner. I ordered the chimichurri steak and it was good. Very flavorful. My date ordered the French dip sandwich. It was very fatty beef, boring bread.  Don't order the French dip. All in all they are pretending to be something they're not. I'm disappointed.

bEcevACPa7uN9JPhsevuag.text: Stopped in for dinner here because we were doing the Fremont Street thing and it had good reviews (first we tried to eat at Park on Fremont but you have to be 21 to eat there?).  Glad we ended up here too because the food was really good.  We had the Mac and cheese which was smokey and had a lot of flavor.  Plus we had the "Ricky Ricardo" sandwich which is a Cuban style sandwich and that was awesome too.  The place had a nice atmosphere that was stylish but relaxed enough you didn't feel like you needed to be "dressed up".  Michael was our server and he was attentive and honest about the menu.  All in all we liked this place and would recommend it if your in the area.

sjE081eE6WruCu_VsyZxgg.text: This place has a very casual atmosphere while offering high end spirits and service. The menu is a mix of southwestern and comfort souls food. We started the meal off with craft beer and empanadas. For my entree I elected to get the Red Velvet Chicken and Waffles as well as the Street Corn. I was not disappointed with either. The chicken and waffles were paired nicely with vanilla maple syrup and a spicy remoulade sauce. The corn was covered in cheese and spices. Like I said the service was awesome and the location off of Freemont street is great. Highly recommended.

PhFb-y3igQb0M5k8nRz0mw.text: This is my first time coming to Therapy! Sat at the bar for a drink before dinner and Shannon and Blake were amazing! So friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and drinks! They were both so awesome we decided to stay at the bar and eat!! They are the kind of people that you want to hang out with just as friends!!

oV7nhg0KTiizJuEvro_bmg.text: Therapy has some unique drink and food selection that can't be found at a lot of other places, such as deep fries pig ears. We also tried some street corn here which was delicious and slightly better than Gluttons primarily because it was served on the cob and as a result wasn't soaked in the sauces - it made it feel less heavy.  The drinks we had were somewhat a miss. I tried their much hyped Smash drink and it was just ok. We also tried the mango and lychee blended drink but it was very tasteless with only a hint of alcohol.  The atmosphere here is slightly nicer than the general downtown feel - it's got a nice open layout and a modern look. Definitely a place that one could spend some time and feel comfortable in. That being said, it's a little pricier than other places nearby.

Y9pofqJlK89mK6_4bz-v5w.text: Kristina made our experience so much better! She makes the best drinks. Their food was pretty good and the atmosphere is super cool. If you're looking for a sweet little place to chill out and get shwasted look no further!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

USvyJ_UKaQuUvEBBNtqOtA.text: Holy cow the salmon is amazing! Cooked perfectly, even the asparagus is cooked perfectly I am very pleasantly surprised especially since I had it delivered thru postmates.  I am so picky about salmon and it being overcooked even a little bit and this blew my mind and tastebuds. I also ordered Devils on horseback which are bacon wrapped dates and they were incredible.  The sirracha sauce is delicious as well. Definitely will order these again.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and bacon wrapped dates.  Soooo yummy definitely ordering these again!

hSx5n0hq0rN4nXNdwfsnkg.text: Therapy has a great new cocktail and food menu! Was suggested the Chorizo Empanadas by the bartender Blake. I didn't even have time to take a picture, they came out so fast and they were amazing. Can't wait to try other new food items!Come try this place out, such a great vibe.

O-qfCe5IpUzMRBUlG33wYg.text: Right on Freemont Street is this cute little place called Therapy. We were looking for a great spot for our last meal in Vegas and we chose well.   The decor is nice, the food upscale - but not too bad price wise. They have a lot of things that are good for sharing, so this would be a great place for a mid-day snack or a meal where you want to share with your friends.   We had a lot of food. The Crab Dip, the Big Sexy, the French Dip, The Carrot Cake and The Chocolate Soufle. All were good. The Carrot Cake slightly dry and the Soufle not the best I had ever had, but still rather satisfying. There were many things on the menu and the drink menu that I would come back here to try.   Ultimately, I would come again and recommend this spot for your dining adventures.

8VM3QDTLrxD-UT7xRcY2Iw.text: My husband and I popped in when we we're in vegas last week. We shared the chicken meatballs (yummy!), I had the red velvet and chicken waffle sliders (so yummy!) and my husband had the ricky ricardo (yummy too!). I had a mojito that was THE BEST I've ever had, so fresh!!! The restaurant was quaint, the service was great, we enjoyed our time there immensely!!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s144825QI7I6n1LhQ13Uig.text: Why this place gets reviewed so highly is beyond me, it's not bad but its not that good.  Ordered a filet at recommendation of the waitress, medium rare = medium well apparently.  The place was freezing too, cannot fault them as I did not say anything but eating a meal with goose bumps was less than ideal.  The appetizers were pretty good, oxtail empanada was very, very hot when it came out so the first bite burnt my mouth.  Bacon wrapped dates were good, liked the touch of bleu chees surrounding the almond in the date.

-J0risZyQlHgcZ4C_IQ05Q.text: Loved this place!! My boyfriend and I wanted to try something new and this place seem good based on reviews. It was pretty busy on a Saturday night, but called ahead to make reservations. Food was great! The red velvet waffles were great and fried chicken was juicy! Definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner or even lunch. I will more than likely return when I'm in town again. Thanks Yelpers for helping us find yet another great restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Therapy Salad and Fried Chicken &amp; Waffles!

QYOxOeu5OOT5Wa_L6SseKQ.text: Came here many times before.... Love their food. However, after making my reservation online, I came to found out they could not find it when I showed up at my scheduled time. Did not try to accommodate us, so we went next door to Eureka. They were alot happier to seat us. I think they killed my image of them.

bpK2ZFZo7yJ3hQ4rtVVgLw.text: Had a great time. The staff was on point and very quick. Food was amazing! Perfect for having a good meal and then going over to the Nugget to see Harry Shahoian's band at the Rush Lounge.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fcxZH8iE-yTwGcgvZu_reQ.text: Intriguing menu with tantalizing flavors. Nice music and comfortable seating. Brandy gave us great service. Nice wine list reasonably priced.

R13qVnd_G1miPWH3QKBXMA.text: We had a great time here for our holiday lunch. The food is very unique and tasty. Everything is seasoned well. Place has a great vibe.

71Lkp3G1R9O4nMJUj-cMKA.text: MEDIOCRE. Might have just ordered the wrong items but everyone we had was BLAH. Had the Brussels because it was a highlight for many yelpers and sad to say they were extremely disappointing. The Caesar salad, which was served an hour after we ordered it, is worth a quarter of what they are charging for it. Chorizo empanadas and bacon-wrapped dates were decent, but not worth a visit. Staff were not knowledgeable about the menu or the wine list. $100 for two people, for a meal that is probably worth $40 at most. If you're going all the way downtown for a good meal, skip this place and go to Carson Kitchen or Le Thai.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $10 salad

ZZAicJD1H_pq9oC0KztRlA.text: It was hard to find but I'm glad we found it! The 'In the Gnudi' and 'Devils on Horseback' were amazing! They combined sweet, spicy, smoky and salty in the most amazing way. The French dip was so juicy and the beef was so flavorful and tender.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My virgin cocktail

79qx09xQTnw0aDJ9sR8lgg.text: We tried literally all the appetizers on the menu. Phenomenal!  Great service from Joanne and amazingly different and delicious tastes. Loved the brie with some kind of fruit bread and plum sauce...This place is a must return.  Oh yes and great Happy Hour specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great time with Dr. WRIGHT!!!

y6R0gxzybpNLD-CNUuR8Jg.text: Walked in Yesterday around 720pm and it was pretty slow. I wasnt sure what I was in the mood for but they have a great tv at the bar and the menu looked great. Me and my bud decided to have a seat at the bar since the host was a cool dude but when we sat at the bar the service changed.  There was a make and a female bartender and we were approached by the guy. He carded us which is just ridiculous since he was much younger than us, then we sat there reading the menus and he never came back to ask if we wanted a drinks or food. The bar was 25% full when we sat down so he was not busy but he never approached us so we bailed. I guest maybe this place was just too cool for school.

ryje6D6ZnKKjg5Lj9dCi8g.text: I live in Las Vegas but have never been to this restaurant before it was wonderful the food was excellent but what made our evening was our waitress her name is Chelsey she was amazing fun great personality the service  was he best in today's world most people don't care Chelsey cares  Jason who is a supervisor greeted me with a huge smile and asked if I was meeting some other ladies there I said yes and he replied I know exactly where they are and immediately took me to their table wonderful personality great skills for mgmt Wonderful restaurant

UP4WR1YBijIQyk7qMboHTw.text: This review is solely based on the hostess tonight, Gabby. I absolutely love this place, their food, their servers.. all of it. First time I had something go sideways and I thought I'd share. My wife and I decided to stop in for dinner, we're locals so we've been to this spot a bunch of times and we love it. Wife had a cocktail and Gabby proceeded to tell us that she would have to finish before we could be seated at a table... my wife inquires, "since when?" .. Gabby informs her "Since always". Well.. coming from a customer service industry I had to educate Gabby on the way out... let her know that wasn't the most customer service response she could have provided. Shared a couple of examples of what would have been fitting and how she should course correct in future if she wishes to find success in a customer facing role. Hoping it's the first and last time I have to see her. Her response to my feedback demonstrated she's not the best person to be dealing with customer face to face.

fRDwJZb3Ya7sgCTvhF64Zg.text: Cute new restaurant downtown. We went for a little tasting for a work event and it was enough of a tease, a good tease to make us want to come back for more. We got a taste of the carrot cake with brown butter ice cream, baked ricotta with fig jam on a walnut cranberry crostini, chicken meatball with cilantro pesto, gulf shrimp ceviche and summer squash flatbread. And upon arrival greeted with a delicious Cab. All very tasty!  Back for lunch the following day for a team lunch. I got the hangar steak tartare which the presentation was cute and liked the pickled toppings. Street corn was my favorite!! If you like bacon the popcorn mix is different and a fun appetizer.  I do recommend if you are going for lunch or a meal order the burger or French dip because the price you pay for a flatbread is the same and you get more for your money for a full sandwich.  Seems a little odd that you pay the same for a giant/good size burger or French dip and a small flatbread. The flatbread won't fill you up unless you have a bunch of other snacks. It's more of a pricey appetizer small plate, the middle section of the menu. It's good just not a meal if that is what you are expecting, so I think pricing is a little disproportionate.  Otherwise great new option downtown. I will be back to try the burger and dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked ricotta
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn with bacon
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!! Street corn

MB29lQXscMPaiibMVGG7tg.text: Well the speaker sound system is AMAZING!  Yes True food, different and comforting!  The chicken sliders were my favorite item and I will go back!

Ig7tHVKpMBpNE3oQd4ptMQ.text: What a gem of a restaurant this is. The decor is really nice, and they played good music (I know music isn't part of the deal but it was good.)   We had amazing service, and they even brought out a s'mores dessert for my birthday, which, BTW was SO DELICIOUS, it was worth breaking my Keto diet for.  Seriously, I haven't had such a delicious dessert like that in so long.    I ordered the The "Big Sexy" burger without the bun, and added bacon and an egg to it, gave my fries away, but another friend did the same and changed the fries to a salad, which I should have done.  The portions are generous, and I was full, and we all eat a lot. (we all powerlift) We also ordered some other appetizers including crab dip (AMAZING, although i think it would taste better with bread vs chips), charred brussel sprouts (my personal favorite),   My friend's chimichurri steak was phenomenal. Everybody at the table enjoyed their food. I was completely surprised a restaurant of this caliber is out in DTLV, since I come to the golden nugget at least twice a year for a week for work, I am glad I found a good little spot to get my grub on!   Prices are decent for what you get, I've been to a "nice" restaurant in beverly hills and had the WORST bunless burger which was around 4-5 dollars more than what they charge here and this place blew that burger out of the water. To be honest, this may be one of the best burgers I had.

rmxiQ3eTgJzBFocBan-xGg.text: This was a really great find in old Las Vegas! Easy to walk to the downtown area. We received our food super fast and Brandee provided excellent service. There are a number of vegetarian options. Highly recommend the brussel sprouts! The drunken tofu was also a creative dish with a unique flavor! My friend enjoyed the empanadas she had as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drunken Tofu

8U9Y77vopEfttOD3ncAbew.text: My friends and I were in the area and found this little gem on Fremont street.  I loved the decor and the wait staff was super nice and attentive.  To start we ordered cappuccino . They were served in expresso cups. Very flavorful; just expecting more volume for cappuccino.  I ordered the Ricardo Cuban Sandwich with a side of the Parmesan Truffle  fries. Every thing was delicious. The sandwich was moist, with a lot of layered flavors.  My friend orders the red velvet chicken and waffles. She stated is was very good as well.   We did not order dessert, but will make Room next time. Generous portions, loved the decor. Great place form quick bite.  On the way out I viewed the daily happy hour specials, which I would love to check out.

WC9NEPr6h8R7i-KZYy__FA.text: I came into therapy tonight with my friend and the bartender, Kristina was the absolute best! Besides the food and the drinks being phenomenal , she is probably one of the best bartenders I've ever met. She recommended the fried Mac to us and the crab dip, which we thoroughly enjoyed. No question about why the food network picked them up. And why Therapy picked her up too.  But In all honesty, the service was everything! She was funny and attentive and made our time there one of the best experiences we've had all year. (Even tho we're only 5 days in) we will for sure be back and if you're anybody whose anybody, you will go in to eat and meet her too. Heck yeah Therapy!

qe9pIm6d_A4k7Qgm_LGJMg.text: Came in about a week ago with a group of athletes after their football game. The restaurant has a really cool, gorgeous aesthetic- it was a great balance of an open space + community vibes. Our sever Jonathan was fantastic! Attentive, friendly, fast and super personable. He didn't flinch when 2 tables asked for individual separate checks (having been a server for years myself, I know it's not easy during a dinner rush). Everything we ordered on the menu was incredible also. I can't wait to come back and try more things. Come check it out and request Jonathan's section!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our amazing server Jonathan!

FPZg7Y8n9N07Tjiyzg98aQ.text: When I went to Therapy back in February for my roommate's birthday it was really nice! We scheduled reservations with ease the night before and when we arrived they sat us right away (thank goodness for it being a Tuesday night and not much foot traffic). It was just a simple birthday gathering so we had drinks and shared some appetizers. I would recommend the raspberry rose (I had two of those) and also had the creamy and crabby appetizer which was delicious! Prices are a little high, but the drinks are totally worth it!

FVtLMRI1K6OffLB-DNm74w.text: Dec 7~Had family in town and they suggested a restaurant called Therapy. I had never heard of it. Doesn't look like much from the outside but inside is really neat. It's 2 levels. We were seated on the upper level. Not a huge menu but something for everyone. I had chicken, with mashed potatoes, and broccoli with mole sauce. I got the sauce on the side since I had never had it before. Not for me but my boyfriend liked the mole sauce. My boyfriend got steak. It was a nice size serving. Everything was awesome. Service was great. Waiter didn't try and rush us. Very nice clean restaurant. Will definitely come again when I'm near Fremont Street. The reason I gave a four star is the tables are extremely close together upstairs. I don't like touching elbows with people at next table.

Suq6xU1e0FJbqLygJzSP3w.text: Therapy is my very favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! I first ate at Therapy three years ago when I attended my very first Plexus Convention at the MGM Grand. We enjoyed the delicious food and our waiter Jonathan Thomas was phenomenal. The service he gave us was top notch!  I connected with Jonathan because I am from Maine and Jonathan had lived in Bangor, ME when he was younger.  He was very understanding and sympathetic as I had just lost my husband a month and a half earlier. We became instant friends and kept in touch over the years.   Fast forward to now when our Plexus Convention was in Las Vegas again. We decided to eat at Therapy and when I walked into the restaurant and saw that Jonathan was our waiter, my heart couldn't have been happier. I sprang from my chair and gave him a great big hug!  Old friends reconnecting again!  Here we are three years later and Jonathan is still an amazing waiter at Therapy. He never lost his touch. He was attentive to all our needs from the drinks to the food and dessert. He suggested the short ribs to my friends and they absolutely loved them! I had the Therapy Signature Salad and we all enjoyed the carrot cake for dessert.  Jonathan always checked on us being attentive to all our needs and making sure we had the best dining experience ever. He was very pleasant, curtious and kind. As far as I'm concerned, Jonathan is the BEST!

6XXjw9-ArlnVE4Gj0n_90Q.text: A gem in Sin City!  Aaron and Michael were spot on with service, and the brussels sprouts were a-mazing!  Don't miss the all night HH at the bar- best thing going for food and drink downtown!

Zr4pHgHdIeJlD9D_40p3uA.text: Fantastic atmosphere. Surprising spot off freemont in downtown.  Great drinks and great food.

0K8VOITfwNIozQyBrwDjdQ.text: I'm not a fan of duck. Never have been. That changed once I had the duck from Therapy! Up until now I thought the only way duck was prepared showcased it as a very oily meat. This was different and exceptional - lightly crisply browned and very flavorful! I also highly recommend The crispy brussels sprouts. Unbelievable!

rM49QlTM5AuRn4UQr9yBRA.text: Humberto Galindo is the absolute best waiter of all time.. knowledge, polite and handsome the best service of all time.. the food was amazing and it was all Humberto's recommendations!!! Fav place

Parking was within decent distance of the restaurant...  Our waiter Terence was great. He was very attentive, he offered some great food options.. Terence was honest and was very groomed. Iaz-eynV8VvDNqYyGnDaNA.text: Good unique food. Chicken sandwich is delicious. Love the freshness of the meat and sauce. Good place to visit when you are in Vegas. Better than 90% of the Western food in California.

5ki9p27ztzBAVfT30xVVHQ.text: I never give a restaurant a one star and honestly this one star is because our Server Jonathan. My husband and myself are locals and we frequent DTLV often whether for business or pleasure. I have never been treated so poorly by a supervisor in my 30+ years of life.   We ordered a few social plates and entrees as well as drinks, it was date night we were ready for a great night! Well it started well Jonathan was very pleasant got us taken care of quickly. When the food arrived the presentation was great so we dug in. The crab dip was sooo good , we also ordered the red velvet waffle chicken sliders (the reason we came). When we bit into the chicken the texture was like rubber! We apologized to Johnathan and told him about our displeasure he was very kind and apologized.   MARIA the night manager came over and "apologized" by saying "I'm sorry you did not like our dish it's made with real organic chicken and we have never had an issue" ...... as to say we don't buy nor have we had organic chicken. She talked over me and spoke very harsh and abrupt. I never pull the race card but discrimination is what I felt. Yes we were the only Black couple but I didn't feel that until this moment! It was date night for us we were ready to order it all of we wanted to but after this we paid for our drinks and crab dip and ended our night. Ended up at a pub we frequent with our mood completely shot!   We tipped Jonathan and thanked him he apologized multiple times , even the guest next to us couldn't believe how she spoke to us! We will not recommend this establishments any of our friends nor partners

5jNuhSPgI47BXLWNYRdi9g.text: Delicious,  hoste was welcoming, vibe is serene, our waitress Yesenia, so pleasant, knowledgable and helpful on the vegan and vegetarian selections and they will  make the selected meal vegan. Mixologist was pleasent and the Mango Ricky she made, was delicious.  All the staffs are all fabulous and helpful. Thank you for a very pleasant, enjoyable visit.

WF-MbtldXoX6hVqD_R1f1w.text: Went here on a whim.  Highly recommend, the food was outstanding.  Empanadas were great as well as the chicken and waffles and the fried Mac and cheese balls.

rcOQRpOhTTDUkTG0C0F9yA.text: We came to try this place and it's AMAZING! The staff was so polite and the food was DELICIOUS!  We ordered the shrimp ceviche, Brussels sprouts, corn off the cob (super yummy) and chicken meatballs-pesto delicious on everything. Our server Umberto helped us choose and was great. Definitely recommend this place!

WJrztj4iayj1ICyATzX8cw.text: Jonathan was the greatest server. Almost had a bad allergic reaction (the vegetarian arugula thin & crispy has pine seeds, wasn't detailed on the menu), but Jonathan stepped in and got everything sorted out without any issue. Real cool dude.

FNYboSRGJMk9AL68Q8hlVg.text: Great food and service. We were in a hurry due to show tickets but they kept us right on schedule and served up an amazing meal. Try the Mac n cheese croquettes..,,amazing!

5FpG8kcx92eiQSEumJTz1g.text: Looking for a Happy Hour downtown Vegas, we came across this place, and sure glad we did.   Therapy is a cool funky type pub/lounge that has great food, friendly staff and decent prices.   We sat at the bar to take advantage of Happy Hour menu, which included $5 beer, wine, Mimosas, Bellini's, well cocktails, a Happy Hour menu and 20% off all regular priced food items.   I had a Bellini, and my husband had a beer. We split the shrimp ceviche which was excellent ! It was a generous portion, served alongside black bean taco chips. So good - if you like seafood - I highly recommend!   We asked our server / bartender Kimberly what she suggested for a main. She chose the Ricky Ricardo ( which we both were considering ) It is a Cuban sandwich filled with pork, ham, cheese and pickles. It was very good. We split this as well and it was enough to have us both satisfied.   We each had another drink and got the bill. It came to under 45$ including tax which seemed really decent.   Kimberly was behind friendly and polite. The ambiance was cool, and I really liked all the metal sculptures that were all over the place. It's not old and smoke filled like most of Downtown Vegas. I would definitely return and totally recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour !
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IyoNUhkI8D3Pp6IjjqKeUA.text: We just had dinner here and the experience was positive. My boyfriend saw they had Barramundi Slider on the menu online but unfortunately they don't serve it anymore. He was disappointed at first but the Fillet Tartar made his day. I loved it as well, it was my first time eating something new such as this dish. Very delectable.   We also ordered Pork Belly and I asked if it was fatty and the server said not too much but it was quite fatty and had little meat. My boyfriend liked Devil on Horseback, and The Ricky Ricardo was supposed to be cuban style but the flavor didn't taste like a cuban sauce. It was tasteful but they should have called it something else.  The restaurant is spacious with a high ceiling which we like. We were seated upstairs with a table overlooking the restaurant.    Service was friendly and efficient.

mo5F3iuiyBlwntvNeSJnqw.text: Went on a quick lunch break with my girlfriend. We wanted to try something new, and Therapy showed up. It did advertise it on Yelp as being a popular tapas restaurant, which I would say is inaccurate to their food offerings during lunch. We ordered the steak-frites ($15), charred Brussel sprouts ($10), and crumbled carrot cake ($9). The waitress raved that we would come back for the Brussel sprouts, and she may be right. What I loved about these Brussel sprouts, unlike other comparable dishes, is that you could actual taste the Brussel sprouts in combination with the cheese, sauce, and cashews. The steak was prepared at a good temperature and accompanied by deliciously fried frites. The crumbled carrot cake was a cool deconstructed version. Besides the Brussel sprouts, I would say that the service and music would have me coming back. Our waitress was so polite and attentive. The music was all of my favorite latin hits! The reason it doesn't get a 5 from me is coming from the taste and price categories. The only dish I believe to be priced accurately would be the steak-frites. Overall, this place gets a 4/4.5.

Zyi5SZnTloNN3nYeMUWBRQ.text: Went here for lunch with coworkers.  The ambiance is amazing, great music, and delicious food! Our server Yesenia was awesome! Would definitely come back!!

ycTuo8hK_-hY1RAGeovgjw.text: My husband and I came in for dinner for the first time on Sunday night (12/23) at 8pm. The restaurant was not busy or full but it took a very long time for our server to acknowledge us. We contemplated leaving but than she showed up. There wasn't much of a introduction just a "can I get you something?" Since we were hungry we went ahead and ordered the food. I ordered the big sexy burger and he ordered the chicken and waffles. Both were good but unfortunately the lack of service won't bring us back.

JEnzBV64u7_lj2dlGag2jA.text: Everything on the menu is awesome! Yesenia was super friendly and attentive. The music and Yesenia made it that much better. Will definitely return on next visit!

46Fe3SUyY3USUZGsURigSA.text: This little gem is one of my favorite restaurants. The ambiance feels upscale, yet laid back. There are no words to describe just how amazing the food is. I recommend getting a few shareable plates so you can experience different dishes. The fried macaroni on a bed of bacon jam has a wonderful balance of unexpected flavors and textures...truly heaven on a plate! I highly recommended the chorizo empanadas and charred brussel sprouts as well. Gloria is a fantastic, attentive server and makes you feel at home from the moment you walk in the door.

LJ5MQHhwK1lCgMOsDquWJw.text: Great meal. We were looking for something smaller, good wine menu and great food. Great overall experience. The family left happy and full.

oKgLs5a_eHfJpPhCVmMf6w.text: Definitely a place to stop in when you are downtown whether it's for a bite to eat or just a drink at the bar. I enjoy the ambiance and have never experienced poor service. We ordered multiple small dishes to share (meatballs, empanadas & mac n cheese bites) which were all great and a little different with their flavoring. I haven't tried their main dishes but will be back to do so!

Ov-nyrckKuM_CkiyzTD-jA.text: We went to Therapy for the first time for an early dinner this week. We had a reservation for a party of 7 and when we arrived a few minutes early, there was a beautiful table all set up and waiting for us. We were immediately greeted by Jonathan who was our server for the evening. If I could create the perfect person to represent a classy, hip, urban place such as this, it would be Jonathan. He was kind, funny, and so attentive to anything we needed. He didn't even mind as our party size kept changing (only 2 of the other 5 people in our party ended up making it and they showed up much later). The food was so good - we shared the Therapy's Crab Dip for a starter and it was the best one I've ever had anywhere. We ordered the "Big Sexy" burgers for our meal and those bad boys were juicy, scrumptious, and cooked to perfection. The bartenders nailed classic old-school cocktails and the overall ambiance of the restaurant is inviting and classy. I didn't get the name of the brunette hostess but she is such a wonderful first impression to this establishment. She and I spoke as she stood at her station outside in front of the restaurant while I stood outside to vape on and off throughout the evening. She answered questions I had about the restaurant and other random things we saw pass by and she was so adorable, sweet and professional. We were all impressed with Therapy for the amazing food, drinks and atmosphere, but it is their incredible staff that really made this an unforgettable experience for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you Jonathan &amp; crew for a memorable night at Therapy!

SsGdlpJss_nIGRrei7l9Tg.text: Down town Las Vegas needs more trendy places such as Therapy.   Really unique dishes that are well prepared and tasty.   Went back today.   I had the burger.  It was a bit on the salty side and also lacked something.  Maybe avocado or pickles or mayo or something.   Was not that good.   Some had the fried chicken sandwich.   They seemed to have enjoyed it.   Service was not bad.   However will have to lower rating to 3 due to the overly salty food.

rt3st7UUZdfT2h-2e7AXHQ.text: This tapas resturant has some pretty interesting dishes.. we got the chicken and and waffles, mac and cheese bites and knocked back a couple of brews. I was not blown away by the taste of these dishes, however the asthetics of the food was quite impressive.   The atmosphere here is pretty chill so I would say this is good spot to grab a drink to wind down from a busy day. Not a place you want to come in and really get your grub on.

I50DsGUuh0XScgcF5CiTHA.text: Located downtown, hip lively restaurant with a varied ethnically eclectic and diverse menu. Whimsical flavors touch Asian, New American, South American and the list goes on.  Variety of appetizers from chicken meatballs over a spicy fresh jalapeno pesto, chorizo empanadas, braised tofu over shishito peppers. Hubby had the braised short ribs over sun chokes- deep rich flavors tender beef.  I had the catch of the day, crispy salmon over farro, delish.  Hubby luved their signature cocktails; bartender brought us 2 samples of his concoctions, rum punch was good, mescal mixture was bad.  Decor is nice and open, great finishing touches. Open area acoustics is a bit noisy, while you're trying to have a quiet intimate dinner.  Service is friendly and attentive. You need reservations as they get pretty busy during the dinner rush. Street parking, hey it's old town

RBsgjJj4uHu4g_rtM694zg.text: Awful experience here, the service was SLOW, bartender was slammed and could get a drink out in maybe 20 mins and then the food was totally forgettable considering the hype! Granted it was during CES but they should've been prepared. It's not that big of place so really no excuse. Ordered the beef and it was literally cold when served, willing to give it another shot but epic fail. The empanadas were good but not worth the pain of the rest.

JpaScbsxXw_nC4G4ADPKfg.text: Came in for a late dinner. We were greeted by the host who seated us pretty quickly. The atmosphere was very loud and hectic(we did go on a Friday night around 8:00). It seemed like there was a party going on up stairs because there was constant yelling coming from a group of ladies.   The menu is very different from what I'm use to. There were many different items I had never heard of or tried.   We decided to try the DEVILS ON A HORSEBACK -Bacon Wrapped Dates Stuffed With Truffle Goat Cheese & Almonds on a bed of romesco.   We only ordered that item which was an appetizer and the server informed us it was going to take about 45 minutes to be ready. I didn't ready think it was worth waiting for but we wanted to try something new so we waited. When the appetizer arrived it was about 6 of the dates. The taste was sweet and then crunch from the bacon. The romesco sauce was very tasteful.   Over all the atmosphere wasn't my style and the wait time was way too long for some appetizers. I might give it another try to see if maybe at a different time it would be better.

nHGsss-3SXqGTqDOd0UTfw.text: What an amazing find in downtown Las Vegas! This place is terrific. We started with the chicken meatballs appetizer. For an entree, I had the chicken and red waffle slider. Spectacular dish, not to be missed. Love chicken and waffles, and this is among the best I've had. My dining companion had the signature salad with steak. Everything was delicious, and Yesenia provided attentive, friendly service. Go get some Therapy...you will not be disappointed. We will most definitely be back.

9K4IpMxLxBAulwibo7kVrw.text: I was so excited to try this place, the menu looked amazing.  We had a reservation for 16 people celebrating my husband's 40th birthday.  I know that a large group in Vegas is never going to be easy for the staff but our waiter was not on it.  Only half our drinks came out.  Took 30 minutes and a 2nd. request for the remaining drinks to arrive.  The waiter only asked half our group if they wanted appetizers.  All appetizers came out except mine, it arrived with my main meal.  All food was delivered except one. Her shrimp scampi arrived when everyone else was finishing. Then her noodles were not cooked.  They did comp her meal, thank you which we appreciate but the service was terribly disappointing. I've worked front of the house before,  I know it can be challenging. I tried to have patience but as the dinner progressed it just kept getting worse.

rrThus0YYSwFiT9H8wVXvg.text: My wife says that this is the best meal she has ever had in her life! Brandee, our waitress, was so helpful. The restaurants manager, Maria, was also very attentive to wife's special dietary needs and answered our son's questions regarding culinary details, as he is in culinary school and is researching local foodie venues. This our new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. It is well worth the trip to Fremont Street!

mJfPfZ1-A7ZLUDYjHXjaAw.text: Not impressed.  Food was not what you think it is.  It's 8pm and empty and now I see why.  The food choice was not what I expected.  When I order the Ricky Ricardo I was expecting a wow factor instead I received a plain pork sandwich with nothing inside except a few pieces of pork.  Much better places to go then here.  I would think twice on coming here.  I usually don't post this bad but for 30$ and food that was this bad I would not recommend.

94RDExQT8_HTx5Hs7VQj5g.text: What a great place to hang with friends. A wide array of culinary choices for palates of any kind. Our server, Michael, was extremely patient with our semi-obnoxious group... which we were very thankful for. He was helpful in suggesting drinks and meals for all of us. Ask for him!  The desserts were fantastic and it's got a cool atmosphere as well. We had the s'mores dessert and deconstructed carrot cake - highly recommended.  It's a block away from the Fremont Street walkway... A great downtown find!

Dk46jcAZWtibJ6lnoXBV8g.text: Service was comical at best. The bartender who never introduced herself had no hospitality experience. After 10 years in the industry, even at the busier of times I never was rude to customers.   The drinks are cheap which is a plus. Their $3 beer selection is amazing. However the food is way over priced. These are all I can put up with but the service.  Soon as I walked in, I was judged by mine and my guests appearance. Little did she know the financial standing he has. After everything, she would not take our order and eventually told us that we were too loud. It is March madness, and this is Vegas. She was well compensated and still very judgemental. I don't want to claim racism, however there was no other patrons of any ethnicity at the. I'm done.

P5qpEdUKTFXBk_Zs_fNKdg.text: I held a team dinner in the loft last week for 35 guests and the restaurant pulled it off flawlessly.  The service was impeccable, the space was perfect and the food was delicious - seriously, all 35 people loved the food...hard to do for a diverse group!  Our meal was served family style and we enjoyed in the gnudi, shrimp ceviche, Therapy's signature salad, Scottish salmon, sliced chimichurri steak, fire roasted corn, brussels sprouts, mac 'n cheese, s'mores and carrot cake.  It was an abundance of food, but worth every calorie!

dR44zCVpU5fFnPt_WegB3A.text: Pure delicious genius!  Flavor combinations you'll never imagine that just work, and work well!  You must eat here if you are near Fremont. If you're not near Fremont, make the trip. It's worth it!  We had the Devils on Horseback, Fried MAC Croquettes and Chicken and Red Velvet Waffles. Each better than the last. Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding was decadent. We've eaten at many Vegas high end venues and Therapy can compete with any of them.  Our server, Jonathan was personable and knowledgeable. Great job!

aZPvk0E0fGOOPFEN-7_tfQ.text: I really wanted to give Therapy a solid 5 star review after talking to the friendly bartenders and indulging in their Bourbon Mash cocktail. Things went a bit sideways after I ordered the filet. Flavor wise it was spot on, but the cook went about two steps past medium rare that I ordered. The filet came out medium with light pink in the middle and lots of grey on either side. It was such a shame as the spinach and potatoes it sat on we're great and the presentation was wonderful. 2 stars seems a bit harsh but given the sin of overcooking a filet I can't give Therapy more than 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sadly this is a way over cooked filet. I would have snapped a pic of how done it was but I didn&#39;t want to ruin the bartender&#39;s night.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Smash, bourbon with blackberries and mint.

I_MgyyT73CQAIGyOL_zfoQ.text: Came in for a quick bite...beautiful restaurant, delicious food, yummy sangria, but best of all was getting to know the wonderful and sweet bartender, Michael Great place! We will definitely be back when we are in Vegas again!!

6j9lhFi6w7m486569DYGaA.text: Awesome restaurant, wait staff is great, food is unbelievable, atmospheres amazing.  The Beef Carpaccio was great the bread comes with was amazingly good, the chorizo empanadas were bomb, loved the cooked ricotta,

WD1JYSbcSLkqvivQTCSjXA.text: I really think this place deserves 4 or 5 stars, our experience was bad but I can tell that the restaurant is a good place to eat.  A group of 6 of us went to eat there after walking up and down Fremont looking for food.  Right off the bat it looks like a cool place with a very hipstery vibe. We get seated right away and ordered drinks and food.  The drinks and appetizer came right out and everything was perfect.  Then we waited.  And waited. And waited.  Our conversations got quieter as we all realized it had been about an hour since we ordered and no food had arrived.  We were also staring at our empty glasses with our server nowhere in sight.  Long story short, we waited about 90 minutes for our food, but we did receive several apologies from our server, the manager and the food-runner along with a round of drinks from the manager.  The food was very good when it finally came out.  All in all, someone made a mistake (which happens) and we appreciated the effort that the people at Therapy made to make it right.  This was just a bad experience at a good restaurant.

Be2qqemKCAjJgg47yo7pUw.text: Everything about Therapy was outstanding! The food was amazing (pulled pork sliders and French dip). And you must order the gnudi!  Our drinks were refreshing on a hot Sunday evening!  Service was great!

k7uACp_ynOd-97dCZKWQvg.text: So. So. Good.  I recommend the Fried Mac n cheese and chicken meatballs as starters!  The BLT was bomb.  But let's talk desserts! Our group had the white chocolate cheese cake.  Awesome.  The smore w Bacon.... Holy bananas amazing.  And then the crumbled carrot cake with browned butter ice cream and cream cheese frosting.  Good thing nobody's mama was around or she woulda been slapped.  I highly recommend this joint.

eEJ4p12A364o-ZFGwcMXlQ.text: This might just be my new favorite place downtown. Love the ambiance and love the food even more. Service was on point as well. If your a food enthusiastic like me, your going to love this place.

DMe5jTvak5oJbYcep9OtPg.text: A return visit.  I greatly enjoyed Therapy on two previous trips, and I was enthusiastic to return.  This time was no different.  Great food (mac and cheese croquettes, empanadas, and street corn). We loved it all.  The croquettes were very good but what put it over the top was the tomato and bacon jam.  It was like a very thick barbecue sauce with the saltiness and smokiness of the bacon.  The street corn was fantastic, with grill marks and a finger licking lime aioli.  Lots of cocktail options.  I think the beer offering, both tap and bottles, was not as strong as previous visits.  They seemed to have moved away from craft brews.

eobymLNgp-ojw2PDqHKeQQ.text: Alright! Food was bomb. We had the portobello burger and the Cuban sandwich. Drinks were fancy and delicious. I love mixology drinks! Bartender was really nice and funny, we were greeted the second we walked in the door. I love fremont and I love this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food was so good! Portobello burger on the right, Cuban sandwich on the left.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks were amazing

DVkb-e9mXJbgRz33VzOC1A.text: I ordered the chicken and waffle slider and oh my gosh!!! Very delicious, light and very tasty with awesome flavor combinations. My server Johnathan was right on the money with prompt, courteous service.  This is a great place to eat.

OB_7nDTMr5zc5BESFmfB6w.text: Absolutely the best meal we had in Vegas. I happened to have my 6 month old with me and they were so accommodating with her stroller and giving us something for her to snack on during the meal. They went the extra mile. The meal was amazing. The tuna tartar we are still talking about! Worth the trip to Freemont just for this place. Hope they are still operating when I make it to Vegas again

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bCwF8Yw8U3QApOz48y4mOg.text: Pleasantly surprised with the chef's creative menu. At the waitresses suggestion I ordered the duck medium rare and it was tender and flavorful with a delightful sauce with hints of berries, there were even pomegranate seeds hiding in the root vegetable side medley. The waffle/chicken was enjoyed by the adult kids and the salmon with capers and olive topping by my husband. The s'mores dessert arrived with bubbling marshmallows.  I wouldn't order the carrot cake, it was more of a crumb cake over ice cream.

f24_jh2hsudO8kcXxtzb_w.text: I brought my wife to Vegas for an anniversary celebration and we decided to head downtown, which I hadn't visited in ~15 years.  It's definitely got a different vibe than it used to, spanning the range from high-tech hipsters to almost-naked panhandlers.  We had seen high reviews for Therapy on Yelp so headed in.  We sat at the bar and very much enjoyed Shannon's wit and highly-competent service.  My wife (a vegetarian) and I (a committed carnivore) both found many options and were thrilled with everything we ordered, including far more dessert than two fairly healthy people ought consume in one sitting.  Great food and vibe, highly recommended!

ftT8HrOJHjeLwJKndUohIg.text: Found on yelp and decided to try.  I am glad I did, had the pork chop for dinner, it was amazing, served with mustard mashed potatoes.  The chop was cooked just right, great flavor.  I am on the fence with the mashed, they were ok, I am not a big mustard fan so take that with a grain of salt.  Mike came by and asked how things were, him and the entire state were very friendly.  I returned about an hour later and he recognized me, I told him I was back for the carrot cake.  He got one for me to go, got back to hotel and it was increadable.  The ice cream had great flavor, the cake was very tasty.  Only wish it has raisens, but that is nitpicking.  Will definitely be back.

ZvZzSTyHoZBzXoYh4RdDlg.text: Michael is the best server!  Amazing food and service as always, one of the absolute best spots downtown! Great for a quick lunch or a fancy dinner.

P_0mQfzVs77pUuqUVSWZVA.text: This place is great. The ambience and food are on point. It's refreshing to see a nice and upscale venue like this open in downtown.   The only thing I would like to see improving is the food portion is a bit small for the price being charged.   The best part of about this place is that it turns into an unltra lounge at 11:00 PM which makes this place a great choice to grab a drink.  The resident dj puts together great sets of music to compliment the ambience of the venue. All of us have thoroughly enjoyed our time here because of this new change.   Take a visit, you'll love the food, drinks, ambience, especially the music.   **I particularly don't understand why certain reviews would even complain about the good music being played here. It's Downtown Las Vegas, without good music, why even bother?! #HatersAreGoingToHate

PCmeecH69Zt_sxTA0YgJxg.text: Wow what an amazing restaurant!  From the moment you walk in its a great experience.  I would highly recommend making a reservation, as word gets out this place is going to be huge!   We are from Kelowna BC Canada and we're just there last week for a friend birthday and so glad we went.  The food was exceptional, well priced and the staff was amazing.  Watching the chef check each plate before it left the kitchen to attentive wait staff and Managment, they never skipped a beat.  I would highly recommend you give this place a try I guarantee you'll back time and time again.    Good work Therapy we wish you much success!!!!  Diana and Luis Santos Kelowna, BC

nHMRKM505aAC0i5h0qXbig.text: The food is very therapeutic! We had the BLT, mac and cheese croquettes, and brussels. All of it was so good. Delicious drinks too! And the service by Joann was superb! We'll definitely be back!

Ut0XXfe-lzTK7gcX6Q168Q.text: I visited couple weeks ago I was visiting from outta town and heard this place was good based off other yelp reviews so I gave it a try I can honestly say it was good and i recommend I'll be returning and my sever was great too thanks Chantay

AEu8QOxqWCdIBpIjmfQhmw.text: Great great great find Downtown! Food, ambiance, service. Perfection. We are locals and this was a nice surprise
