Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates, chicken and short ribs

OiPX_Qq2VSM7AXNfKzN-pA.text: We are Las Vegas locals and always try to support new businesses. We decided to head to Therapy in DTLV. Welcomed immediately. Jenna made the most perfect drink. Dirty beer. Absolutely perfect. Ordered popcorn....fried paprika peanuts and maple candied bacon. What? Bacon and popcorn and peanuts???

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a sneak peak of the menu :). Try this place.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinking the most amazing dirty beer. Thanks Jenna.

A4j7zdcto1riDi_IaVqiEA.text: Went to Therapy for a late lunch with the family.  When you pass through the front front door the place has a very cool vibe.  Our server/bartender Todd was the best.  Not only was he quick to attend to our requests, he was very personable.  He easily exceeded expectation when asked about the draft beer selection.  The food was great was great.  Ask Todd about his tattoos.  It was truly a memorable experience.  Will will definitely go back the next time we are in Vegas.

SrLnJyYTigN2mI-wCdKrQg.text: Great food!!! Chelsea was amazing... we weren't sure what to get and she guided us through the menu and helped us all pick the perfect dinner for our individual pallets. I will definitely come back and ask to sit in her section. Jason greeted us upon arrival and made sure we were comfortable while waiting for the rest of our party. Great live music.. wonderful atmosphere

kd-UN6wH2iUAG7sx1kkB9w.text: Therapy is wonderful! The atmosphere is great- casual and modern, great for a date or a family dinner. I ordered the filet frites and the waiter brought out the chocolate cake, carrot cake, and smores for my family. All three of the desserts were amazing and the service and pace of service were perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D45USJLbg4nbgq3fhd7gPQ.text: This place was awesome.  The food was awesome,  we tried 5 or so of the small plates and appetizers as well as the Cuban and a salad.  The drinks were good and not weak.  I will definitely go back.

UfAGuurELb3pGIwxsGA6Mg.text: Loved this place! A friend recommended Carson Kitchen, but, when we got there, they were closed for a private event. One of the staff recommended we try Therapy. So glad we did. The menu was terrific, and it was hard to choose what we wanted. My husband got the Ricky Ricardo and I had the filet. Both were delicious!! Our server Brandee did a fantastic job. I'll definitely return when I'm back in Las Vegas.  Thanks for a great experience.

4ikYGHwN4-eNaEviVB3plw.text: Just ok for me, seemed overpriced, but not high end enough coming out of the kitchen, not bad, but just ok.  Beers great, service ok, ambeance better than most, feels like a brew pub with formal tables for dinner on the side....is it therapy....for some im sure, but i will say this, the drinks are cold and the seat is plush.....drinks only...pass on the dinner...maybe some appetizers..your call either way.   Average.

0iGCtWKdIDIu81F-Aqp7gw.text: Great food best service in town... Waitress Chelsea was the best...hostess friendly can't remember her name... Bartender came to table to check on cocktails can't be beat a must for anyone in Vegas... Chicken and waffles.... Mac Cheese croquets were fantastic... A hidden gem.

DJMzaVVXOIG-hzMM5NFDCg.text: I ordered the chicken meatball and it was not good at all. On top of that, the service was horrendous. I sat down and waited at least half an hour for a server to come by. Only two appetizers were ordered and that took over an hour. They did notice and gave us free appetizers so that's why I didn't give it one star. I was expecting really good food here because of the reviews and I was sorely disappointed, and it wasn't the terrible service that makes me say that. I wouldn't come here again.

wd3ewMkV3tBHI63ylO8l-g.text: After a bad first experience, I was contacted immediately by the management team to talk about the problems, and was invited back in to give it a second chance with a guest. I appreciated the quick follow up, and of course was willing to go back and see how they could turn it around.   My friend and I who were there the first time came back in for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon at 12:30pm, and the 2nd time around was 100x better than the last (of course). It wasn't very busy, but our food came out very quickly, which I'm sure was not a coincidence since that was a huge complaint of mine last time. We each started with a salad, I with the charred kale and poached egg, and she with the caesar. We split the pretzel appetizer- the cheese mustard sauce is AMAZING. We split the side of mac n cheese (with bacon on the side for her, which was successful in execution this time), and then were surprised with FOUR desserts that came out. The fresh sorbets were a delight, I believe they were cherry, key lime, and passion fruit. The popular s'more cast iron skillet was among them, which was far too sweet for me, but she liked. The decomposed carrot cake with cream cheese frosting and brown butter ice cream was a pleasant surprise for me, and made a great breakfast the next day! The manager ALSO brought a chocolate ganache torte type ensemble out in a to go box, which was really just indulgent and over the top, but we appreciated the effort and it did get eaten a couple days later :)   The food was much better, the service was great, and we had a chance to chat with the chef and management. Of course it was a comp meal, but not everyone makes the effort to remedy a bad dining experience, and they really went above and beyond to make sure we had a good time the 2nd time around, and the VP of Ops even followed up that afternoon with a phone call. Now THAT's hospitality.

JpsjZI4yyhH48houlpgrqA.text: Walked in on a whim and had one of the best meals I've had in years. We sampled the baked ricotta gnudi, filet tartar and Ricky Ricardo Cuban sandwich. All phenomenal and in large, shareable portions. The service was also super conscientious and attentive. If you're in the mood to imbibe, I'd also recommend the Paloma. So tasty. Definitely therapy for a couple Strip-weary out-of-towners.

xKyHQxbJuRg8N2yTzSo7oQ.text: Amazing dinner, amazing service from Georgie and the independent wine selection is great. I love the atmosphere as it reminds me of trendy restaurants from back home in Manhattan.   If it comes back on the menu I recommend the rib eye with the red onion jam and the chicken jidori was bursting with flavor that will arouse the senses!

L1RNm5eZXbtBy0YfvZxO3w.text: The Big Sexy burger was awesome. Great balance of sweet, salty and meaty. Would definitely keep this place in mind. Higher prices than most places around but a welcome new addition to the block.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BlCzJC6coeBO6EsVAQe41A.text: Shanon and Blake were awesome bartenders. Totally took care of our food and drink needs. I highly recommend this place if you're downtown in Vegas!

jKWQ_xfuB-C2_FzmUaC0yw.text: We were very dissapointed with this restaurant after reading the reviews and eating there. We ended out eating the oxtail empanadas, the Caesar salad, and the crab dip. The empanadas were ok. They were deep fried which i do not like and they were served with a tasteless mayonaise type sauce.  The Caesar dressing on the salad was good but the salad has so much dressing on it. A good salad is not drenched with dressing. The crab dip was ok. They serve it with tortilla chips that were soggy not crispy. We asked for them to be replaced which they did with much better crispy ones but then they charged us for an extra order of chips. The service was also with unfriendly wattresses except for one of them. All in all we were very dissapointed with everything and we would not recommend it.

m1z00DWCtLPHYA7O-MbETA.text: After waiting 1 and 1/2 hours at Le Thai across the street and their flippant attitude towards us when they couldn't figure out their own list we walked across the street and were treated graciously and efficiently. A totally different atmosphere...fun staff and great food. Thank you for rescuing our date night!!

HDldbp-UlpnUz4Bsovn8hA.text: The food was great.. I was with a group of 4 so we ordered many different plates. Service was perfect! Definitely a upscale hipster place. The atmosphere was nice and lively with some really cool works of art around the place.

vm-vuaKbNcqqn-v_lLEJBw.text: This place was awesome.... The Empanadas Trio was amazing...The Poke was fresh and had tons of flavor....and the Chimichurri  Steak was tender and full of flavor....great beer selection...very helpful staff...and great atmosphere

wyFwoHrDefRu8rIrrpkfJA.text: Was crazy excited to try this place. I'm actually curious as to how people have raved about it. The French fries seem like potatoes from a freezer bag, the burger is just.. Well a burger. The flat bread, oh lord why is it so dry and boring?  Wish this place had more quality food. Service was ok though nothing memorable but nothing to really Complain about

9D_pl71r2KvPjCADP9Mz1w.text: Great food and Michael was a fabulous waiter! The empanadas were amazing. I personally loved the chorizo but all three kinds were delicious.

RFdE8SIHAfqahiuL8nR6nA.text: Love the food here! And the drinks! And the service! We had Brandee tonight and she was SO accommodating and had an awesome personality. Too fun. Definitely coming back.

dB-ZcKjIE5-TgsDX6LSt1Q.text: Friendly staff. Great food. Try the mac and cheese croquettes it is bomb!!!! Kim was our bartender/waitress and she was amazing!!

pgtqNgS-8l4D0dZ5_y5Pmg.text: Finally! A good experience in this joint! I think it took 5 visits and a couple years.......but it was worth it. Got tired of eating at all the normal spots I go to in the neighborhood and decided I'd give this place 5 or 6th shot (lost count) the management reached out several times and graciously invited me back in, but I went in on my own and everything was a 180 from my previous visits. I'll happily be making this a regular spot moving forward! Food was always in point, but the service finally matched that.

NiaxuGuT-cokI6jU8qys9Q.text: We had a fun, wonderful meal here. The food was well presented and prepared. My husband is a chef and he ate every bite of his chicken and mashed potato entree. The corn side dish and the carrot cake are to die for. The best part of the evening was our server: Georgie. She was so nice and her recommendations were spot on for our tastes. The service was excellent. We will return on our next trip.

ORr5mErIl3ZDtMrmxvGBTw.text: Funky and fresh. Great innovative food. Off the beaten path and worth the trip. Menu changes daily and the service was good.

cGcDylZhxxjZexKyYLKRcw.text: Get the fried chicken sandwich it's awesome. Get the Manhattan cocktail not to sweet not to over powering. You will enjoy your time at therapy.

ax_VVj0Ae3Qql-pFaOnrSA.text: This place was great and the service was AMAZING!!!! I had the chicken and red velvet waffle sliders, and they were phenomenal. Our server, Jonathan Thomas, made the experience even better. He was very attentive and knowledgable of the menu. When in Vegas, I definitely recommend going to Therapy!!!

W_YDAM_-SrA29xFbhUhepw.text: Therapy is a gastropub tapas restaurant Downtown Las Vegas just a very short walk from the Fremont Experience. Our server Georgie was awesome! So nice and attentive! Check out this place great location and great atmosphere! Ask for Georgie. She ROCKS!

3tuhvDo7vqYN9ffPdrxS7w.text: First time. Great lunch! Fantastic service with Julie! Had the Brussels sprouts for an appetizer, the Ricky Ricardo sandwich and carrot cake for desert. Absolutely delicious!!!

_TU-3a8paQAsgBCUVhdqfw.text: Stopped by this spot for a quick bite to eat and was pleasantly surprised at the place.  Super clean, professional,  and great service.   The food was much better than I would have expected,  and the prices reasonable.   We split the French dip and Ox tail empanads and a pair of beers. Under $40.   The attention to detail in the food presentation and the service move this from 4 star to 5 star.  Our server, Jonathan,  was excellent.     The music was great, and overall a vibe which is relaxing.   The people watching through the window is great entertainment.    Will be back for sure.  Great job gang...!

b89j-SM4GlJ1EHhjzNyNdA.text: Stop. BOOM! Done. The food alone is the best quality and value in Vegas. The kitchen and bar is scratch, down to the bloody Mary mix. They even support your specific taste of a fried egg in a sandwich or adding pickles to things, without overcharging you. The food will keep u coming back, but Todd, the bartender will leave you wanting to tell everyone you know about this place. Todd took my taste for chartruce to a whole new level and customized a drink that instantly became my go to favorite. Without a doubt, the best restaurant downtown, and for me any where near Lad Vegas Blvd.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail empanadas?!?!?! Ya, that&#39;s what I said. Oxtail freaking empenadas!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KM8uG9hIjsojVXWXmineCQ.text: The food and drinks here were very good.  I had the St. Therapy to drink which was made with Therapy's own signature whiskey.  To eat I had the sliced chimichuri steak and the loaded mash, both were delicious.  The place was clean and very open.  There is not a lot of seating so making a reservation ahead of time is a good idea.  I would definitely go here again and recommend it to friends.

kfJ90kgKEbG8HXDyq2S8NQ.text: There's a lot of generic, a lot of crap, and a lot of generic crap in downtown LV, especially on the Fremont St. corridor. But not at Therapy, which is original and very enjoyable. The space has very high ceilings with some industrial ductwork and also cool wood-plank ceilings. It feels airy and fun and can handle a lot of sound without becoming unpleasantly noisy. Had the house salad with greens, apples, bleu cheese, walnuts and big slices of thin radish. It was big enough for a meal in itself, but not knowing that, I also ordered the barramundi sliders. Tasty toasted buns and pan-seared fish chunks with a tangy zing--something you can't get just anywhere. Francisco at the bar was all over it and made me a really tasty gin cocktail with a nice balance of citrus and botanical. I'd definitely come back and if you're looking for something more than just greasy bar food downtown, give Therapy a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barramundi sliders

E31b6YuRgdO66ZI6w3n-1w.text: We sat at the bar and just had drinks... though I scoped out some of our neighbor's plates and HOT DANG! That shiz looked straight up deloyshis! :)  Anyway, absolutely recommend the Elder-Melon sangria--super refreshing and not too sweet. Bar service was incredible; special shout out to Blake who was attentive, personable, and just all around awesome. Thank you for an awesome visit!  We will come back on our next visit FOR SURE!

MZZo7Ghxw4VRUN1nk2Jcgw.text: Bartender was super friendly! Full of great information about where to go, what to check out.   Friends got the chicken fried chicken sub and raved about it.  Would definitely come back - time and the again.

3mV38Kr4fFgNbhLz6m2bIg.text: This place is fancy. We ordered the $22 meat and cheese appetizer called The Perfect Cure. If you like to play with your very fancy food and get away with it, do this. We were making walnut-cranberry crostini sandwiches with bri and spicy moustard, dipped weird little pickled beets in an apple jam and spent a lot of time saying, "Hmm, what the heck is this?" It was fun but a little pricy for a sharable app for 2.   The drinks were great, we had the Devils Eyes; a mint and absynthe tasty frozen drink. These bartenders are seriously professionals. They were practically dancing they were so busy but did their job with focus and accuracy.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Perfect Cure. Super fancy.

vZup9pnZIXfxI4Fj07wmig.text: This is the first review I've ever written on Yelp. I have made suggestions on what to order at different places before but never a review.          My wife and I were out site-seeing and stumbled upon Therapy. It was later in the evening so we only had to wait a couple of minutes for a table, it looks like it stays pretty busy, I would suggest a reservation. Joy was our waitress, she was helpful, fun, and quick. Make sure you request her, you'll think me later.          We ate the Mac and Cheese Croquette, that we're suggested by Joy, and they're the bomb. We also ordered the Braised Ribs and Chimichurri Steak but couldn't decide which was better, but after licking the plates the Chimichurri may have taken prize.          We'll probably go back tomorrow for round 2. Call me crazy but Therapy could actually be a reason to move to Vegas. Ha, see what I did there "Therapy & crazy".  GOOD EATS!!!   Bon ap

0y3c2wgAWthUKOFPXYekng.text: Service, service, SERVICE! Joanne was on point with lots of suggestions. Never let the water go dry without crowding us. She gets five stars!! Loved the fried mac and cheese and the Ricky Ricardo sandwich. The sangria was delish! Will be back.

O895LMVu_t34NgW2wf-opw.text: I had three girlfriends from Arkansas in town for a gun show -- two named Gina and one pageant queen, and they wanted to go to dinner downtown. I chose this spot based on friends' recommendations. I thought it was OK, but nothing to get excited about.  The ambiance is Big City Hipster  -- exposed ductwork, painted brick walls, a sort of upstairs dining loft above the main floor. The vibe is bustling and noisy, the air thick with clanking cutlery and snarky witticisms. Service was great and the crowd was attractive.  Food-wise, you might say I didn't try enough stuff to give it a fair review. I had a burger, which was alright but unexciting, plus a side of Brussels sprouts (shut up, I can pair whatever I want) which were fantastic. One of the Ginas had a flatbread sort of pizza thing which was also kinda meh. So considering that 2 out of the 3 things I tried were meh...I just don't feel an urgency to come back here.  I mean, I spent $35 -- for that, I could have gone to Chipotle three times, and experienced three times the exposed ductwork and snarky witticisms. Yawn!

h3y2HJL_yIFnoei68ws8DA.text: We randomly came here to eat on a Thursday night.  For starters, everyone was pleasant, from the hostess to waitresses to bartender. I decided to order three appetizers and a salad for the table to share.  The crab dip and oxtail empanadas were delicious to say the least. Both were cooked to perfection where they had a slightly crispy exterior. However, the crab dip was an amazing consistency to the point it was velvety, while the oxtail inside the empanadas gave a tender, buttery filling. As for the salad (we got the Therapy Signature) it was fresh, tasty, and oh so colorful!  The only disappointment was the "In the Gnudi." It's an appetizer with baked ricotta and toasted walnut bread with some fancy sauces included. However, it was too sweet, especially as an appetizer. It seemed much more fitting as a luxury dessert of some sort, so we didn't finish the plate.   Small note: The restaurant was loud (like really really loud) to the point where we couldn't hear each other across the small table. I am not sure if it was just the spot we sat in, but if you end up going for a date night, you might want to ask the hostess for a spot that is quieter.

O0iKymGu6Yj0Mw6Lf5z_ZQ.text: Oxtail empanada 5/5 Chicken meatballs 5/5 Charred carrots 3/5  (maple is overpowering) Charred Kale Salad 3/5 (didn't understand the egg on top.  char was a bit too heavy.)

6DVBZBulHYaFAQJSbhTwhQ.text: I was here with a party of 6 Saturday, June 4th around 8:30pm to celebrate my birthday and staff was amazing!! We hung out at the bar since there was a 20-30min wait (we didn't have a reservation). Shannon and Blake were our bartenders and they really made our wait time go fast! Hostess, bartenders, and our waitress were all so welcoming and really helped make us feel oh so special. Hands down the best service in downtown!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our hostess was awesome!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blake and Shannon were awesome!

-vk3T2fBmPT7LyjZGKWVCQ.text: We had the pleasure of enjoying dinner with our friends last night, absolutely amazing! The staff was very attentive, we enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates, the chicken dish was very good, short ribs is a must to try, pork chop was a huge portion and cooked to perfection. And you must save room for desert!

dntz447CCVHtuJvflzpOQQ.text: I am at Therapy on Fremont Street in Las Vegas. The food is excellent!  Industrial vibe interior.  See my friend Joe's review it is more eloquent. Our servers CHANTEY and SPENCER were attentive and social.   I highly recommend a visit to this establishment.

7vIzJqADtwxcABxTXYMZjw.text: Great food. Great customer service. I even met with the General Manager who has such a wonderful perspective on the restaurant and the hospitality industry in general. With such a leader, it is no wonder Therapy is doing so well!

XIg9EpavxkOfxlkz563plg.text: The ambiance is very trendy and staff was accommodating and welcoming.   We had the oxtail empanada for appetizer and it was on point. Crispy crust,  with well seasoned oxtail very juicy!!  For main entree, we got the mac and cheese with bacon and the sexy burger. The mac and cheese serving was a lot for brunch size, which was good. The burger was juicy and flavorful.  You really can't go wrong with wagyu beef.   We also got 2 drinks: the mango lychee sangria and melon sangria. Both refreshing and not too strong.   I'd like to go back again, and hopefully they'll start serving deep fried pig ears and cheese corn again. Those 2 were the one that attracted me to go here when I was checking yelp reviews but found out they're not serving it anymore.

n8LGEefdU9qzG1gsArmGjQ.text: Went to Therapy last night recommended, by Carson's Kitchen (excited to go there tonight) we had to make a show at the Golden Nugget so we had limited time. We did not have reservations but the two hostesses we extremely accommodating sat the two of us right away up front which was fun. The waiter Rene' was the absolute best! Very helpful, personal, and tons of fun.  Therapy's drinks were amazing mostly bourbon bases with their own smoked version - they brought us a sample it was real smooth with a simple bite at the end and the bottle is gorgeous!  Our food was spectacular the best we have had in Vegas - but that is not really giving it proper merit. The food was superb really have not been impressed with Vegas food until Therapy. The Crab Dip was out of this world good and Fried MAC Croquette with the tomato bacon jam was incredible!  Now back to the drinks, I enjoyed The Smash so much that the hostess let me meet the bartender Michael who taught me how to muddle the berries and mint and make the drink for myself and yes they gave me that one on the House!  The best dinning overall experience I have had in a long time - looking forward to going back this time with reservation or to just sit at the bar to work my way through the drink menu and to have some of their own bourbon! Way to go Therapy!

V5Yg2Qr8HY_jCu-bRqIzTA.text: The best lunch ever. Here is my list of must try items. The French Dip with truffle fries was so good, the Ceviche, empanadas, cauliflower.  The best dessert ever was the Carrot Cake. Don't let the way it looks fool you. Everything listed above was amazing.

daMxBKY7jepVu-HIl8C-VQ.text: Best Therapy ever!! Therapy's crab dip, Ali"s Ahi Tuna & Mac & Cheese Croquettes were amazing!! Robert was the best waiter! Great service

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jxS4l5UxoTsiFvDas6s8PQ.text: Finding good food in Vegas is much more difficult than it should be.  Therapy, though, is a fantastic addition to the burgeoning food scene in downtown.  The Scottish salmon was perfectly cooked, and the chicken meatballs were quite tasty.  Our server, Michael, was as fabulous as the food he served us.

CYhTChb1Kez6fDVPxe9QTQ.text: i give this restaurant a 10 for fantastastic best food best service in vegas.. i would go there again and a again   lori

7J8EKFWxIt56DwMYjVFYxg.text: Stopped in for lunch today after finding it on Yelp. What a great find! Our waitress Joann was very attentive and friendly. I had the Cuban sandwich with truffle fries. I'm from Florida and have had my fair share of Cubans. This was one of the best I've had. Juicy pork, excellent seasoning, and yummy house made pickles. My friend had the Caesar salad and fried mac & cheese. Omg the mac and cheese were amazing! The combination of the spicy aioli and red pepper remoulade was phenomenal. If I weren't pregnant I would have definitely enjoyed a few cocktails but, well, I am, so water only for me. I'll definitely recommend to others visiting Vegas!

l3wYXPlKgnlMQupbMhklsA.text: Food was delicious! Highly recommend the Risotto, creamy with hints of butternut squash. Best I've ever had, hands down!

Bv6CN8seMzKhDpou7wUDKQ.text: Great experience all around!! Jonathon our waiter was great!! Prompted, and made great suggestions! Drinks and food were on point. Highly recommend the chicken meatballs, Caesar salad, and the strip steak with chimi churri. They had a dessert special chocolate pudding, freeze dried raspberries was a great way to finish off the meal!  Make sure to ask for Jonathon

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

awU5A6zBsg657R8JTVmQaA.text: [Need Therapy]  There's soo many newer local restaurants to take advantage of in the Fremont East District and Therapy has been on my to do list.   Took my sis to lunch Monday 2.20.17  I ordered:  Therapy's Crab Dip: Omg this dip arrived sizzling and didn't disappoint my taste buds. This dip was so delicious and I enjoyed the Parmesan taste. Must order!!!   Super Mac: Another great choice! The mac was moist and full of flavor.  Caesar Salad: I typically don't use black pepper but it was a great addition to the Caesar and I devoured this salad bread and all!!  Therapy's Catch MP Salmon: $35 was a bit expensive in my opinion but it was delicious and cooked perfectly.   Carrot Cake: Great presentation and even better tasting. Definitely the best dessert I've had in a while.   I was a little disappointed Street Corn was out of season but I shall return soon for more deliciousness!!!  $100 later I'm satisfied

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super Mac
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Caesar

2s5i5cp7X1vUzRS3oNCPJw.text: We came here for early dinner on Saturday. Fremont Street was blocked off for a classic car show giving it a festive air. Parking at a pay-by-phone alley right behind the building was easy. We started with shrimp ceviche & chips (a bit too tangy for me) and roasted beets salad accompanied by cold Therapy Duck LV IPA. The Chimichurri flat iron steak was done just right; tender and juicy. The brick chicken was moist and tasty. The battered fried chicken & red waffle looked pretty but wasn't as crispy as expected. The charred Brussel sprouts was tasty, albeit somewhat over-seasoned. Our server Mike provided high caliber service. Overall it was an enjoyable dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Pr8EfTqug5YgUoyQk9TQRw.text: Great food, great atmosphere and great service. We were in a rush and our server totally understood, she got us in and out in about 35 minutes. I would go back again!

VDx9LsASp55XQUvSnyr1Xw.text: I can't say enough about how wonderful the food is at Therapy Gastropub.  My family and friends ate here Friday night (8/10).  The service was wonderful and the food superb. The brussel sprouts and street corn were so good my husband asked for the recipe. The signature salad was yum and the meat (I got steak well done) was tender and full of flavor. The chicken and red velvet waffles were a brilliant mix of sweet and savory. The shrimp civeche was delicious and full of shrimp.  We shared a couple of servings of the banana bread pudding (served with chocolate, whipped cream, caramel, slices  of banana, and banana sorbet). It was delicious!   The food at Therapy has interesting flavor pairings that you don't find everywhere else. That's a shame because they worked beautifully.  Not one of the 12 people at our dinner had a complaint about our experience. I highly recommend Therapy!

pugWkUX0LO9c4Ryy2UjD5Q.text: Hit up Therapy last night with 6 family guests. Two were young-ish kiddos. Our waiter Michael was OUTSTANDING in his service and care making the group comfortable that they would get food they liked and were comfortable with - NOT always easy with children. BUT...he absolutely nailed it and we all had such a good, satisfying, and happy meal!! I already loved the place, but after last night it has risen to one of my favorites in Vegas!!! Thank you Therapy and thank you Michael for such a great night!

GoYCMLpg81K6dOlkSnz-rQ.text: Shoutout to Michael our server. Great service, even better food! Ps: the s'mores with bacon was delicious.

fxKcW6MvntXvFIRVRxkx4g.text: The food was excellent. If we lived in Vegas it would definitely be a hangout for my hubby and I.

_FPPQS1HICe2jRI5UXZc0g.text: Worst service,  waited almost 40 mins for our food. Sat at table the entire time without offer of new drinks.  Food was not too bad. But service was terrible Michael never even bothered to let us know the food was taking so long, never check on us.  He didn't even deliver the food and never stopped by to ask how everything was.  Finally flagged down a manager and told us of our dissatisfaction and bought us a free round of drinks and a desert.   Don't think I will return or recommend

BxgugBOdyLon1r3CxJvn_A.text: This was a truly awesome experience. I made a reservation here on Yelp, came in and was seated right away. The vibe is fun and lively, although a little too bright. Our server (Berto?) was excellent. He was very attentive and friendly and did not rush us. We had a few signature cocktails that were great, and ordered about a million different menu items! Their menu is just really awesome and we wanted to try everything! My favorite items were definitely "In the Gnudi" which is baked ricotta and it was so unique and truly AMAZING, and the s'mores dessert which was exactly what you'd expect and SOOO yummy. We also really liked the drunken tofu, the texture of the tofu was right on point, it was just slightly crispy on the outside and not greasy at all. The shrimp lettuce cups and Korean bao buns were less memorable. And the heirloom tomato and burrata salad was standard but quite good and refreshing. This place is definitely a hidden gem downtown and I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores dessert OMG!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom tomato burrata salad
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In the Gnudi

u0YA-S9AePppYBxca5KHyw.text: Therapy session will now commence. If it is an individual or group therapy session, this Downtown Vegas establishment will pull you out of what ever rut you are in. The vibe is comfortable and chromed in shades of blacks and whites, Therapy should always be without many distractions- remember focus on letting go. The service is friendly and the live music really puts one into a pleasurable mood.   On my visit, a friend asked me to join last minute and we sat, drank, ate and conversed in a therapeutic fashion. I ordered the Smash which was a great cocktail of berries and bourbon. I liked it so much that I medicated myself with two! My meal of choice was the Red Velvet Waffles and Chicken Sliders. Seriously, you can't make this stuff up. It truly exists! It was so comforting, so yummy and yes... So theraputic.   Therapy is one of those great Downtown Vegas restaurants with a great vibe and good food. I will definitely be back to Therapy either as an individual or group session!

7bXiSf6FG89yQUMpaoCiBA.text: Came to Therapy for the afc/nfc championship and the staff was incredible.  Our bartender Elizabeth was very accommodating and was super busy at the same time.  This place is awesome, if you ask for Elizabeth she will en-suite your experience is amazing!  Thank you Elizabeth and thank you Chris for fixing the tv!  Go Saints!

pdmh8PmgoaqiW_NAQeC4IQ.text: Another night of alcoholic revelry with friends in town in need for grub and thankfully, football.  If anyone in need of therapy, it dis Monkey...  GMonkey do:  CHIMICHURRI STEAK- nothing short of phenomenal!  Having shared each others plates, this, hands down was the best. I'm jealous I didn't order it for myself.  SHORTY Buh Buh BRRaised Short Rib- Ace King:  look great, but not a winner. Anticipating greatness, THicK meat need to be cooked slower, longer. This was a bit dry. So disappointed.  BIG SEXY Wagyu Burger- delicious!    Monkey walked by large table of ten. Several plates of Chimichurri Steak. The obvious winner here.  Returning just for this, is an easy decision. Great service, clean and plenty of room for large parties.

sTtihdHjNdvANjJznMPNAw.text: What a pleasant surprise. We decided to Visit the Fremont Street Experience to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and decided that we would go without dinner reservations and see what we could discover. Came across this place and what a nice experience! The staff is extremely friendly and our waiter was top notch. The food was delicious and affordable. We both had the flat iron steak and it was cooked perfectly to our specifications. The Brussel sprouts are to die for. Highly recommend!

MlD9oPF-GTYZgNNqMOutdg.text: You know what? I don't have 1 single bad thing to say about this place. You can make reservations, the wine list- had my fav Riesling and JONATHAN the server was superb!! The food was elegant ,plentiful and DELICIOUS. The atmosphere was trendy and comfy. I would recommend & plan to come back myself very soon.

CZijHNLs5MbsxNlIOnVaWw.text: This place gets a 5 star for food, which was the best food I had in Las Vegas, and a 4 star for ambiance, so more like 4.5 stars for me! We had made a reservation on a Monday at 9 pm, but went there at 7:30 ish. The place was relatively empty (hence the 4 star for ambiance, although may be I shouldn't expect much from a restaurant in Fremont street on a Monday) and we were seated immediately.   The food was great!! We had the brussel sprouts, the fire roasted street corn, and the chimichurri steak. We didn't get any drinks and the total without the tip was $53.04. The brussel sprouts was out of this world!!! I really liked it! In fact, I wish I could have some this very minute! The corn was also great! The steak was also quite good, not as incredible as the other two, but still quite good! I highly recommend this place!  Oh, and our server Gloria was super polite and friendly! I felt like she is vicariously enjoying the food with every bite we take! Thank you Gloria!!

IWr5SY4SoxWFEqMRsvRVLw.text: My friend and I decided to try this place out to get off the strip. After reviewing many menus we decided Therapy looked the most promising. Boy were we happy we chose this restaurant! It has got to be the best and most underpriced meal I've had in Vegas! I had the Scottish salmon and it was melt-in-your-mouth perfection. Her chicken dish was to die for, as was our Korean-inspired appetizers. Seriously if you don't try this place you are missing out. Our server Gloria was extremely friendly and attentive - we had not been drinking enough water and she kept our glasses full at all times! We could have gotten in without reservations and when we left there were open tables. This must be the best kept secret in the area or something because I have paid twice as much for food not nearly as good here in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i0itIGkSBJpS8dP88K-ahQ.text: Found this while browsing the apple maps and I wasn't disappointed. Food and cocktails were great- nice gastropub food with an eclectic selection and a fun spin on dishes. We had the Korean pork buns, the drunk tofu, and a spinach salad - and everything was delicious. The pot de crepe was pot de YUM. So was the smash cocktail.   Our server, Brandee, was great too! Attentive and on it. Would definitely come back!

nyGgEPm7XY1sSz4lVDSPhA.text: A cool vibe, and neat place. A bunch of us went here for dinner and drinks, and the memorable dish for me were the bacon wrapped dates and their salad. The empanadas were also very good.  Service was on point. Definitely recommend making reservations on Friday and Saturday night.   I wish that this place would convert to a bar/dance floor at night.

MFVR5n0_PNHPo_mHPuB6MQ.text: Had a staycation and ended up eating lunch here. I'm soooooooo glad I did. I don't know how I've missed this place before. I had the Ricky Ricardo and it was so good. Every part individually was amazing and then you put it in a sandwich and it's heaven.  My guy had the chicken tacos. The refried beans that came with them are probably the best in town. I ordered a to go container for later. We will for sure be back to try more of their menu

P8N9ige1eBZ5p8RudiEPag.text: I wasn't sure what to think when I walked in. They lured us in with their happy hour menu so we sat at the bar. Francisco introduced himself to us and the rest of the bar team. The service was awesome. We ordered the chimichurri steak, salmon (fresh catch of the day) and pork chop. All I can say is WOW! The food was amazing. It took a little while to come out but I can see why. I literally wanted to go and shake the chefs/cooks hand for preparing such a delicious meal for us. Highly recommended!

7qzpQxfPEWmRDdJteFaE3A.text: Came here on a Sunday. The food was delicious. Had an all day happy hour. Really enjoyed the chicken and waffle sandwich. Wish I had taken pics. Services was very pleasant. Will definitely come back.

a3ZwxjICdSWOCOp9gNajNA.text: My second time at this restaurant and it still ranks as one of my favorites in the Fremont area. Delicious food, great quality, reasonable price. First time I came I had the red velvet chicken and waffles, it was amazing! I also highly recommend the s'mores dessert and ADD bacon! This time, I went a little healthier and it was still fantastic. Skirt steak and tofu appetizer was perfect! If you want great food, minus the Vegas price tag, check this place out. Great wait staff and large dinning room to accommodate parties. They have a fantastic drink menu as well!

2_Qrzw9ofdnmm6_AqbWgWw.text: After several days of mind-bending experiences and finding ourselves downtown, "E" said we needed some Therapy. We were met by Jenna, our friendly and helpful server, who brought samples of two of their three IPAs. We each ordered a different one! Jenna recommended that we start with the Charred Brussels Sprouts which were delicious...a great suggestion. The ladies selected the Veggie flambe and the Chicken & Waffle Sliders; I got the Double-cut Pork Chop. The flambe was a crispy flatbread kind of thing made of several tasty ingredients, but it was sloppy and did not come together as a dish. I remember that the pork chop was very good, but I don't remember what it was served with (sorry). The bottom line is that I was happy. The star of the show was the pair of sliders. They looked great and I never even got a taste. The ladies were quite pleased.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffle Sliders
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7tE6vqDrnv0JX7MlrFb3tw.text: Great food. Tacos, chicken and waffles, and a surprisingly excellent Ceasar salad. Our server was Jenna, and she handled my gluten-free issues well. A great night out.

9rjJhuewwNXQ-8tXtp_YIw.text: I came here light night with my boyfriend in celebration of my 24th birthday, and I honestly had a spectacular time.   For a Monday I wasn't quite surprised at how empty it was, but we really wanted to see how this ambiance is when it's busy.  I ordered The Meadows and I was pleasantly surprised by how mellow the mint was, but really enjoyed how smooth it was.  We ordered the Mac n Cheese croquettes with the bacon jam, the chorizo empanadas, the corn off the cob, and the Korean bao. I personally loved the Bao and the corn the most, as I found the bacon jam to be a bit overpowering, not that it wasn't bad, but I couldn't taste anything else. I loved the harissa lime aioli that came with the chorizo empanadas and they were extremely flavorful.   For our entrees Jacob ordered the French Dip and I ordered the Ricky Ricardo which is just as good as people have been mentioning. I hope I didn't upset them by not eating the plantains, but I just don't like platanos unless they are fried and covered in salt. Jacob just wished there was a tad more horseradish.  We finished this evening off with the s'mores dessert, which was yummy, but honestly a little much. We felt that if there was a vessel like graham crackers on the side to scoop up the yummy deliciousness it would have brought it over the top!   This place is a definite must try and there is so much more we want to eat there.  Until next time!  Happy Eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Was too distracted to take more photos. Sorry friends!

47A1sGx6m4S2gKVxPlmVXQ.text: The bartender, Haley was rude and not friendly at all. Can't believe you have someone like her in a customer service position.

wODYkHCK5bfX-zU75ciWLQ.text: My friend suggested lunch here, having read something about this being a top-notch place. And I think it must be True. Prices are a bit steep, but food quality and service more than make up for it. We tried the bacon-wrapped dates which came with a truffle tomato sauce. They were quite tasty. Then we tried two sandwiches to share expecting the portion size to be like tapas only to be surprised by such large, filling portions! Splitting one sandwich is more than enough for two people. I still don't think I'll have an appetite for dinner! We tried the French dip and the red velvet fried chicken waffle sandwiches and both were decadent with a surprising combination of flavors to delight the palate. We sat in a comfortable booth with a great view of the interior design and hip signage. Plus, the place transforms into a night club during the evening. So a bonus for those looking for some entertainment for their guests.

Does anyone there want to work?  Edit to respond to owner:  Went by at 728 and all those tables are still empty.  See attached photo.

dO_aFKUU2CS-FhN8s2rOVg.text: Came here after work on a Friday night with a few coworkers for a birthday. We had made a reservation a few nights before, as there were about 10 of us. Definitely recommend making a reservation for this place, especially on the weekends. They were turning people away left and right.   We tried a few specialty cocktails off their menu and every single one of them was SO delicious! It was pretty busy and we had a big group, there was only 1 bartender, and our server had quite a few other tables. The drinks took awhile to come out, but that's ok considering how delicious they were.   I have to say, the 5 stars are almost entirely due to the food. AMAZING. We pretty much got 1 of everything and shared amongst ourselves. My favorite was the street corn. Basically Elote in a bowl, and by far the best I have ever had! So flavorful!   I would highly recommend this place if you are in the area, and I'll definitely be returning.

wOzuM3ca3-KBRZYVVySeWA.text: We came here over the new years weekend on a Sunday for lunch. We made a reservation just in case but I don't think we needed to because the place wasn't too crowded. We got seated right away and the waiter explained the menu very well.   The food was very good and it was definitely better than I expected. We got the red velvet chicken waffle slider, parmesan truffle fries (SUPER BOMB), french dip, and fried mac and cheese. They were all very delicious and I would definitely come back. The price was also not too bad.

VK7k5GN5sTvzJ04f50lCOA.text: We ventured over for lunch and the atmosphere was chill and calm.   We started off with the bacon wrapped dates and I opted for a salad and added steak. Everything was palatable but not exceptional.  While our server was pleasant, the busser kept coming by to clear plates before we were ready which made us feel rushed even though the place was mostly empty during our visit. We ordered champagne but sent it back as there was no fizz. A new bottle was opened for us, which was perfect.  We had the s'mores dessert and it was amazingly gooey and delightful, as promised by our server.  We wanted to buy t shirts with the therapy logos but the shirts were incredibly scratchy and not cute.  We saw a cute red one on display as we were leaving and asked if we could see that one. We were informed by our server that the manager refused to come out to show it to us and so we left disappointed.

fuQy6ho9KZGTGfX0N89IUQ.text: Nice setup however, I came here on a wednesday with a group of friends with a reservation prior to arriving, we had two more people who wanted to join us but told us that they can not accommodate two more guests in our party. We arrived to our 6:30 reservation and only two tables had guest with plenty of seating available, our large booth definately could have fit those two more guests. Other then that the drinks were great, Diplomatico rum was suggested by our host and was so good me and a friend had to have another. Empanadas were dry, tacos we're 5/10 and was not hot when delivered to our table.  This place seems to lean toward the beverage side of things, food wasn't the best, definately am not coming back here.

9YWqtOLstpoLV7ztCZ4ylg.text: I've been here for dinner before in Oct 2018 - the food and staff were great then. However, my second visit for brunch on a public holiday in May 2019 was dismal and a painful experience. We were one of three tables filled at the time of visit, but had to wait 45 mins for the kitchen to prepare our 4 dishes, and 2 of which they got wrong (server keyed one order wrong, kitchen got the other wrong). Adobo fried rice was way too salty, fried chicken in The King was dry and missing the crucial sauce, omelette was overloaded with onions we didn't even request for and missing ham, red velvet waffle was hard and overdone. No attempt to make up for it or to acknowledge the poor service at the end either. Disappointing.

RmQt68gwZFglJyfaQilfyA.text: Looked this place up on Yelp because we were going to be in the area.  We ordered the artichoke and lump crab for starters.  It came out "burn the roof of your mouth" hot (which we loved!) And it was excellent!!  You could really taste the lump crab meat in every bite.  I had the dip and my wife had the Wagyu burger.  Both were very good and we enjoyed it.  But what really stood out to us was Michael the server.  He was outstanding in every way.  We will definitely return and ask for only Michael!!!  The ambiance was very warm with soft lighting and a homey feel.  If you go here ask for Michael!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3pI8jetK4oz-mvF-kJKuow.text: We went here based off of the 4.5 star rating but were truly disappointed.  The place wasn't terribly busy although there was a large group of people there.  Our server/the bartender was slow. We arrived first ordered and about 30 minutes later 4 friends joined us.  They ordered and it appeared that our server didn't quite hear all of them and my husband tried to point it out.  After waiting for at least 45 minutes for the food to arrive it did with the exception of the one he didn't hear.  "I thought you didn't order anything" he said.  He put her order in with a slight protest from her and so we waited. Our friends ate the Betty's biscuits and a Ricky Ricardo (Cuban). The biscuits were doughy and undercooked and the Cuban wasn't very good.  When the forgotten order of Sweet and Savory arrived nearly 20 minutes later it was by far the only acceptable meal the 6 of us had. It was hit and very delicious.  Our server did not charge for the forgotten order or for one of the biscuit orders though. Overall we would not come back to this place.

iYRBhsvNMJOd0fuhMFAx0Q.text: My 'guardians' came here for the second time. Chicken and red velvet waffle sliders and French dip was their choice. The dip was not the typical dark brown sodium OD. Light in color and a more subtle light flavor. The beef was tender and well seasoned and the white cheddar was a perfect compliment. It came with home made tater chips! Yummy. My guardians got mad when I absconded with one. Oh well. Chicken and waffle sliders just like you would imagine. Atmosphere is cool downtown industrial and more hipsters than you can shake your proverbial stick at.

9iWy53DgonBLM7HJtQ9TKg.text: Hubby and I's first time here and OMG this place is mother-ing fantastic! Humberto was our waiter and took excellent care of us. Tapas style restaurant which is our fave. Drinks on point, fast service! Will most certainly come back to this hot spot!

_SLPlLWMXpP3TZ6tc3aoYA.text: Didn't get me wet.  The food took too much time to come out. I could see there was only a couple other tables so idk what they were doing back there. The food was mediocre. I paid $18 for a burger and the bread tasted slightly stale. Hell of a good jalapeno aoli doe. Oh and the staff was friendly

50hYnlm3NRCAaAelCCd1zQ.text: Three of us enjoyed a very flavorful meal at Therapy. We had the Mac N Cheese croquettes. The sweetness of the tomato jam really set off the spice of the sirracha aoli and the crunchiness of the croquettes added great texture. We also had the battered chicken sliders in red velvet waffles. We didn't really like the slaw, but the vanilla maple syrup was oustanding. Finally we added the korean bbq bao, with pork belly cooked to perfection - tender yet crispy. The buns soaked up the flavor of the sauce and left us lusting for more. The portion sizes were huge and made for sharing. But we still found room for the banana toffee pudding. Incredible, and worth a return visit on its own. Might be too rich for some - but can that be a bad thing?  This place is worth the stars.

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac N Cheese croquettes

6xvwOw6MvIqiwv8xAwrktw.text: This is a MUST try in Vegas.  Everything is awesome!  Jason is the BEST!!!  Great food, great service!

qRo_QFfAMwT-PaHLEqxg3Q.text: Michael was an excellent host and the food was exceptional.  The atmosphere was not a typical Vegas strip feel. Very local to the area and a great find.

JxZ4EnmMK8wMDXljaMc98w.text: Great place and atmosphere. Jonathan our waiter was awesome! We were celebrating my daughters graduation from nursing school. Go Roseman University of Health & Science!

9I6HFUSFCJ4Z88pMloIHgw.text: We can in for dinner tonight and it was amazing! From our great host Gabby And server Brandi to the amazingTherapy Chardonnay! We had a wonderful time and we will definitely be back!

vzQSGu6ZSqt3DMVqDPCLNA.text: Just opened two days ago, and I only had time for a drink. The house drink "the Smash" was amazing. Our server Jason was awesome!  Definitely check out this new hotspot!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the Smash!

gmoAeehIYfq4ykBZQT8zkA.text: Red velvet sliders were bomb. Salad was great. The bacon wrapped dates were also great. The snores dessert was a JOKE. I could have made a better one at home. It was a sprinkling of graham cracker crumbs on the bottom of a skillet, (not a crust-mind you), with minimal chocolate on top and a crap load of marshmallows. Yuck.  Other than that, not bad. Service was good. The guy at the front was super nice and even opened the door for us on the way out :)

3WTcZuALHYS8QOdQRbqsJg.text: So good! Jackie was our waitress and she was super friendly and attentive!  We shared the stake tartare, red velvet chicken & waffles, street corn, and S'mores.  The street corn was my favorite. The fatty in me wishes the waffles came with syrup. The tartare was good but not memorable, and the s'mores were the perfect ending to the meal.  I also tried the mango and lychee sangria. Perfectly sweetened and strong from the grand mariner.   I would definitely pick this spot again for something to snack on downtown!

9ekfzbHI27MqdFIirsgOLA.text: My first time at the restaurant was a great experience ordered a selection of menu items from appetizers, entrees and desserts.  The Oxtail Empanadas YUM, Super Mac a great creamy dish, Chicken and Red Velvet Waffle Slider awesome, French Dip Sandwich too many items to mention.  My FAVORITE item had to be the Carrot Cake Dessert with Brown Butter Cinnamon Ice Cream.  I am not a drinker at all BUT the "Fuhgettaboudet was so good I almost drank it in two giant gulps!  Also the Smash was great and the Deal Maker.  My server's name was Michael a young man that took care of our every need with such a great attitude made the experience that much more.  I would recommend this restaurant to many and have been back to try other items.  Keep up the good work guys!!!

90LdJckQyQr13MLM-64G0w.text: Went here last night with a group of 13 on a weekend trip. Had a blast! The ambiance was perfect, Micheal was our server, he had awesome suggestions, great personality and over all he was phenomenal! Food was amazing, craft cocktails on point! What more could we have asked for!

yudnedQJeO8OkIaRnOvFKg.text: LOVED this place. Trendy atmosphere, staff is fun, I recommend the filet mignon and parmesan truffle fries.

bzIhmCoKOt0SFkiPcrD9eg.text: Welcome addition to Fremont St. Great value and good cooking. From the doorman to servers staff is hospitable and very well intentioned. Tried the Charred Kale salad, beets lightly pickled in Pedro Ximenez are addictive. Lots of tasty vegetarian offerings, Curried cauliflower & dates are a bold full flavored. Pig ears & Oxtail empanadas are just two of the many "Chef driven" offerings.  I'll definitely be returning to to try the remainder of the menu.

-XcBL6aXqcwMYa9HvW7oPw.text: Loved it! We ate at the bar because all the tables were reserved (Saturday night) Excellent drinks by Mauro and very good food. We had the Chimchurri steak, Mac/Cheese croquette, and the Crab Dip! All satisfying!

etRqvqcESeQROmEnnKcM0w.text: This place had so many good reviews I don't know what happened the night I visited.  We first had a seat at the bar to wait for the rest of our party.  The Smash I ordered was fine, just like a nice refreshing mojito with Bourbon.  But the drink my girl ordered was definitely made incorrectly.  She ordered a frozen drink, but it was more of a meal since she needed a spoon to actually drink it with the huge chunks of ice.  I'll give the bartender the benefit of the doubt since he was obviously new and was reading the ingredient list as he was making it.  But even I knew you had to blend the drink for more than 10 seconds.    We decided to see if they could make something simple so we ordered a Jameson Ginger.  You cant' mess that up... Yes you can if you put all ginger ale and barely any Jameson.  I went back to ask for a bit more Jameson but he said it was standard pour and would charge me for another shot.  I was pretty surprised as we saw him make the drink right in front of us and he might as well has forgotten to put the whiskey in it.  This night was not starting out well.  We were sat 15 minutes later, around 8:00pm.  We didn't get our food until 9:20pm.  Even drinks were a difficult to get at our table as we watched them sitting at the bar, ready to be served.  We watched a family next to us leave after not being served after a while.  We were lucky we were in good company or else we would have definitely got up and left.  I ordered the Ricky Ricardo sandwich.  They should have just called it a Dijon Mustard sandwich because that's all I could taste.  The plantains were the best part of the dish.  Do not order that!  The Oxtail Empanadas were not memorable.  All night we had to flag down our server and we had wagers on the Over/Under on the time we would get our food/drinks.  The OVER won 9 times out of 10.    I will not be returning to this establishment.  Whether they were understaffed that night or chef's were having an off night, this experience was one of the worse dining experiences I have had in a long time.  Usually Yelp reviews have steered us in the right direction but something was off with this experience.

ETkVU_FSHDIqWd7BRTTUrg.text: Food was sooooo good! Our server Jonathan was very prompt and kept our drinks full without disturbing our table conversations. He  was knowledgable about the menu as well. The food was presented beautifully and tasted great!!!   Highly recommend this place if you're on Freemont. It has a low key chill environment :)

e4GlipVMZ3mCj05yIP6_Ug.text: This place is such a hidden gem. Awesome food, great music, and fabulous bar staff- Michael and Spencer are great! We had the Ricky Ricardo, Filet Tartar and the mac & cheese croquettes. SO delicious! Cannot recommend enough.

VlWOR0sfcHSIK7EWB6jjSg.text: This is one of the many gems in the newly renovated Fremont Area of Las Vegas. A gem of a restaurant with a great wait staff, bar, food and hip ambiance that rivals a lot of the higher costing restaurants on the main part of the strip.  Went to dinner here with my sister and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly! I had the Sliced chimichurri steak and my sis had the Barramundi filet. Both cooked to perfection and the drinks from the mixologist were delicious also!  Definitely coming back! When you come, have a good time, enjoy, and relax!  Just wanted to add that Georgie was our server that night and she helped my lil sister's visit pretty awesome! Be sure to ask for her and treat her kindly!  Thanks again Georgie for the hospitality and for treating us well!    Totally look forward to coming back!

PLS-d6eJINs4Eb0YET0aUQ.text: Good vibes. The staff here is very kind and helpful to each their as well as guests. Humberto is great! Awesome Brussel sprouts starters. Reasonable cocktails and warm comfortable set up! Would recommend!!

FzFjVXPl4nucABbgGn0vdA.text: This was a great experience!! Food great!! Ask for. Yesenia she was awesome!!   Brussels sprouts my favorite as well as the stuffed dates.   Great hidden gem

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9BYm6lteUCCSjLP3a53yxA.text: We had a lovely dinner at Therapy.  Our server Humberto was attentive and helpful.  We shared a few plates, with our favorites being the Tartare,  as well as the Heirloom Tomato salad.  I drank the house Manhattan and my Hubby enjoyed a cold beer.  We did not have room for dessert, but did end our meal on a sweet note.  We had the House Therapy shot, which had coffee liquor, baileys and a house cured cherry.  Overall, fantastic experience.

uh9U08drpj9SgQlS8On3mw.text: Boy oh boy if you don't try the oxtail empanadas you are missing out! Very very tasty! Service was outstanding. Nice place to come and relax and try some tapas! The guy next to me ordered a burger and if I hadn't already been so full I probably would have ordered that too!

KK4PobN74pNSJwCDBnZVJw.text: This is downtown done right - heck, this is anywhere done right.  The architecture and design of the room are subdued and cool, but very inviting.  The split level is intriguing, and I hope to be back with a large party soon so I can enjoy the loft.  The kitchen is on full display which is good, because the food is certainly the star; gunned, ceviche, and chicken with red velvet waffles are just a few highlights.  The restaurant's laid-back vibe is driven by the staff who I found to be warm and friendly, as well as helpful in navigating the options.  Located right on Fremont Street, Therapy will do very well - go early before they get mobbed.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnudi!

bKa4CueWODhI1eUJ9lyQsw.text: The BEST Caesar Salad with shrimp I ever had! The shrimp were huge and amazing! Really awesome garlic Parmesan flavor! Also, try the Elder Melon Sangria prepared by our awesome bartender Keith! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BEST Caesar salad with shrimp I ever had in my life! The shrimp were huge and tasted amazing! Also, try the Elder-Melon Sangria.

TdPYMtem-dyUMrbfc2oxAg.text: Very chic place in the heart of Freemont! Delicious cocktails with a nice ambience. Must try the Deal Maker cocktail

GqZkHOBVHFDix2owNh7Mtw.text: My best friend and I came in for dinner a few nights ago, and I was so pleased with my experience. We ordered the Super Mac with bacon and the Red Velvet Chicken and Waffles. Our food was delicious and served promptly by our attentive server, Zeke. Between the delicious food, and wonderful service, we had an overall 10/10 experience.

tf1lmTtvGi9k00LmWZRU4A.text: Therapy,  perfect for our group tonight!  Michael was such an attentive and knowledgeable server.  He suggested all the right things.  Food was creative,  tasty and appropriately portioned.  So great and unexpected !

3SgSsWE1cf15XnwJbut4pQ.text: Stopped here for dinner with my husband and loved the atmosphere of the place. Right off Freemont but with the locals in mind more than tourists. My husband had the pulled pork sliders and had nothing but good things to say. I too had sliders but aimed for the white fish....not my favorite fish. Very fishy flavor and not something I ended up being able to finish, which was unfortunate. We also added on the truffle fries...which tasted like completely regular fries so choose wisely there friends. Overall, I think I'll keep exploring the local eats in this part of town but wouldn't say no to going back someday and giving it another go.

UkgPBReGN-OCoQPPf25XXQ.text: I didn't know if this place would be good, or just a "trendy downtown" place that was trying too hard. It was actually phenomenal. I had the Ricky Ricardo, and it was one of the best things I've ever eaten. Very impressive.

eJ6bkKLjGo43NssULWBFGQ.text: Starting from the moment we walked in, we knew this would be a favorite.   My husband uses a walker and a hostess immediately asked a couple to move upstairs so we could be seated downstairs.   Seating is comfortable and not trendy bar stools, while tables are far enough away from each other that you can have a conversation.   Staff was attentive all evening. Thanks to Georgie S for the great service.   Definitely try the Sangrias .     Oh and the food was wonderful.  Tuna with Sriracha  to die for and a great kale salad.  Burgers coming out looked really good.  Portions plentiful.   We try to go to a different place each time we go downtown,  but we'll be back for sure.

DxezgNfh3sDvfTe7G1zpuA.text: This place truly was Therapy!! First, our waitress was simply outstanding. I'm sorry that I don't recall her name, but she knew everything about the food and ingredients and the best way to eat each small plate that we ordered. There were 3 of us so we ordered 5 small plates and split them. Each one was unique and perfectly prepared and presented. I would go back a zillion times!! An absolute MUST if you're on Fremont Street!

BMA8GJBtgp2TvKpWb9ustQ.text: Candice and Michael are amazing!! Most def my favorite bar tenders!!!! Coming back for sure

AVz8wmXNA3kFA8DdvfgTDw.text: Amazing food on Fremont, great atmosphere. There Was only one bartender and one server and I still had great service at a busy time. Bartender was on point. I will return

ntd8SVPD2r5Klh8P89_MEA.text: Great place for a business lunch had the blt delicious and service best I had in a while. joanne made sure we were taken care off, will definitely visit this place again!!!

Wg5BO00jYhBkY0T07vYafw.text: Amazing restaurant the food was exceptional the service outstanding a True highlight to down town Las Vegas I'll be going back million times and a big bonus the owner was such a great person !!!!

2Ti8fCVTRTGYMgYgSvdMRw.text: Brandee was amazing. The food was good too! Brandee brought more drunken cherries than I could eat but I did!  Food was great as was atmospheric level of fun!

VHsDrP7BDEjtsWkaeBwfQg.text: Such a great find! Shannon and Blake at the bar were amazing and so knowledgable of the menu. They love this restaurant. A must for locals and visitors.

InakajJpKYOZCvKYfaFDgQ.text: Delicious food. Owner checks in at the table. Go for the oxtail empanadas but cut them because they are full of hot broth.  Order everything social.   Everything was delicious but perhaps pass on the Salmon main course. Cooked well but good fish should never smell like...fish.  Definitely get the chicken w lemon mashed potatoes and the white chocolate cheesecake!!!

Zut2mbi_KhXFAsMB_5shOw.text: We planed to eat at f.pigalle but it was closed do to technical difficulties.  We went next door to therapy. Wow perfect place. Happy to see us on a Friday night no reservations. We sat immediately. We shared the epandas awesome bites here. The crap dip was very creamy warm good taste.  The steak tartare was good everything was fresh but won't order again. The chicken and waffles is an omg moment wow a must order best meal and place while we were in Vegas cockatiels were perfect. Server Kristen made it even better

yXmot7BhPxyIeaHxRN_3dg.text: The staff was not friendly.  Ordered a whiskey sour had no flavor.  My fiance ordered a old fashion it was served with crushed ice instead of whiskey block/cube tasted watered down.  Would not trust the reviews.  Went to eureka and had a great experience.

w6NZGGYYERBUdM4LhFBHkA.text: What a find!  My wife and niece are vegetarians and there were great options for them.  Our 13 year old son thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and mashed potatoes and I love my steak!   Most of all we enjoyed the service and great nature of our server, Michael!!!  He was the bomb!  Oh, and an awesome selection of beer!  Just the right therapy for us!

7jgp7qAwXfF1wj5n5G00nw.text: Awesome food and good service, but horrible management. We had a big group with reservations 2 weeks in advance, but our server had our table and 4 others to serve. Naturally, it was very slow. It wasnt the server's fault, it was management's. We ended up opening a tab at the bar to get drinks and got them before our server was even able to take our drink order. Also, after we made the reservation, we called and they couldn't find it (despite giving them a credit card), so we made another reservation. The day before, they called to confirm both, but thankfully we were able to cancel the duplicated one.

WizTP_isfeTZY5P_T2OWtw.text: Honestly, nothing was too terrible about the place. The food was very interesting sounding and the drinks were definitely a reason to return. Unfortunately there was nothing exciting about the food. The meatballs were kind of dry, but if you soak them in the ranch provided they are good. The beat salad was awesome but it was huge and could have been an entry.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chimichurri

vYJbiwseZpp8CuPyoMyWSA.text: My cousin suggested I try this place and when we got there we were seated right away. We both shared The Chick and Korean BBQ Bao. Both were full of flavor and I really liked the sweet potato mash. Our servers name was Jonathan and he was very attentive. We never had to ask for anything or for any refills. He really had great customer service!

Fzp_TyFclAoKCc6Tuwi9Lg.text: Made reservations for noon, showed up at 11:20 and the doors were locked. Their sign showed they opened at 11am and everyone just stared at us and walked up stairs. There was an open table app that said there was a table available but again doors were locked, Good thing there are plenty of other spots to eat nearby, didn't need any Therapy while eating at Eat. down the street off 7th. I have updated rating due to owner reaching out and offering to buy us all a round. we didn't take him up on his offer but it was still thoughtful

Ul3fmLaqKdXIUviTaG5EQg.text: Had a great time with Michael the bartender had great food recommendations and amazing people. Great environment!!!!

JtE6NFHmAzvUDD9Z5RABvA.text: Elizabeth,  money.  Great spot for drinks. Waitress was awesome.  Service was solid.  Food was solid.

OsItXpUgCQsJyTO9eFzRRA.text: It's been about a month since I was in here, but I'm definitely impressed by this place. I love the name! It still just makes me giggle.   My mom, my brother, and I were walking down Fremont Street when we got toward the end. It was insanely hot outside. Imagine that, Vegas being warm! Lol. Anyway, my brother and I were going to walk back to find the car and pick my mother up.   We left her here, at Therapy. This made for a hilarious joke! My brother and I annoyed her so damn bad, that she had to go get therapy, and a few drinks to make it through the rest of the day with us. Just kidding, but we did tell people this.   We left here here for approximately half an hour. She found a spot by the window, so we could just drive up and pick her up. Gave her money in case she really did want to drink while we were gone.   The staff were super sweet to her while she was there. They didn't mind she wanted to sit by the window while she waited. They brought her water, even adding extra ice after she requested it. They didn't seem worried about her that she wasn't ordering anything. They were more than happy to let her get out of the Vegas heat and simply hang out while she waited for us.   I'm not really one to go into a business like this if I'm not planning on buying anything. A business is there to make money, so someone taking up a table and not ordering anything basically costs them money. Is it the nice thing to do? Absolutely. I'm always impressed by a business that can look at something like that from a personal standpoint, versus a cold business standpoint. I wouldn't do it again, but I appreciated the fact they let my mother get off her feet for a bit (she's not too steady on her feet, which is why we went to find the car and left her there to rest) and just get some water in her and cool down from the heat.   It is a place that deserves both my business and recognition for being so kind to my elderly mother. It makes me love it that much more, and the next time I am in Vegas, I will make it a point to stop in and try some of their food and drinks.   Review 89 of 2017.

e9rLBncf-XLG2QF01J8HtQ.text: Jonathan was our server and he was delightful. Our drinks came right away, we ordered a few shared plates and those were also brought in a timely manner! The empanadas and chicken and waffles are superb!! Def check this place out whether you're a local or tourist and are in the DT area

3ugpquNpbp6pb2mssKKo_Q.text: I stopped at Therapy on my walk home from work for a quick beer after a long day. I was greeted with a smile as I walked in from the host. Elizabeth was the bartender and suggested a unique Atomic IPA which really hit the spot. She was attentive and quickly made my drink while with a friendly chat. The atmosphere was very hip with a second story loft and and high ceilings. I'll be back to try some food next time!

Mv8A_B759-1pVKoq0NpReA.text: Go here. If you are anywhere in Las Vegas -- get to this restaurant. The service is amazing and the food is absolutely incredible.  From the outside and the general area, you wouldn't know that this gem exists. But it is fabulous. Candice and Joann served us and talked Vegas with us -- what awesome connections and stellar treatment.  We ate the Chicken Red Velvet Waffle Sliders and Charred Brussel Sprouts -- both amazing. Possibly the best food in Vegas. Topping lunch with a delicious Melon sangria...outstanding.   Go here. It's marvelous and delicious.

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charred Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Red Velvet Waffles

AYGH-eDEet-cHvSq53Haqg.text: My friends and I made reservations on OpenTable for dinner here on a Saturday night. They called us an hour before the reservation to confirm. We said we'd actually be there about 30 min early, asked could they seat us then. The host laughed and said they'd see... when we got the the place was busy but had plenty of tables available. We were seated immediately by (presumably) a different employee.   The food is either family style with tapas small plates or they also have individual plates as well. We decided to go the tapas route, and ordered the Pesto Chicken Meatballs, Seared Brussel Sprouts, Oxtail Empanadas, & Tuna Tartare. They were all good but honestly the brussel sprouts were my fave. The kitchen forgot to bring us out the chicken meatballs so they came out late--after some prompting. Our waitress felt so bad, we got a Carrot Cake on the house.   If you're coming here for drinks, they're a little pricey.. $13 on average for a mixed drink. Which, to me, is a little steep for not being on the strip. They were tasty though. The Smash was delicious! The Life's A Peachy was too syrupy sweet for my taste, but reminded me of a sweet wine cooler. They have an impressive whiskey and wine list, as well as a decent beer selection.   Overall, the food & drinks here were good and the atmosphere was surprisingly nice. One of the nicest sit down restaurants in the area, as far as ambience goes. Although the host we initially spoke with on the phone was a little rude, everyone once we arrived was very helpful and polite. I'd come back here.

4teEEJVbaA3JdV_QsmH3yg.text: This is an awesome place to go on Fremont! The food and drinks were great and we loved the happy hour! Michael was the best bartender and made us fabulous drinks! Would highly recommend!!

sEpc_EQOzI_rnZviizneCA.text: My wife and I went here during our trip to Vegas. We sat at the bar and had a great time. Food was great, staff was awesome, and the location was perfect

C8lN9xfDYAqhFBmsxt2dpg.text: Food was delicious! Must try! No other words needed!! Great hidden gem! The Ricky Ricardo Sandwich....delicious

Dyh43wY5IzbykRMMIGH2Wg.text: We had our wedding reception in their loft this past weekend.  Everything was even better than we could have wanted.  We arrived a little early, and they immediately took us up.  The servers were so awesome.  They were constantly moving and taking care of all 30+ guests.  Drinks were coming quickly, and all courses of food were coming out hot.  Our guests were extremely happy with the family style serving and quality of the food.  I heard many times that it was so much better than the buffets or "rubber chicken" meals of most weddings.  There was also a fair amount leftover.  I cannot say enough good things about the restaurant, the food and the servers.

fnJ8SBJ5pybhyIpHh1VoNA.text: Ahhh Therapy came in the form of air conditioning after walking multiple blocks in the insane heat! This place was a day saver for sure.   So the good folks of Therapy make this chicken and red velvet waffles slider dish... go ahead and get that because it is delicious! I never knew how important red velvet waffles were until I had them.   They are typically served with the slaw on the sandwich, but I opted to have them on the side just in case the flavors clashed - they definitely didn't and I definitely ended up adding it to my slider. The chicken was perfectly fried crispy on the outside.   I also ordered a side of french fries. Typical quality bar fries but also complimented the red velvet waffle fried chicken extravaganza well.   I do not recall the beer selection being anything to freak out about... but at least they have a selection I guess. The atmosphere is very chill... the staff didn't seem rush-y or anything... but not exactly super welcoming at first. Maybe because we stormed in as if we had been stranded outside with no water for a year... I'm not sure.   Definitely worth stopping by and grabbing a bite. I'd recommend making a dinner night of it.  *2017 Yelp Review Challenge: 8/100*

EG_J2LfGfosgthynSX1y7A.text: I came in for the first time tonight with some of my friends and the restaurant was extremely busy and they seemed to be a little understaffed but all the employees seemed to be running around and handling it pretty well. We waited only a few minutes for a table and then we were sat upstairs and Jen was our waitress. She was very friendly and even though she seemed to have all the tables upstairs and a large party she was awesome! Wait time for drinks from the bar and food was a little long, but they were packed. All in all food and drinks were worth the wait but the service is what will bring us back!! Thanks Jen see you again soon!!!!

r5_i0DFr9xRIV3g1FJTW5Q.text: Last night my husband and I were in search of a place that served delicious drinks but also affordable. We found it! Therapy reminded both of us of our favorite place back in Fort Collins that is laid back and inviting. We didn't get a chance to try the food but we will next time! We will definitely be back. Great drinks and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My new favorite drink.

JwtV3g6Atpc7VyHufEueXQ.text: It's an open, airy, loft-ish space, which is a nice contrast to the cramped and dark spaces that otherwise exemplify downtown. Ordered the mac and cheese. Added bacon. Ate two bites. Went home. It was even better the next day.

op1WTXdIPJWpyyYMpJfzrw.text: Love this place! The food and drinks are very well done!! The owner Jared came outside while we were looking at the menu in the window and personally invited us into his restaurant. We were not disappointed! It's in a great location in old Las Vegas. Give it a try!
