_bVw35kO1Kr1XyXBYvwx8A.text: I currently reside in vegas was downtown with friends from California to see thrice, deftones, rise against show. Friends have had bad experiences foodwise on the strip so they asked for me too choose the restaurant. I came across therapy im like this place looks cool it was great.  I ordered the tuna tar tar. Perfectly season with ponzu, pickled fresnos, julienne apples and radish with daikon chips. Perfect.  My friend ordered the beet barrata salad super sexy presentation, my other friends order the sliders, mac and cheese with Lardon and pull pork sandwich. All very good. Forgot to take pictures. But it's hard to find good food in vegas this place is on point.

HUGE SHOUT OUT TO BLAKE AND SHANNON FOR THE BEST BAR SERVICE EVER!!   Dang ! I forgot about Georgie !! She's next level cute btw ! She's so sweet! Checked in our service, foods, and drinks. n2rgW4S2j9gOVh0XzNzqxg.text: I had the seared brussels spouts and drank lemonade which are delicious. Very trendy and friendly atmosphere, with quick service.

r5si1_KpgBLVrg5qXuPWDg.text: The most amazing Brussel Sprouts I ever had! Wow, what a nice place. By far the best place Downtown! Tried all 3 Sangria's and they were delicious! We also tried the pork sliders and Mac and cheese and was impressed with how good the food was. It is a nice, clean upscale place in downtown VEGAS and the service was outstanding.

nbFPW2agwnpzLySUJzAL2g.text: I can't give this place the fifth star because I think a lot of guys would get in trouble with their wives here. It's hard not to stare at some of the waitresses wearing revealing clothing. Good food

54VeT3WBiK5gyLTSM_qrRA.text: Fabulous restaurant - from the staff to the food. The decor is urban with a rustic flare. The food was flavorful and the portions were perfect for two people to share in a social setting. The chicken and waffles and the scampi were delicious. The deconstructed carrot cake was also on point. The owner stopped by to ensure our satisfaction. This is a place I would recommend to anyone looking to have a meal with a small group of friends away from the madness of the strip or even to rent for an event space.

9JmNqhL6kA6_1JnUYNLsLg.text: Went to therapy for s bachelorette party. The food was great. Great place for groups and a good ambience. The service was excellent Jonathan our server was on top of it. He served our table without being intrusive and was very helpful and professional.

pydyGuAPEmP8S1d4h2S5og.text: Came here during life is beautiful and understand they were busy but they seemed to be well staffed and waited an unreasonable amount of time for everything. I ordered a Bloody Mary and the server brought it over with bacon in it. I am vegetarian and asked if I could have a new one made. She said yes but couldn't not be bothered to actually do it, she went behind the bar and took the bacon out and brought it back to the table. Then the wrong meal was brought over for my friend and when the food runner came over to try and bring the right one we could hear the manager very loudly saying "just leave it it's too late"--like he wouldn't notice he was just served something he didn't order. After we finished eating we had to wait about 20 minutes to pay our check because whenever we did see our server she would not even make eye contact with us. A totally disappointing experience for sure. The food was fine but nothing fantastic and certainly not worth dealing with such rude people.

N00VQjNWo_1r2VFdOPvqHQ.text: WOW! What a wonderful environment with such great servers and people. They were so accommodating and I love the atmosphere. The modern feel gives me such a great feeling I can't wait to come back. MICHAEL WAS JUST GREAT! Thanks Michael!

jEt4wPRd1dwuUEVYtQShRQ.text: Excellent service, food was delicious and the atmosphere is relaxing, they had upbeat music, the food was served pretty fast as well.  Will come back for sure.

jbUueEzRXpoearWQTaVnaw.text: My mother & I dined here on a Saturday night & even though we did not have a reservation they immediately sat us. It was packed! Love the hipster but elegant decor & ambiance. We were greeted by our waitress Michelle who was friendly, warm and inviting. Her suggestions were the perfect cure, the chx & red velvet waffles & the beer mustard pretzels. All were so very tasty. Therapy is a must try & I am now a fan.

fYT5GbjmwOVvk_PYM8Q2uQ.text: We stopped in for lunch  and had a wonderful bartender, June (spelling?) who also apparently manages the sweet find.   He was delightful.  We had a specialty drink"for get about it" which was yummy rum and fruit beverage.  We also had the " Ricky Ricardo" a Puortorican twist on a cubano.  It was salty ( I love salt so it works for me ...but may not for other's).  This was served with fried plantains that were sweet and tasty and that balanced the salty pulled pork.  Also there was pickeled carrot and onion that I put in the delishish sandwich ....mmm  The patron next to us had a burger that looked amazing.  Totally a great find in the downtown strip/ Fremont a blast to go to and see the local crazy action of music/gambling/ crafts/ art etc. I'll be back!   Priced very well too.

q2x-VsRuuTlTUGSowV8OyA.text: Wife and I went to Therapy on Monday. Second time for her, first for me. We ordered light because we had been pigging out all over Vegas. We got the brussel sprouts and mac and cheese and both were the best I ever had! The night before, we had the brussel sprouts from Wolfgang Pucks at MGM and I thought that was the best I've tried until Therapy. Our server Jason was excellent. Very attentive and helpful and was fun to "talk story" with like we say in Hawaii. Can't wait for our next trip to Vegas and more Therapy!!

Ee7MQpQNKkuenmmgHpTfPw.text: I ended up here because the place I planned to go was closed. What a breath of fresh air! Amazing ambiance, great service (shout out to Yancy and Kyrsten), freaking fantastic food (get the Mac and cheese w/ bacon!) and amazing drinks (frozen mango lychee sangria!). I'll be back again and again. I already booked for New Year's Eve, and I am so looking forward to it!

Vl_78NU6OlYYRKr_F8Bfew.text: Came into therapy a couple nights ago the environment was very welcoming. I was attended by a wonderful outgoing server named kyrstin. She was very helpful with ordering a cocktail and items on the menu. When I go out to eat this is the service that keeps me coming back. Great job good food and drinks!

5KGkvyMmQg3m_U1Wg4G4fA.text: What a great find on Fremont in Las Vegas.  The atmosphere was wonderful and the food was awesome! Jonathan our waiter was excellent, and was there with refills and warm bread and butter until the main course came. I felt it was well worth the walk from the MGM Grand (just kidding). I will definitely go back!

5TzeFVAsrrhkoF1yqizxzA.text: Friendly and amazing wait staff and bartenders! Food was really really great! French Dip was excellent no fat and au jus wasn't oily at all. Salmon melted in your mouth, the presentation was artful. Try their coffee it was really flavorful, over all just an amazing place!!

I5fv7B5nwBBoY2GfnK2DYQ.text: We (large business group) ate dinner at Therapy on 1/27 and had a really enjoyable experience. The chimichurri steak was great, as well as the oxtail empanadas, ceviche, and the s'mores and carrot cake were to die for. Michael was our server and he did an excellent job making sure we got food and drinks in a timely manner and had everything we needed!

BXxl0k9RUtgDN9xJmW7JEg.text: I love the atmosphere of this place the most! I'm always warmly welcomed and genuinely pleased with my service. I've only had dinner here but it would definitely be a trusted lunch choice for me too. Oh, and sangria :)

JwIEZ_uqMbEG8jS6Tn0kYA.text: Hidden little gem! They're brand new and the bartender was really nice. It's a Sunday night and they're not dead so that speaks for itself. Drinks are normal Dowtown prices and the music isn't too loud so you can actually talk to the person next to you. I'll be coming back!

zWw3VJ_YthXvXnY-R-Ukdw.text: This place is hip with an attentive owner manager watching over efficient and timely execution of artful, tasty meal. The place is full of texture and cool vibe with an urban warehouse feel. We ordered the big sexy burger cooked to perfection, roasted cauliflower, empanadas, grilled corn cobs, and the red velvet chicken waffle dish. Superb!!! Well worth the drive to the original strip.

K9NYyuQwrs7eGHIs8yn_Wg.text: Some things have changed since I was here three years ago not too long after the restaurant opened.  I had a talk at the Mob Museum later in the evening so I came here for dinner first.    The restaurant was empty and the hostess said I could sit anywhere I wanted.  I chose a two top near the front on the raised area with a view to Fremont Street to enjoy watching tourists.  I was given the menu when I was seated and my server soon came and asked about a drink.  Ordering my standard iced tea, I kept looking over the menu.  She brought my iced tea and I was ready to order.  I opted for the Ricky Ricardo--Therapy's take on a Cuban sandwich.  I also ordered truffle parmesan fries.  After the server left, I realized she had not left any sweetener for the iced tea.  Seated the way I was, I tried to turn around to see if I could get her attention.  No success.    When she brought my sandwich about 10 minutes later, I was then able to ask for artificial sweetener.  There was a couple in the restaurant now so there were three people there.    The sandwich was good tasting but calling it "Therapy's Signature Cuban" is to do disservice to Cuban sandwiches.  There was a lot of pork, a thin slice of ham on the bottom, and a lot of Swiss cheese on bread that wasn't toasted like a real Cuban.  The house made pickles were on the side along with some pickled sweet yellow pepper rings.  This would be better named a pork Philly cheesesteak because that's the kind of sandwich it is.  The fries were crispy and the fine strands of parmesan gave them some nice flavor.  I decided to have dessert.  There was one new item since I was there and I ordered it--chocolate bread pudding.  It's a dessert I only rarely get.  I'm not a fan of warm desserts but I gave it a chance.  This was the best part of the meal.  Topped with caramelized banana slices, banana sorbet, and Therapy smoke wagon whiskey salted caramel, the dessert was good tasting.  There was also an amount of a finely ground mixture along the edge of one side of the bread pudding that was a nice counterpoint to the softness of the bread.  Prices are more like Strip prices, not Fremont East District pricing.  I would have been better off going a block south to Carson Street.

k1nKsR30_8jZbQhX1mNYbQ.text: The family and I were walking down the street when I opened Yelp to see the reviews for the restaurants near us. Therapy was right across the street from us and had top reviews so we walked in. We ordered the steak, chicken and waffles, and more. Everything was delicious! The steak was so flavorful and the chicken was so juicy and the red velvet waffles was amazing. I can't remember the names of the appetizers we ordered but all good. My sister ordered a sweet pasta dish and she loved it. There was 4 of us and felt like we ate like kings and we spent less then 100 before tip. I highly recommend eating here.

6K3XUULKlE66fKPfCB973g.text: Absolutely delicious, inventive food at a great price in Las Vegas! We had the filet mignon and the steak tartare, both wonderful and made perfectly. Brandy was our waitress and provided excellent service, even brought a bowl of water with ice in it for our dog without us having to ask for water for him. I would go back to eat there any time I am in Vegas!

_Z1T0I6NivDwzCBi3bvbQQ.text: We've always wanted to check out this place and finally got to visit on Mother's Day. Located in downtown Las Vegas near the El Cortez Hotel, a very cool atmosphere dining area with patio seating as well. They had their new brunch menu release with just a few options at the time we dined, looking forward to seeing how much more items will be added to the brunch menu.   We got to enjoy their Adobo Fried Rice, House made Betty's Biscuits, Berry Simple and Red Velvet Chicken and waffles, which all were very fulfilling and portion sizes were just right. Our other families tried their burger sliders, Fried Mac Croquettes and the King. Everyone enjoyed their meals as well.  Customer service from our server was ok, not much interaction with our party, took her a while to check up on our party to see if we were ready to order. We ordered our drinks first while waiting for a couple more people to our party. Would've been nice if our server explained to our party that they had a short brunch menu roll out.  Chef Chris came out to our party table to greet us, which was very nice of him to take time off away from the busy kitchen. Chef explained about the new brunch menu and what he has planned ahead for Therapy with new menu items. Very excited for Chef Chris on his new journey. Will definitely check them out again soon.

AV4dS72lIvrIG8agiR5lTw.text: This place was great. The chicken and waffles were amazing. The staff was great even though we brought a huge party after a wedding. It get busy and crowded but totally worth it.   I would recommend this place!

WaR07i9XGmAt1Q3asC_IXQ.text: Another hidden gem just along Fremont street. Yummmy. Lunch was a combo of several things (chorizo empanadas; Mac/cheese croquettes with bacon jam (oh yea yummm); and red velvet chicken and waffle sliders(a do again!). Ordered the in house made carrot cake with brown sugar ice cream for the end of our shared lunch, another in the yumm category. The H is already planning a return eats visit on the next trip to Vegas....where ever we stay....that's saying something!

VJYhf14e3y7IM_d1Ke_p4Q.text: Relatively new visitor to Fremont St, usually do the Strip and larger restaurants.   This is only the third time I've eaten down there.   Pulled up the top 5 rated places and picked one that looked good.   We made a great choice.   Humberto took great care of our table for 4.   We had some drinks, apps and meals.   Not a bad drink or serving came to our table.  We didn't have a reservation and ended up by the kitchen.   Not a place I usually enjoy but no massive heat wave or noise to bother us.  Just a great looking staff serving amazing food.  Saw the whole menu come out.  Looked GREAT!   Worth the stop!

TiuFdqPsWqXsfCDWTQ2YjA.text: While visiting the Fremont Street area during St/ Patricks Day weekend for work, I was looking for a spot for a bite with my boyfriend where my drink would not be green. Therapy delivered!  The ambience was good, this night they did have a DJ who was playing pretty loud music, but it was St. Patricks Day, so that may have been why. We were far enough away from the speaker that my boyfriend and I could still have a conversation at a normal volume, but I imagine that would not have been the case for those closer.   We shared the chorizo empanadas which were delish, and then also split the "Ricky Ricardo" Cuban sandwich, which was AMAZING. I loved the flavors of the sandwich, the plantains it came with, and allll the pickles that were included too! I would definitely order this sandwich again. My boyfriend said it was one of the best Cuban sandwiches he's ever had. We split the smores dessert, but I would skip this in the future, and order one of their fun cocktails instead.   Overall, I would definitely visit again if in the area!

QYZRt6j3jiYh1mxTAqKFIA.text: I love the ambience. The music was amazing and suits the ear very well.. the natural lighting really brightens up the mood. Parking was within decent distance of the restaurant...  Our waiter Terence was great. He was very attentive, he offered some great food options.. Terence was honest and was very groomed.  The Bar has a wide variety of options...  Try the signature shots : $5 Daily Therapy shot Or the house sangria:BlackBerry   We ordered :Therapy crab dip, The Big Sexy handheld  burger with the Wagyu Beef. Yummmmmyyyyy

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides

KtuZR5FgCVqv-ICl9C0LBg.text: Therapy is like Meditation through talking about Certain Perspectives, Problems and your Differences. This place is all about comfort Food, as in the Food is like Meditation throughout the Meal. Relaxes you with eat Bite or Sip that you Take. Like the sign said outside: After a couple days in Vegas who doesn't need a little Therapy. What was once a run down Dollar Store turned into an Eye Capturing eatery that attracts Locals & Out of Towners alike to take in Meal like they've never have before.   Just a bit past Fremont Street but before Container Park, I walked in to this Cool, Swank Joint that brought a casual feeling. There was also an Open Kitchen and an upper floor dining area, It was slow as there were only 2 Other Groups, as I was peering at the Unusual Statues like a Scorpion made out of Wrenches and a Bike Chain. I walked over to the Bar and sat down to have my Lunch. I talked to my waitress for a bit before placing my Order. None of the Cocktails really struck me as interesting except one called Spiced Gingerbread (Ginger Rum, Spiced Pumpkin Liqueur, Bailey's, Pumpkin Puree and Orange Bitters). Generous Spiral of Whipped Cream over the Top, got that Spice that slowly lingers on your Mouth, Orange was light but I thought that the Ice was unnecessary in the Drink. It was good but it was more of a December drink (I came in October) a week after I was there they had a Drink called the Boozy Bat (which should've been a Monthly Drink) or have drinks on the menu named after the City's beloved NHL Team the Vegas Golden Knights.  To start off I got the Empanadas (filled with Braised Oxtail) with a side of Harissa/Lime Sauce. As I bit into the Pastry to feel that Unctuous Meat then dip into this sauce that had that Hot Spice that stays with you but goes away eventually, the Lime was pretty light. I was trying to pace myself as this was an Hour and 40 Minutes after my Late Breakfast at Donut Bar. For my Main I decided to get myself a Sandwich, the Ricky Ricardo (after the namesake Character's Cuban Heritage from I Love Lucy). Loads of Slow Roasted Pork with Ham & Swiss Cheese, Dijon Mayonnaise and with some Plantains and Pickled Vegetables on the Side. The Meat had that Melt in your Mouth Tender feeling, with an excruciating Richness that can be mellowed out by the Pickled Vegetables on the Side (Onions, Cauliflower and Cucumbers). The Plantains while Crisp on the Edges I felt were Slimy in the Middle and did not finish them.  There was a Salad on the Menu called Beets by Therapy that really captured my interest (Different colored Beets, Goat Cheese, Hearts of Palm, Hazelnuts and Orange Ash). It said on the Menu that it was only for Dinner but I asked if they could've made an exception and they said that all the components wouldn't have been ready so that was a Bummer. Anyway I skipped on something sweet cuz I was feeling pretty Full, so I paid and was well on my Way, I thought that this Therapy Session went good for the Most Part. I'll be sure to let them know again when I'll schedule my next Appointment !!!

SNCs7CLeJqZkMhA5JyDeTQ.text: This place exactly hit the spot. We split some sort of delicious salad with walnuts and watermelon radish and apple and some sort of light and delightfully citrusy dressing followed by dreamy elotes and truffle fries and peach vodka bellinis and god damn it feels good to get help. They also played throwback rock tunes the whole time which I enjoyed very much.

g88tJcgYiCl8f_4OUkYdTQ.text: Great food.  Lots of veggie options.   Server was super friendly.   Custom drink- The Arizona or something similar, yum! Really great spot to eat quality food on Fremont Street.

HVOgfMUh5oGPmJ6Dd2NfVQ.text: We came at a pretty busy time. We got the only seats left ( a counter facing the street) which I actually highly recommend for people watching purposes. The tables are right next to the bar so I was surprised that we waited a pretty long time for our drinks ( soda water and ginger beer)! I saw Shishito peppers as part of a dish but I wanted them on their own. They had no problem doing that, which I think speaks volumes for their customer service. Our waiter, Zack was SO professional and really seemed to care about our experience. He apologized for any wait we had and then came back many times to make sure we were happy.   I can't leave a review without mentioning the IN THE "GNUDI"! To Die For! Well, I wouldn't really die for it but I might be willing to suffer a cold for it. Had it been socially acceptable, I would have licked the platter clean! They have a very large upstairs area with a massive TV that would be pretty cool for large groups. If you like small plates and a creative menu, this is a great downtown stop!

mhhaGH5LOXYnzIMYvDsvtw.text: Cute place near on Fremont Street once you pass all the attractions and sights. Went based off of some Yelp review and not wanting to eat at the casinos. Ordered from the happy hour menu, which we came in with only 5 minutes to spare. Ordered Mexican Street corn, Brussels sprouts, chicken meatballs and firecracker shrimp tacos. The food was fresh (except the shrimp seemed like they were previously frozen) but I wasn't excited with the flavors and seasonings. The Brussels sprouts were too salty, and the chicken meatballs were on the dry side. The corn and tacos were definitely the stars of the show. As for service, our bartender wasn't the friendliest. She seemed as we were an inconvenience to her. There was conflicting information between the hostess and bartender about the happy hour time and the bartender acted like it was our fault. Overall, I wouldn't say this place is horrible, but this isn't a must-go place. Go if you have the time and want excellent happy hour prices.

I had the Asada tacos which were delish and 3 of my friends had the short ribs (amazing!!!!) the signature salads were yummy as well! Thank you Maria for visiting our table!

L9j2r8s1q0tAMt3i-qT7Uw.text: Soooo this place was great. My friend and I came here for dinner and we were not disappointed.   Jonathan was our server and he deserves FIVE Stars. He was super friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. He was awesome.   We had the fried Mac and cheese. Definitely recommend. And we also had the red velvet and fried chicken... I was nervous it would be too sweet but it was close to perfection. Not too sweet, not to savory. I've had a LOT of chicken and waffle in my day and this was next level.   The cured board, so the meats and cheeses, was good but not great. Would probably skip for the Mac and cheese and/or chicken and waffle sliders.   We then split the shrimp tacos, which were also very good.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. The outdoor seating has great views of Fremont Street. Glad we found this gem. Shout out again to Jonathan!!!

fSUoLVbPjv4g-L4U5ePP-A.text: Came out for dinner a while back. The menu is small, but the food ordered was good.  I felt the food prices were a little high for the quality. The restaurant is nice. A little small so if you are just walking on off Fremont you may not get a table. Although tables were opened we were told they had reservations we sat at the bar.   Seems like the trend downtown is "reservations" but the tables are always empty. Maybe when people don't show they should give up the tables to guests waiting? With it being Vegas everyone gets waisted and ends up somewhere else.   I am giving them four starts because while to food was ok I felt the prices were over the top for what you got.

gfbE5LQyODb0tyZ1UeEc2A.text: Absolutely a must for Vegas! I am not a Mac and cheese person at all. I must admit I saw the reviews and said whatever. I instantly became a believer and wrote this review. Simply amazing. Furthermore, I ordered the Red Velvet chicken/waffles as well and fell in love with this place. Definitely worth the trip off the main strip.

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese croquets

DRI1amISgq1NF6SCPH4dXg.text: This is a solid good time in terms of food, albeit limited.  The appetizers are especially established...try the mac and cheese bites.  I also like the specials, particularly fish.  The weird carrot cake (with a real part of carrot) is surprisingly satisfying.  This is a perfect place for a Happy Hour, or after work drinks.  Lunch sometimes feels a bit out of place.  And dinner can feel a bit lonely, like you should have gone home to your wife or husband.  (It's not much of a dinner place, IMHO).  But out shopping, or before going home, go in and take the load off. You'll be glad you did.

usb4-O3MoY0MwlhVdjnKIA.text: Visited on a Saturday night at 8 PM with no reservations.  Place was packed but we were lucky enough to find a spot at the bar. (Party of 2)  Service: 4/5 The bartender was also our server since we were at the bar.  She had our menus ready for us as soon as we sat down and took our orders promptly.  She kept checking on our food orders as well as keeping our drinks fresh.    Food: 4/5 The oxtail empanadas were tasty and is something I look forward to on my next visit. The chicken meatballs were also a hit for me.  The size was only slightly larger than a ping pong ball and 6 came out in a bowl, but the meatballs were dense with chicken and rich with flavor.  The raw filet tartar looked and tasted great.  The egg yolk and parmesan cheese mixed well with the filet.  The carrot cake was tasty and presented in this unconventionally mashed potato shaped fashion.  It was interesting and definitely didn't hinder the taste. Best part of the night was being introduced to tonic syrup for the first time with my Tito's vodka.  It gives an appearance that it's been mixed with Coke or Pepsi.  It's a little sweeter than tonic water but not too sweet and really takes the edge off the vodka.  Tonic syrup is something I'll be looking for in the future. (see pics)  Value: 3.5/5 The appetizers are priced in the $11-$17 range and the entrees are fairly priced for the quality of food you receive.  If you have a big appetite the bill can add up quickly but you will have a tasty good time.    Ambiance: 4/5 Industrially decorated with high ceilings to make it appear even more spacious.  It's going to be busy and noisy on the weekends as it is a popular spot downtown.  There seems to be a mix of parties of either looking to eat and run or staying for awhile ordering plate after plate. The tables and booths are separated enough and comfortable for dining.  There's a good energy and vibe that helps kick start a long evening out.  Summary: This is my second visit and I enjoyed it as much as the first.  I highly recommend reservations if you're coming down on a weekend night.  The location on Fremont street is close to the main bars in the vicinity, all walking distance.  Therapy is my go to place in Downtown for a light dinner and some good drinks right before I head out for the night.

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet tartar presentation was nice. =)

TE6jdqFirZ7EVXt250z1gQ.text: Stumbled into this place on Freemont, and it was really good. Bartender was friendly and drinks were delicious. The pistachio martini sounds weird but it's a must try. And the crab dip was da bomb. Lol.

_ttKkLeR2GpXEiHODgoHnQ.text: I loved this place!!! The server Yesenia is dope as f**k. The cocktails are incredible, I had the Smash and $5 off the wagon. The drinks and food are super affordable. Food was great! I was expecting a long wait for a table after reading reviews, but we instantly walked in and had great service. Recommended!

2XSKMSHKD4VHZLIxNponoA.text: Had dinner at Therapy with our family.  The Fried Max Croquettes were absolutely amazing!  A very unique taste!  If I could explain the taste, I would.  SO GOOD!  Also, the Chicken and Waffles were amazing!  The waffles aren't too sweet which makes it the perfect combination!  We had the Brussels sprouts for an appetizer.  Different than any I have had in the past.  Therapy has found a way to create very unique dishes that work well together.  We will be back!

BGRZ6gPaWW9k_5-Nz9hFPg.text: I've been to Therapy twice now and each time I feel the need to make puns about going to group therapy.   First time, the group of us got a few appetizers to share: oxtail empanadas and the crab dip. I couldn't eat the crab dip, but everyone said it was really good. For dinner, I got a filet, which was so tasty!! I almost ordered it again the second visit but after a tiny bite of the short rib I couldn't say no to that. Oh yea, on that note.. the short rib is amazing. The polenta that it's served on is meh, but the meat is amazing. On my second visit, we also got the mac and cheese, which the portion was definitely large enough for 5 of us to have small shares of.   Dessert wise, they have a yummy s'mores dish that you can order with or without bacon. I recommend it with bacon. Because bacon.   Both times I've made reservations and the first time we were instantly seated but the second time we ended up having to wait quite a bit even though there were empty tables. That being said, the gentleman at the front who greeted us was extremely friendly and had a great personality in the few moments of chatting.   The restaurant isn't huge, but it does have a bar area, a downstairs dining area, and an upstairs dining area. The decor is pretty cool, but as you walk down the hall to the bathrooms there's a bit of an unpleasant smell.   Therapy is delicious and I recommend going. Making it part of a friends night out is definitely some much needed and super fun group therapy.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet

o3YNckHZV1OqbFHf3ix_2g.text: Tried Hells Kitchen it was on the bucket list , Uber driver told us about therapy OMG fried Mac and cheese , the BOMB and I'm from New Orleans so you know its good. I had my waitress to call the chef for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet chickens and waffles
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Mac and cheese

pn39OswJoKMuLpVcN5TxSQ.text: I got GREAT service from Gina and Kristina at Therapy.. I was also greeted by Maria the GM of the establishment,. The food was "Awesome" I will come back again..

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time eating here. Looks too pretty to eat lol

vySwi1VJ510my2xx_nWxeQ.text: If you've spent much time in Vegas at all, you'll know there is one thing that tends to run in short supply, a quality wifi connection. We were in Vegas doing media coverage for Punk Rock Bowling Music Festival and after several frustrated attempts to get some work done at our hotel and even Starbucks, we decided to call around to some restaurants to see if they could help us out.   Therapy was more than happy to save us a table by a power outlet and offer us the wifi code. Our waiter was incredible, he was super attentive while understanding that we needed to get some work done. We really enjoyed talking to him and he made us feel super comfortable and welcome, making sure we had everything we needed and telling us to stay as long as we'd like, even after we finished our meal. Therapy was certainly a welcome respite from that crazy Fremont Street life and we were so grateful for their hospitality (plus the food was to die for!).   I only wish we had found Therapy sooner and spent some more time relaxing there in our own special bubble :)

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp ceviche
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese croquettes

Oig0tFsb8uF9p38Za3i7bw.text: I came for happy hour which was 20-25% (cant remember which) off food on the menu and special drink prices. Bartender gave me a massive pour of white wine blend, which who can complain about that.  The tuna tartare was one of the dishes suggested by the bartender and wow did I end up loving that dish. It was soooo flavorful and I truly enjoyed the combination of crunch, spice and creaminess.  Only odd thing is the bartender had to go manually add the HH discount and left the bar. Feel like they should a discount button or something.

6BjhUYkqLwA4KHZ1G4LILA.text: Commenting on service. I haven't even had a chance to go in and try their food. I placed a reservation for this place on Yelp. My friend got there first, mentioned the reservation, but staff said they can't find it. I even sent a screenshot of the email confirmation to my friend. Still can't find it. I also put a note on my reservations because I have a service dog, just out of courtesy to the business, even though legally I don't have to give notice. My friend mentioned it while staff seated my friend at the bar, but staff asked for a permit for the service dog. Legally not required to have paperwork or vest or any identification for a service dog. Business obviously isn't trained on ADA. Don't go to this place if you have a disability, especially if you have a medical equipment with you. When I try to go here on my healthier days, get welcomed in, and get to try their food, I'd leave another review.

6Nklfg3GBKOxD1Wi03qumg.text: Had a reunion dinner for 10 and the service by Michael was great- fun and knowledgeable. Menu is perfect for all ages and tastes- everyone was very pleased with their selections. Salads, hamburgers and special fries with Parmesan cheese and garlic were great. Also steaks and the Brussel sprouts. Good drinks and Michael made a special one himself for my son.  We had a fun and memorable time!

KI6ysopLRvdXQZ33cJCq8w.text: I've been to Therapy twice now. It was originally recommended to me by a downtown resident who said I HAD to try the mac and cheese. Not being a mac and cheese person, I can't tell you if it's good or bad.  The first visit here was with a couple of omnivores. We sat downstairs, split a good bottle of wine, and tried a bunch of shared plates of which the most memorable was the chicken and waffle sliders. Our consensus on that experience was that it was good, but not great.  This second visit was with a pescatarian. We sat upstairs (crowded) and ordered cocktails as well as the drunken tofu (tasteless), crab dip (heavy layer of scorched cheese on top, all the oily fat was rendered out of the cheese and that did nothing for the blah crab dip underneath), Caesar salad (more blah tastelessness with dressing that was basically mayonnaise), tuna tartare (the one bright spot - lots of flavor and texture with dried lotus chips a nice addition) and the carrot cake (deconstructed - and too sweet).  I would say this is a nice spot to have drinks and people watch, but the food needs work, or at least some salt.

CZ0TqZNB_tlWS2TTz5Sd2g.text: The food was incredible.  Super easy chill vibe and Jonathan, our waiter was super helpful, knowledgeable and shared our love for s'mores!  Must come eat here when in Fremont!

mTKpljx4_sbVmGP_0i8ODw.text: So me and my girlfriend are in the food industry and I work at a tapas restaurant so we love small plates. This place has a wide variety of options and lots of small plates. The host was attentive and friendly a d our server Brandy was absolutely awesome. She made us feel right at home. We started with the bacon wrapped dates... WOW!!! Orgasm in your mouth! Get them and don't ask questions people! Next we got the butter parmesan brussel sprouts. Now those you should only get if you have a goal of getting diabetes. Not saying they are bad, they're delicious. Maybe too delicious lol (too much butter). We finished with the therapy's signiture salad with chicken. It was just what we needed after those brussel sprouts to cleans our palette.

qmWZ86IgdRj2rprXC8t8UQ.text: I have to laugh because they are very aggressive about confirming reservations. I made a reservation for dinner on open table. They then called me to confirm. Then I got a text to confirm, then while we were sitting in the restaurant having dinner they called again to confirm. They might need to get their stuff together. Very annoying. That being said the waiter we had was very friendly and helpful. They food was pretty darn tasty as were the cocktails. We enjoyed the Brussel sprouts, The Shorty and the duck. I would eat all three of those again. And to be glutenous I had to have the s'mores dessert which of course I added bacon too and I was not disappointed. They have lots of gluten free options and are very knowledgeable on the subject and they offer a generous military discount.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten s&#39;mores very good

OQ0dGL6JfKpLt3AOkJNerA.text: Had a great dinner here. Everything on the menu looks wonderful and unique but we had the chicken and waffles and the fried mac n cheese both suggested by Jonathan our waiter. By the way he was awesome! Both dishes had been featured on the Travel  Channel and I can see why. I could have eaten 12 of the mac n cheese croquettes,  they are served on top of bacon tomato jam and top w sriracha sauce- OMG to die for!!! The chicken and waffle was so good, the waffles are red velvet which makes this chicken and waffle slider stand out! Great Service and food makes this place stand out. We will be back to try more on our next trip to Vegas!

cIy5g8UehmmEqCz-Brq8qA.text: So so so good!  We shared the Ricky Ricardo, the chicken sub and the red. Ember chicken and waffles. All amazing with unique flavors. Loved it. The service was excellent.  Dry attentive and Yesenia anticipated our needs in advance. Will be back for sure!!!

UdsJvoGVMVLbS_FpuGoLdA.text: Your most cliche overpriced hipster food. Good? Yes. Great, not so much.  Ordered the following items including the price: 3 different empanadas (oxtail, veggie and spicy chorizo) $21 - they're very small. For 9 pieces, this is definitely a meal for one.   Super mac with bacon $13 - Therapy blend cheese. Not sure what kind of cheese it was but it was okay. When they said blend cheese, I was thinking more like mozzarella, ricotta, etc. Nope. Their house blend.  Crab dip $15 - Gluten free! Yeah I enjoyed this one except the most except the fact that the crab was too salty. Heart attack. Yum.  Chicken meatballs $13 - The green sauce on the bottom is jalapeno pesto. So yeah, it'll be spicy.  Crumbled carrot cake $10 - This is a joke right? You know how hard it was to eat crumbled carrot cake? I tried to fork it and it just fell apart. Still good tho, but I wouldn't eat this again.  So the bottom line is, it's a-okay. I wouldn't really go back here as it's not really worth the price for the small portions of food and okay tasting food. Service was subpar, it felt like a regular restaurant service.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empanadas
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab dip.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super Mac

mRT_ogiH-j7x3Www_2Gyzg.text: Wow!  I was set on Le Thai, because I already love it there, but so glad we came into Therapy for dinner last night to try something new. Here's what our party of 5 experienced:  The Food:  The good:  CHICKEN MEATBALLS - comes with 6, we ate them all, quickly. Tender and savory, I would order these again.   FIRE ROASTED CARROTS - the vanilla bourbon maple syrup was divine. And the feta. Perfect.  SHRIMP CEVICHE - the tomato lime sauce was just so satisfying, I actually was running my fork along my dish to get a few more final tastes when I finished. Well done.   THERAPY SIGNATURE SALAD - the red wine vinaigrette was very acidic, some found it slightly salty, but I enjoyed it. I would like to try the charred kale salad, but I am a sucker for granny smith, candied walnut, and bleu cheese combos..  The not so good:  IN THE "GNUDI" - maybe it was the truffle oil, maybe it was that it was our last dish. It was a miss for me.  HANGAR STEAK TARTAR - with the confit egg and herbs...kind of was like eating meat waiting to be rolled into balls..and I'm a fan of tartar and carpaccio in general.  The neither here nor there:  CAST IRON SMORES - eat it while it's hot. Pretty good, but not memorable.  The Service: it was slammed in here. Park across the street was having an event outside with a half pipe and some snowboards. The bar was in the weeds (we sat there for an hour waiting for our table). We sat for probably 20 minutes without even being greeted, let alone served. With a barback, 2 bartenders, and a runner, I felt like they could have done better with a little assistance from the manager. I saw him, he seemed to be of no help whatsoever. Not sure what he did aside from look around. He didn't talk to guests or step in to make drinks or run anything. Strange. In spite of that, they were clearly trying, and I have been in their shoes. No judgement here.   Our food runner was awesome. Wish I got his name so I could give him the good feedback. Very sweet person.  4 stars instead of 5 for the lack of help on the floor, but they did really well for being so busy. Great food, I would definitely return!  P.S. also, Manhattans are typically made with a swirl of vermouth around the glass, not a shot of it. Not sure if that was intentional. If so, this needs to be reconsidered.

83QvB0xeGYwHf71r6zq4Tw.text: Todd is the best bar tender in Vegas, come to Therapy on Fremont Street. He's also a dead ringer for Harvey Spector on Suits.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With Todd, best bar tender on Fremont Street!!

VWIrCNXvFBzdOPlInkm4Rg.text: Here now. It's amazing. Great beer, wine, and cocktail selection. They have an upstairs...how cool! Will definitely be back to try more. Thank you Christina for the great suggestions.

kq6CPUA0eRDTalLooU_FMg.text: Love that this place exists, but wish it was closer to my house. The ambience inside is super hip with that rustic industrial modern vibe going on. It's fancier than some of the other new places (publicus/glutton/etc) and more restaurant-y than bar-y. The beer and wine and cocktail selections are quite good, with a couple unique beer offerings I hadn't heard of.  I liked the menu: small plates, "new American" style, kinda fancy, heavy on the veggies. Most of these things would be a turn-off to Mr. A., but luckily they had a burger/sandwich menu, too, to keep him interested. I tried the carrots, brussel sprouts, shrimp scampi, and 'in the gnudi.' Liked them all. Loved the gnudi, but it was a pretty big portion for just one person to eat and my husband isn't about to try something involving 'fig jam.' Also it's really rich, so I couldn't finish it. Also loved the carrots (although, again, too sweet for the Mr.). Brussels sprouts were good and shrimp scampi was good, too, but they weren't extra memorable. For 4 small plates and 2 beers, it ran us almost $90 with tax and tip, which seems a little high.  Service was friendly and efficient, but it's just too expensive for 5 stars. Would go back with out of towners or for a cocktail if in the neighborhood.

1PwM6_XSxhKgwWREM4OC0g.text: This place was outstanding. The second we walked through the door JoAnn greeted us, made suggestions, and made us feel welcome. Our bartender, Daniella, was super nice. These gals made our trip so much better. The food...Holy....Fried Mac and cheese, crab dip , and BLT rocked. Just go!!!!

yyFmJ6sQotTlAK6Yh4mmPg.text: Kandice was absolutely amazing...The food is incredible at this location we had a shrimp caeser salad... (I know boring) and the red velvet and fried chicken waffles....incredible taste and Kandice made this a great experience handling the bar and dinkng area and we waited for nothing...highly recommend this spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

De6EaCMQTeqkc4xSxTu7rw.text: Oh my! Yum. We came in for a quick bite before other dinner reservations and had to restrain ourselves from ordering. Chorizo empanadas and Mexican corn! Delicious!!!

68-l-uJcqU9HI3cYlerEVw.text: Eight of us came here to celebrate a birthday.  Perfect! We each ordered appetizers, main dishes, drinks, and, as our waiter was informed, our intent was to sample and share everything on the menu.  We came close to it! We were given extra sharp knives, had large plates on which to put our share of appetizers and meals.  Our waiter, Jonathan, was the best; he made excellent recommendations, was very friendly, took our MANY orders through the evening (requiring many trips to the table as we ordered only two or three things at a time) with good spirits and a smile. JoAnn was the expediter that night, and, boy, did she hustle, moving quickly around the restaurant to help servers, even offering to take a group photo of us when she saw what we were attempting. Three others also helped at our table, bringing water, napkins, dishes, clearing; altogether friendly, observant servers making sure the dining experience was the best. Oh, and the manager came to the table to make sure all was well, which was nice!  Yum for the food! The pork belly was the best I've ever eaten, and I'm glad--as I've had it three or four times before and NOT liked it--that I gave it a try. And finished off the plate.  Be warned if you like fat; there was none. All the other pork belly I've had before was just all fat. This was fall-apart tender and flavorful meat.  The Devils on Horseback appetizer was lovely, as was almost everything else. The only dish we didn't scrape the plate for was the macaroni.  It was creamy smooth, but just too bland even after we added salt and pepper to it. Had we ordered it with bacon, it might have been enjoyed more, but more flavorful cheese needs to be used, or the dish taken off the menu. That being said, we have already decided to return here for our next gathering to repeat some favorites and try the (few!) dishes we didn't get to this time! Bon Appetit!

xlWq9MJjtKP3S_q3hpr_nw.text: *sigh* A bad experience. Did I upset the Food Gods? No idea but I sure did have hell of a lunch date! My date and I arrived at therapy around 2 o'clock to try the beautiful and delicious food we had previously discovered on Yelp. When we walked in we were immediately greeted and sat at a table. Our waiter was a beautiful young lady with dark brown hair that was also working the bar. She went over the menu with us because we were new customers, which I appreciate and took our drink and food order. The food literally took 30 to 45 minutes to cook because we had to leave right when the food came out to go pay for an additional hour for our parking. That was very inconvenient and a bit frustrating the fact that lunch was fairly empty but I guess that's what you get when you go to a restaurant that cooks fresh food. My partners ordered the famous burger and I settled for the red velvet waffle chicken sandwich. The host that greeted us at the door delivered our food.        My face frowned when I looked at my plate. The waffles were obviously very burnt inside and out having a black coating and a smoky smell. I immediately pulled out my phone and compared pictures on the same plate that other people had ordered on YELP & I noticed that everyone else is waffle was a bright red or bright pink color without the burnt glaze. My partner asked me, "Are your waffles burnt??". He waved down who seemed to be the manager on duty. Heavyset Caucasian male over to the table. I politely pointed at the waffles and asked to get a new batch because I received burnt waffles. I had already tried to scarf it down and cover it with mad syrup, but it did no justice.        What made me feel a certain type of way is the fact that the manager sat there and to my face explained that the waffles were not burnt and that they just come that way. The hell.... I don't know if he was trying to be funny or he was blatantly being an a****** looking me dead in my face telling me that these burnt rectangles are perfectly fine. I think he was trying to make me feel stupid!!! But he insisted on making a new batch for me. 7 - 10 minutes later I receive a new batch of red velvet waffles and just as the ones before had a charcoal coat. It. Tasted. Burnt and unappetising. I put all the waffles to the side and simply at the juicy chicken and left hungry. The bartender then came over to check on us. She asked his our food was, but before we could even answer she asked me " Are those burnt???" I shrugged and told her that the manager said they can't this way. She looked at the kitchen and said "oh.." And walked away with a scrunched face back to the bar. When we were done eating we never were given our check because our waiter, the bartender was busy. A birthday girl and her group came in and they ask wanted drinks. The manager is in the corner folding silverware and the host is upstairs, doing whatever. So we had to walk up to the bar to pay. We left no tip.   I was jealous that my partner enjoyed his bomb ass burger and I had shitty food and questionable service considering I only eat at YELP 4-5/5 reviewed restaurants. I am willing to try this place again but I will come for dinner instead to avoid #1 Whoever the Chef was and #2 the manager.   Good Luck

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Replacement Waffles. Bartender agreed they were burnt. I just ate the chicken then left hungry.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You Telling Me This Isnt BURNT?? I feel like the manager was calling me Stupid...
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Initial burnt waffles that I received for the Waffle Sliders. As you can see I tried to happily eat the first one... Just No...

hQ0I12bPlpMVNqdX_AWFzA.text: Great spot for a group. We ordered a lot of dishes to share and glad we did. Empanada trio, brussel sprouts and chimichurri steak stood out. Shrimp cerviche and gnudi were just ok. We also took advantage of the special price wine (Decoy for $30!). I'd recommend making a trip off the strip for the Fremont experience.

snrdtbPXkrc_V9eF6E1gGQ.text: Soooooo good great cocktail hour! Amber was really nice!!! Can't wait to come back for dinner

x_nuYVszH3NeGXDcGOrMYQ.text: Our group went here for a wedding reception. The food and service was fantastic!  The chimichuri steak was probably one of my favorites along with the elotes, both were fantastic!!  Chelsea our server was on point, she kept everyone's glasses full and was very friendly and welcoming. We will be back whenever we come in town!! Thanks for making it a great day everyone!!

5P94ErOx_vSf13R8Y3EdwQ.text: This restaurant is absolutely amazing, definitely one of a kind. It takes you away from the craziness of Fremont and presents and elegant, classy, clean lounge feel. You can lose track of time sitting and talking to friends because it's such a welcoming environment. The gm Maria goes above and beyond for not only her customers but her staff as well. I will continue to visit here based off the hospitality and the amazing experience I had.

uc7TLJa26t1zS2V5FNP7Zg.text: I love this trendy spot located DTLV. Service good and food YUMMY.

QWCJlwUaogfP9VRZ-0vLgQ.text: This place was so good we came for dinner twice in one trip. The servers are as knowledgeable and attentive as servers at a Michelin star restaurant. The menu was varied and interesting without being pretentious. Started with great artisan cocktails which were strong and well made. Over two meals we ended up trying a good part of the menu. Everything was was well balanced, flavorful, creative and delicious. Portion sizes were generous, plating was artful and overall experience was top notch.   Therapy is a welcome retreat from the overpriced underwhelming restaurants on the strip. Make sure to make a reservation, we had trouble getting a seat the second time.

Eo5ymNCLam3DHe1-Fs47pQ.text: Meh. That is all I describe about this place. Looks nice, but the food was nothing special. Do not order their Moscow mules. They don't use ginger beer!!!! They use a ginger beer concentrate and it leaves the drink tasting flat and bad. Honestly was really disappointed since there were decent reviews. Probably the least favorite experience of my trip to Las Vegas.

xmybGh5l7dzSUtBsONBdcw.text: When wondering down Fremont Street, and friend and I happened upon Therapy. It was Happy Hour, which was a plus, and my friend did enjoy their drink specials, even though I stuck to the beer specials, which never disappoint. Not bad pricing for the location, and everyone was extremely friendly. We ate at the bar, and the bartender was very willing to recommend menu items, drinks, and must-sees while we were visiting Vegas. The red velvet chicken and waffles were amazing. The fried mac n cheese was amazing. No complaints here, and I'd definitely visit again.

_MMTjwxVitaCza047Zk4-A.text: Therapy is such a great little spot in DTLV! You have to go here! Our server Joanne was so helpful and attentive; she was great! We had the oxtail empanadas & In the Gnudi from the Bites menu. Yum! Especially enjoyed the gnudi! Enjoyed the Therapy BLT,  portobello mushroom sandwich & you must try Super Mac with lobster! Ended our lunch with the crumbled carrot cake with ice cream. You have to check this place out while in DTLV!  Oh, and drinks. . . the Smashed was awesome!

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Therapy signature salad (the dressing was excellent!)

d3y0emT1L1P1oyp4TAJIyQ.text: I was excited to try this place, but I was very underwhelmed, food was just meh, some of the items that i specifically wanted to try were no longer on the menu..the recommended specialty drinks were pretty nasty to be frank, and it was expensive to boot....Now i know

Exw5wXAxjUdhbWwEuIcZCA.text: Hands down some of the best food in Vegas. We started out with the mac n cheese croquettes and they were to die for. Such a perfect combo of sweet and savory. The french dip was perfection and the side of loaded potatoes has this layer of cheese and pork belly that Im still dreaming about. This will be be a stop every time we are in town. Do yourself a favor and eat here!

AVAYJApQPzKdn3ZFaexEjQ.text: My friends and I drunken-stumbled over to this place from the nearby Commonwealth, after two too many drinks (or 7, who knows?).  We didn't know the kitchen was closing in five minutes, but were relieved when the server let us order anyway.  We paid them a pretty penny for our late night nosh, so, good on them for recognizing the Drunk Hunger when it's ready to fork over their charge cards.  Not many options for pescatarian little-me, but I made do with the delicious lime-crema infused street corn and some ridic truffle fries.  My friends made me try bites of their other (insanely delicious) food, after picking out huge globules of bacon or pancetta.  That being said, if I were to visit this place again at a reasonable hour I would see if they could make me their truffle mac sans meat.  It would be worth the (probable) dirty looks from the kitchen just to try.  While our tab wasn't cheap, I felt the food was delicious enough to be decent value.  I'd go again in a heart beat.  Old Strip is greater than New Strip.

RxYUVfkDHujMrdkV-ty45Q.text: I want to really like this place because I enjoy new dining options in DTLV. However, this place just wasn't doing it for me. I believe they're going through an identity crisis? Though, I'm not quite sure.   I would like to say the hostesses greeting guests were very friendly, welcoming, and so was the bartender who served us, however, friendly only gets you so far.   First we took a look beer and wine list and the beer list is quite extensive and we had many questions about the different beers, unfortunately the bartender didn't know very much or even know how to pronounce them. They also server frozen drinks, which I thought was a bit odd considering it's all inside and it definitely isn't a pool.   Next, many "manager" or "owner" type guys were looming around (maybe they owned the place, maybe not). Now, I understand it was the first night, but none of these guys really seemed to be professionals, we weren't greeted by them, or asked how we enjoyed ourselves or anything. The reason I knew they had something to do with the place is because they seemed to have set up shop in the corner or the bar doing their work, eating, drinking (it was a big glup type drink, classy) all in view of the guests. If you are the manager or owner you should be greeting ever guest walking in your door on opening night, not just your buddies, and ask how everyone is doing.   The food was good, and this it was I'm actually rating my review on. We had the roasted cauliflower which is one of my favorites anywhere. This was super oily though, so for me I probably wouldn't order it again. The summer squash flatbread was great and my boyfriend really enjoyed the oxtail empanadas. None of the dishes were to die for, but they were good.  If this place is going to be more like a sports bar than a tapas experience then I probably won't be running back, especially if the owners/managers carried themselves the way they did.

c_LeJctng8e-UYCIcfV88w.text: This place is a gem amongst the chaos of Freemont Street! We just happened upon this restaurant with it's eclectic menu and chill atmosphere. The beer selection its great, with over 50 choices, and all unique. This place boasts specialty cocktails (hence the name Therapy) but we are more beer people, and were pleasantly surprised! The menu had so many amazing looking dishes, we ended up ordering our top three and splitting them, and they were all great. Our server, Jonathan, was top notch and extremely helpful!  The entire staff was friendly and attentive. Overall a great dining experience!

n1ka98gdJfukJ9GFKf2OkQ.text: First and far most, our server GEORGY was amazing! Great attitude, always smiling, very genuine, and was so attentive with our table and other tables, prompt, professional, and helpful to our first visit! She's an asset to your restaurant. We loved the Ahi, the stuffed dates and the chimmichuri steak. The "gnudi" was good, next time we'll ask for easy on the fig spread... it was very sweet/iverpowering, still good. Our salad was very fresh, very crisp greens and we ordered the toppings and vinaigrette on the side. Atmosphere was very pleasant and enjoyable. Great central location to downtown. We didn't drink this evening but drinks looked superb that were being delivered to tables and everyone seemed happy. Can't wait to go back and try more of their great food. Ask for GEORGY! she was AWESOME.

r5XhVjcBivUgmOX9S8uPyw.text: Every single time I come here I get the oxtail empanadas and they are the most delicious little bites ever! The meat is tender, the sauce is a perfect mixture of spicy and sweet! All the other food is great too!! Fast, friendly service right in the heart of Downtown Las Vegas!

lvzP_yzIkgG35jtZDgCDwQ.text: First time here as a local and won't be my last. Great food., Great atmosphere, Great service.  Jason greeted us on arrival and Chelsea was our server who was outstanding.  Who can ask for anything more!

z5CHBQweNV1V0-XkW8UE_g.text: I give Therapy 4-5 stars for food, 2-3 for customer service, and 3 for drinks. Came here on a Saturday night so it was fairly busy. That being said, you shouldn't have to ask 5 times where your appetizer is. Yes, we had to ask at least 5 times where our chicken meatballs were. It was at least 45 min wait to get them. Clearly, the waiter was just to busy to get our food on time and at least once our meatballs were given to another table. The food was pretty good. Pricey, but good. I had the salmon and devils on horseback. Drinks were definitely watered down. I don't drink often but there definitely wasn't much alcohol in them. Dessert was good except for the cheesecake.

aHDx52NU-70cTbZSwCxqYg.text: It was a wonderful Day Date with my lady. What I loved about this place ...Excellent customer service, College football games, inviting atmosphere, tasty drinks. If you like Bloody Mary cocktails, try one here.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow, for one cocktail. Pricey.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail empanadas
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary; smashed berry cocktail

ZQfJXAcUhJSjAACUBcD1fg.text: I went to Therapy for dinner two nights in a row on Jan 29, 2018 and January 30.  I had the same server each night (Mike) and extremely attentive and friendly service from him and nice conversations with the manager.  On the first night, I started with a Caesar salad (with bacon, which is a really nice addition).  It was fresh and delicious from the crispy croutons to the flavorful dressing with a twist of garlic.  Presented beautifully.  Then I ordered the chimichurri steak and parmesan fries.  The steak smelled funny to me, chemical-like and I munched on my fries (outstanding) until Mike came back.  I tasted one bite.  I explained to Mike that I thought the steak tasted like it had been cooked over a gas grill and had the flavor of lighter fluid.  I have probably sent back about 3 orders in my entire middle aged life, so I felt bad about it, but Mike was very reassuring and I had a new steak before long.  It was delicious, had a beautiful balance of some acid and some sweet (lime I think) and some smoky flavors.  It had been marinated and was perfectly cooked to the medium rare I love.  I ate every bite.  I did not care for the onion straws on top, they were rubbery.  But I had plenty to eat with the fries.  The manager stopped by my table to apologize and offered me new fries with my steak (very nice but I declined as I had my fill even though they were amazing).  She and Mike were just concerned that I had a good experience and that I felt no guilt at all.  They both handled it beautifully and I felt so comfortable I went back the next night.  I ate more lightly the next night (I'm in LV for work and was by myself both times, at a nice table in this beautiful and elegantly simple- decorated restaurant.  I love the calm atmosphere.  Mike greeted me by name, which I found incredibly impressive and remembered I drink unsweetened ice tea.  The manager also came by and offered me a cappucino on the house-- very sweet.  I had the bacon wrapped dates which were an incredible combination with goat cheese and truffle and this to-die-for red pepper sauce.  Also filling, then I had dessert and the chocolate in the s'mores made me want to lick the plate, just the fix I needed.  When I return to Las Vegas, I will definitely visit Therapy again.  It does have something special-- human connection that you don't often find in restaurants.  I travel solo for business pretty frequently, and this is the first time in 25 years that I've been welcomed back like I'm a regular.  I very much appreciated that and the delicious food.  It was a great experience both nights I was there.  If Mike and the manager and the others who refilled my tea and checked on me as I was working on my computer are reading this, thank you.

JyJEEZq1CxMA8x9CijuHSA.text: Great restaurant right off Fremont.  I ordered the Chicken Fried Chicken and Carrot Cake for desert.

oxwYMFPJR3DcuCb-Ujt37w.text: OMG!!  If you are a foodie you need to check this place out!  Great drinks and interesting food fusions.  Nice size small plates so you can try a few different things for happy hour or dinner!  Staff was very knowledgeable and attentive.

GQeLVHAvjB5djMesw4BO8w.text: First time here at TherapyLV! Happy Hour pulled us in and by far this is the best happy Hour spot in down town vegas!!! Go in and ask for Kimberly she is DOPE!!!

E_GG0tqIQVJ7p_rKgsRIMA.text: There are a few times in life when a beer is so expertly poured and nothing short of genius. Last night I had one of those beers at Therapy courtesy of Kim.  I come to visit her at Therapy every week while I travel to Las Vegas for work because of the great service and great beer.

GBcOQt5gc6wq25SKt5uq2Q.text: If you want to go at dinner time you may want to think about a reservation. This is a popular place. It's tight, tables are very close. You have to stay focused on your conversation with the company you are with because the conversations at the table next to you can encroach(this from a man with ADHD). Service is beyond reproach. Food is excellent.  I would eat here weekly, except I have ADHD. When I'm on Fremont and walk by looking for a place to eat there are people waiting. I need to start making a plan in advance so I can get reservations. If you have never been here you need to make the effort.

ovhmqPxZPJWLYB-nbZLmiA.text: Yummy yummy! Great music, great vibes, & wonderful staff. The food was delish and creative. Ordered the steak tar tar, Mexican corn, ox tail empanadas, blt which was served on a croissant and the chicken meatballs. Faves were the empanadas and the corn.

EnGAYHJowaPOlERriqNYRw.text: I thoroughly enjoyed this dining experience. Great hamburger, ambiance and service. Three large screen TVs in front of the bar but didn't exactly feel like a sports bar the TVs were muted and they were playing soft tasteful music. I don't think there's another place of this type in this part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great ambiance

JgMkBolnJGGxKNjme471iQ.text: The venue itself is really nice! It's hard to believe that it used to be a cheesy souvenir shop before. It has a modern industrial look to it now, plenty of space and really clean.   The reason for the 2 star review:  1. They had great happy hour specials ( I showed up at 11 on a thursday). Me and my friends ordered a bunch of four roses whiskeys on the rocks....for $5 bucks! Fantastic deal. Then the bill comes.....they charged for ice! Yes ice! We asked the bartender if the drink listed was part of the happy hour and she confirmed that it was. And somehow we didn't get the $5 dollar price. I looked over the menu after getting the bill and it didn't say anything about a charge for ice. I'm surprised that they didn't charge of for the use of the cups. Just absurd. Be aware of extra hidden charges!  2. The DJ blasts the music!. He plays nothing but club edm, which is fine. However, there isn't a dance floor at all. Not a huge deal, but it didn't make sense to me.

Wg1gacNZNVyN-w9yorhQew.text: We had a party of eight, all of whom were satisfied with their meal. All good, not great. Very cool ambiance mixing modern with industrial. I ordered the  chimichurra steak  at the recommendation of our server: a inexpensive cut ( still $25 on menu) which was diced w/chimichurra sauce: again good, not great. My wife ordered their filet which was oddly cut in half, assuming the chef was checking temperature in a rudimentary way. Who cuts a filet in half and serves that way? Again just good, barely. Here's why we wont go back: All seperate checks without discussion from server and my check (not my wife and I) actually had a $3 charge to put ice in my Crown Royal. WTF?? I get I'm spending $11 for a top shelf whiskey but to add $3 for ice??  When asked, the manager said when a guest asks for " on the rocks" it makes it a double. It wasn't.  The line items on my check said: Crown Royal: $11:00 and the next line said: ice: $3:00. With the dining options downtown We're done with Therapy.

4ozIddjMR6mLYXHWurHsgw.text: French dip still has me salivating! Amazing food and service, especially Michael Moran, who is the best! He's also soon to be a supporter of Discovery Children's Museum when he wins his $1000!

TyqTQAQ7viH0T1yXfWkrGQ.text: Wonderful experience overall from beginning to end! Welcomed as soon as we entered, sat immediately, our server Michael Moran was totally on top of all our needs! Food tasted amazing and was quickly placed on our table after we ordered. Michael did not let our glasses be empty for a single second. Thank you we will 150% return and tell our friends!

ANTZw-ITpu2tqhiKZrQzpQ.text: We came here after reading other Yelp reviews. Excellent chicken fried chicken! Thank you to Jonathan for your recommendations and the service. Everyone was friendly and upbeat.

6OAQyaPVSMYXFeLRdy2NWw.text: Amazing customer service Roger is awesome, ambiance is great, and food is excellent! I will be returning and telling friends and family to try this restaurant out as well. I adore the 2nd level loft area.

_UO4Ty5cPII_RLdSS-vrSA.text: Although I had a good time here and the drinks were alright, the service was poor. I had questions about the menu and our waitress who I'm pretty sure was a manager seemed a bit snooty as if I was ignorant for not knowing some of the french terms. Might come back here, might not.

hXQKpZKnJaVMTmEpFhFZxg.text: Great food and atmosphere, original architecture. Mac- n -cheese was great. A must stop. Go to Vegas for therapy!

xzS52monWgwePM2WcR3XNw.text: One of the best meals we've ever had. The name is fantastic and we left feeling amazing and full. The food was fresh, unique, and so delicious. The owner was working side by side with the amazing staff to ensure an epic dining experience. They truly have a passion for perfect food. We live in AZ and this will always be a guaranteed stop when we come to Vegas.

sEZAPDhvDLwAyQn0Nc4daA.text: I really wanted to love the food here.  On paper, each menu item sounded flavorful and creative, but I'm sad to say that just wasn't the case for me.  I will start by saying that two of the items we ordered were pretty danged good:  the oxtail empanadas and the chicken meatballs.  The rest, however, wellllllll let's just say very underwhelming.  We ordered the baked truffle ricotta "In the Gnudi" and although the cast iron skillet it was served in was screaming hot, the cheese itself was cold and hard and I was not a fan of the crostini that was served with it; too sweet when combined with the truffle and honey on the ricotta.  The lobster mac n cheese sounded delish as well, but quite frankly was bland and fishy tasting and smelling.  Took one bite and that was more than enough.  Lastly, we ordered the barramundi sliders, and again bland and fishy.  The kitchen should probably consider fresher fish offerings.  It reminded me of walking into a grocery store's meat department and smelling spoiled fish.  Not good.  The atmosphere is amazing however.  Love the high ceilings, brick walls, open floor and bar area.  And of course, it's hard to beat the setting of Downtown Vegas among all of the revitalized businesses and Arts District.  Maybe the kitchen was having an off night, I'm not sure, as this place didn't live up the reviews we'd read.  Unfortunately we won't know, because we most likely won't go back.

XI3CbYAts1HSmGwAHlr7XA.text: Amazing food, super bubbly and nice owner.  The house cocktails are small but the food is amazing! Had the corn, burger, and shrimp scampi.

DWuY2lu_bufDJyTphd9YAw.text: Excellent. ..food is fabulous. ...drinks spectacular. ....Roger Seaholm is the very best  and Georgie is the best waitress.....love this restaurant. ...

LVfWh7O12k0Et2dJVRNnPg.text: Been here twice in the past few weeks based on first visit with the wife and then went back with a group on our recommendation based on our enjoyment.  First is its in a great location off Fremont Street extension to the east just a block down.  The area is hopping with new places, bars, restaurants and shops.  Great vibe in the area and Therapy definitely adds to this atmosphere.  It is combination of small, sharable plates with a few well executed main dishes that knows what it is and what it does well.  We shared multiple small plates with our favorites being the oxtail empanadas, pork sliders, the meat/cheese plate, Caesar salad w/ chicken and chicken meatballs.  All were really good and great portion for sharing and trying new things.  The table went crazy for the Mac & cheese which is so rich and creamy with some bacon thrown in.  Ordered a second batch after the first one disappeared.  We never made it to the entrees since the small plates were so filling and reasonably priced for sharing.  The bar did some great cocktails with the Lemon drop going over well with the ladies and lots of craft beer selections for guys and some good scotch selections for the real men.  Service was excellent from Georgi and the manager stopped by several times to visit and check in.  Make this place happen.

aein73dRnGJ7k2dKkw1DBQ.text: Pretty unimpressed. The appetizers are way pricy, as much as an entree almost and not even enough for one person to eat let alone 2 to share. We had 8 people and got 4 appetizers and each of us got one bite of each appetizer . My husband and I split the big sexy hamburger and that was fine because it was fairly large. When we said we were going to split it he said he would cut it into 4ths!? Haha. We told him in half would be fine. We ordered it medium and our friends ordered a big sexy medium as well and ours came out literally like raw hamburger meat and our friends was exactly what medium should look like. When we asked to have it cooked more we could hear the cook arguing with the waitress about how it was cooked medium. He sounded like he was trying to send it back to us?! I was appalled. He cooked it more but it was still pretty pink. We said whatever because by then our party was all done with their food and we were just starting. The waiters were pretty snooty and sometimes just straight up ignored us. The one very bright spot was the Mac and cheese appetizer. Holy hannah that was good mac and cheese. Too bad it was $10 and I got one bite

O3p3sgwT5eMBrpQ4eQsbYA.text: Took some friends from out of town here on a Sunday for dinner.  We all were impressed with the quality of the food and the service.   The menu is tapas style, but their entrees are certainly enough for lunch or dinner.  What impressed us the most about this place was the attention to detail in the food.  Each dish had a perfect balance of flavors that made you want to savor each bite, and that is a rarity in most other  restaurants in this price range where quantity substitutes for quality.

ktQKwdr7ox471CpF_yDcqQ.text: Great food. Happy hour is average, not much on it. But the appetizers are amazing. And the staff is nice and very helpful & pleasant. Only real complaint is they dont turn the sound on for football despite having 3 large and nice tv's to show em on. We ended up leaving to go somewhere to hear the game. Otherwise we woulda stayed. A great date spot tho. And the food is a solid 9!

Roger was so sweet to me and my coworkers, answering all the questions we had about the place. We will definitely go back!

Prs-kC3q2I_P6EQcSNsYpg.text: We stopped in for Sunday brunch and it was a treat. The oxtail empanadas were a perfect way to start it off. The red velvet and fried chicken sliders were perfect balance of sweet and savory. And since we were celebrating a birthday we shared the carrot cake crumble which is a must!  Place is clean and staff is friendly.

Ni5XRHGPPmBlKIklm6lz_w.text: Love this place! Will keep coming back for that chimichurri steak! I also love the corn, might even be my favorite dish on the menu. Great place for large parties, lots of sharable plates offered.

PdJnlROvavvIF-QWGuMngw.text: Superrrr delicious.  Like everything we ordered and we ordered ALOT.  Our fav was the Cuban sandwich.  Michael the bartender was super great too!
