Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The looks, the service, the food, stick with therapy.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Per my  fiancée, and she knows she a real Mexicana ; &#34;Best Shrimp Ceviche&#34; in town.

rPxzIBEClshqhI5utV4VEw.text: Updated review here:  For some reason, I always end up at Therapy when friends are visiting because it's just so easy so I guess this is a nice place to take out of towners. Parking this time was a b$6#@ but our waiter JASON was so wonderful as to give us an insider tip. Sorry, yelpers. I can't tell you the secret. Guess you'll have to go and ask JASON next time you're dining there. Thanks, JASON. You da best!  Between the 4 of us, with no drinks, our tab was around $90 before tip. No bad.  We ordered the Oxtail Empanadas, Chimichurri Steak, Crab Dip, Caesar Salad and another salad. Can we talk about this Ceasar salad again? I don't know why but I am addicted to the Ceasar salad here. It's just so simple with just enough dressing. I think it's because they cut the romaine lettuce into perfectly bite size pieces. You know when you have to shove a big piece of lettuce into your mouth? It's just not cute!   Anyways, I think this place is going to be on my regular list pretty soon. Thanks for a wonderful evening, JASON!  ***  Honestly, I love this place because it's a cool hipster hangout spot. (I'm sorry if this is offensive to you) I love the warehouse feel with the high ceilings and ventilation ducts? I really don't know what those are for but it looks industrial and cool. And their chairs! Who doesn't love to have dinner while sitting in nice chairs! So important! I also like the waiters and bartenders here. They make strong drinks and are dressed REAL NICE.   This scene is definitely my kind of vibe. This is a great place to catch up with an old friend for drinks and appetizers. A lot of it will be on the heavier side. One of the dishes we ordered was the CEVICHE. It was recommended to us but it wasn't my favorite thing. Guess I'm just used to the old traditional way rather than a new twist. All good, though. Everything else we had was spectacular, including my CEASAR SALAD. No really. It was a really good caesar salad. Just the way I expect it to be!

pexIqw5-L1DPoqrrP2gdTg.text: Stopped in after the CES show. We had the burger and tuna tar-tar meals, and the Devils on Horseback (for starters); this is an amazing dish with bacon-wrapped dates on a bed of Romesco. Food was great, quick and our server Brandee was very attentive --would definitely come back!

gVWNI1JFZDOGOKff92ylNA.text: This is probably the worst service received. We waited over 20min to get seated, over 30min to take our order (not to mention someone in our party got 3 water cups dumped on him which wasn't a problem). Food came out very quick!! Food was good. Not once did we get checked in to see if we needed anything so we couldn't tell the waitress we were missing all our alcoholic beverages that came seconds before food as the bartender was too busy flirting with the guys at the bar. Drinks came, food came and we were still missing one drink which we couldn't get the waitress attention to let her know. We finished our meals and waited for the check that seemed like an eternity. We did nothing but wait for a long time for everything. There was a guy with a purple shirt running around like a chicken with his head cut off. They weren't even apologetic about the fact that we were neglected on.

RHN8jQ7zZrMUkI1LR2bhrw.text: I do have to say that I'm torn between a 3.5 star rating or a 4 star rating when it comes to Therapy. So I guess you can say it's somewhere in the middle there. Therapy offers a classier than your usual Fremont restaurant atmosphere. It is definitely fancier and nicer looking than a lot of the restaurants you find on Fremont street, especially so close to the Fremont Street Experience area.   I've been to Therapy about two times now. The first time was short -- we only ordered the crispy fried pig ears and the fire roasted street corn. Along with those, we ordered two drinks.. the smash and the devil eyes. The pig ears were delicious. It was fried perfectly with some yummy seasoning .. it was on the saltier side of things. If you have had pig ears before, it's pretty gelatinous when you eat them deep fried. The cartilage is also not as hard as they usually are. They're pretty much melted. The fire roasted street corn was amazingly delicious. That lime aioli that goes with it is just perfect. It adds just enough of a tang to the corn. The drinks, on the other hand, was nothing to write home about. The flavors were missing and the watered down alcohol is the only thing that sticks in my memories.  The second time we went, we ordered the crispy fried pig ears, the fire roasted street corn, mixed mushroom flatbread, and the "big sexy." The crispy fried pig ears were a miss this time around. They were essentially burnt with no flavor. We had to get them to remake it for us and even when they remade them, it was still not as good as the first visit. It had too much batter with little to no seasoning. The fire roasted street corn was still very delicious. The mixed mushroom flatbread was amazingly delicious. The poached egg on the flatbread just brought all the flavors together in a whirlwind of tastyness. The "big sexy" .. the meat in the burger is very well seasoned. The tomato that they used and the brie that they used was definitely a different spin on everything. Overall, it meshed in perfectly.   We sat upstairs during our second visit and the service was slow. I guess no one wants to walk the stairs! Haha. Therapy is a good place to try some out of the ordinary food. However, the prices are a bit on the high side. Four pieces of corn for $8? Yeah, talk about steep for certain things that you can get for less than a dollar. Nonetheless, it's still a decent place just to grab a bite or two with a group of friends.

VFUSNA08uZBOfBb2DDCy3Q.text: I wasn't sure what to get when our server June recommended the Ricky Ricardo. It was my first time having a cuban sandwich and it was delicious! The plantains were excellent as well.

8c34YPfuQ4QEzuUYAYI6qA.text: After reading all the reviews, my husband and I were excited to try it tonight. I was really disappointed. I had the Mac and cheese with chicken, and the chicken was over cooked and the macaroni was flavorless. It wasn't an expensive dinner but it was still not worth the money. I'm not sure I will try it again.

57bQ4DcMd8F2dan_01YcbQ.text: Food was excellent! Our server Michael was terrific; he was knowledgeable about the menu and he recommended the Cuban sandwich, which was delicious. Zeke kept our drinks full and was very courteous. We will come back!

3fb_5cEaC_uxKsBmkKq4RA.text: Outstanding craft drinks and a great menu.  The Devils on Horseback (bacon wrapped dates filled with goat cheese) and Perfect Cure meat and cheese tray were amazing.  Robert provided excellent service and we would recommend this well appointed establishment to anyone.

OQ2gPsRdHyFehC9GbvbhYA.text: I never write yelp reviews but everything we tried at Therapy was FABULOUS and the customer service was great. Highly recommend for a date or a relaxed night out with friends.

sVcrX17G3iBMNCvm35zhRA.text: Service and food exceeded my expectations. Would definitely recommend this establishment for any type of enjoyment! And will absolutely go back!

T-gi4kaWtRKbK6_7JwX82w.text: My husband and I came on a Friday night and I was happy to be seated right away. Our server was friendly and explained the idea of the menu well. We ordered drinks and they were just okay, my sangria tasted a lot like syrup. Definitely not worth the price of the drink, but I guess downtown that's to be expected. Our food was really good! 5/5 for sure. We shared the oxtail empanadas, brussel sprouts, and mac-n-cheese. I would recommend adding something to the pasta since it was very plain but still flavorful. We had dessert too which was excellent. Our main complaint was the atmosphere. We found it confusing, whether it was nice dining, a sports bar, or a night club. It was very dark inside and the music was so loud, and it was top-40 style dance music. Not something I want when I'm paying $100 for some drinks and small plates. We will probably come back again because the food was really good and the variety of the menu would be perfect for any type of eater. I would probably order wine next time and make sure to sit close to my husband so we are not shouting at one another at the table.

3vEeZ_Fsx0RzrzxcooO8CQ.text: We came here the day after Veteran's day to celebrate a birthday.  Since it was a large group of people, we got an opportunity to try majority of the items straight from yelp!  The specialty drinks were delicious and I have to say the environment was quite nice too.  We were handed a very large bill haha but the waitress was able to give us 20% off because my friend is in the Army.  All in all I would come back again but maybe with a smaller group since we've narrowed down our favorites.

e4MNFBSMsoaIF5enrcuUJQ.text: Joann was AMAZING!!  She always made sure my drinks were full and recommended great food.  Can't wait to come

mztEvTdJOeH4uEeuulZAsA.text: I took a chance by walking into this restaurant with some friends and let me tell you, I don't regret a second of it. As soon as I walked in, I was presented with the fresh ambiance of a casual yet classy all American pub. We were greeted by the general manager, Maria, who took the time to have a conversation with us while suggesting certain items on the menu. She was helpful and pleasant to talk to. She checked up on us from time to time and made sure our first time there would be nothing short of an amazing dining experience. It took me a while to decide what to eat because everything sounded delicious. I decided to go with  the shorty which was a braised short rib. Once it was handed to me, my mouth started salivating. It was tender and cooked to perfection. The bar manager Kristina had made me their signature gin cocktail, fly me to the moon, and not only was the drink great, but she also made us feel like welcome. Kristina is very personable and definitely has a talent when it came to bartending. Kristina was walking back and forth behind the bar all night making and dropping off drinks and can I just say that both the front and back view were sights I'll never forget. Although the restaurant was busy, the staff still took their time in talking to their customers and making sure everything was up to par. To say that this place has exceeded my expectations is an understatement.

LJXCzr5X39wt6fq1KWLIKA.text: My first time there and I needed help picking out something from the menu. My server Robert was very helpful and patient with me. I ended up ordering the French dip because I'm more of a plain Jane eater. The horseradish on there was delicious. Great food and great service!

kTcTjeLB7mxgoWAKs42S-A.text: I was told this place is too expensive for what it is, therefore I didn't have the desire to try it. Today, there were no other options for us to go for lunch and was kinda "forced" to eat here. Glad we did! While I can agree it is expensive, I believe it is worth it because the portions are huge and it is delish! Do try the Empanada Trio to include the Oxtail. Mac and Cheese is truly cheesy and creamy, one of the top Mac n Cheese I've had. Also ordered the Ceviche, they have their own take on it. I can't say it's the best, but it's quite good. The portions are so huge I didn't get to eat my main meal (which I'm going to share with my daughter), BLT, we had a bite of the chips that came with it and it was great and peppery. The only thing I would change is the bread used for the BLT, they use croissant. It's still good overall. If we are to go back, I'll order less appetizers and just go for the fried chicken sub, which looked amazing when it passed me by.

COcTMxFfowtRK7IfzhbRDQ.text: This was an awesome and surprising find on Fremont Street!  We actually visited it twice during our stay it was so good.  The Gnudi is to die for, the chicken and red velvet chicken slider over the top and the chicken meatballs excellent.  To top it off we celebrated my birthday with a deconstructed carrot cake with brown butter ice cream.  We were in Heaven.  Jared has a great thing going here and next time we are in Vegas it will be our go to place!  Thanks  Ron & Jon

BK8jwMz7D1vYa9V2lcGEFw.text: Went there on a Monday night with a party of eight.  Had a bunch of apps to start.  Our favorite was the gnuudi (sp?)..hands down.  The popcorn was a disappointment for $7..way to small of a portion.  Empanadas were average.  Steak Tar tar was outstanding and all the flavors meshed well together.  Mac and cheese was also a hit.  In all, the appetizers were solid but the portions were too small for the price.  Draft beers - Not sure if it was me but the draft beer glasses looked to be a 12 oz pour and should be 16oz pints.  Also the wine and cocktails pours looked short..mgmt please review.  Strip maybe can get away with this but not downtown.  Entrees were spot on.  I had the best kale salad ever, and im normally not a kale salad fan.  The Char took it to another level.  Everyone else at the table was pleased with their entrees.  Burger, French Dip, Flat bread, and Caesar salad from what I remember  Desserts were to die for.  Had the Smores and the carrot cake which the server talked us into.  So glad she did because its not your typical carrot cake...much better and executed.  The service was perfect and the staff was always there if you needed anything without being intrusive.  Nice addition to the DTLV dining scene.

c5cXYQGeM7UvAAyzx0sZdA.text: bacon wrapped dates came burnt, poke was same as anywhere with a nice presentation. if you have been to yard house and or hearthstone you know the menu. mac and cheese was mac and cheese. wife asked for med/well burger and got a mostly pink center, she said the bun was good with a snicker. service was a poor spot for this place and I feel its not the common food that will tank them but the poor service. 15 min to get drink order, 10 more before the waiter cam back around so we ordered apps before we were ready not knowing how long it would be before we saw him again. they need someone on the floor pushing these people to deliver good service. that's what will keep customers coming back. not me though, at this price range the first chance to deliver is the only chance.

fIdbli8PMcy_3IabZ3onzw.text: June was a fantastic host and bartender. Great wait staff, terrific food. Priced right. Fantastic experience.

vnL7XU2AlC1CFS4B0c8O-Q.text: They served orida fries with there steak! They also told me I was getting wild caught salmon when it clearly was farm raised. Not wise to lie to your customers.

R3VYGaUhBV765foF7Vu89A.text: Not as good as expected. The chicken meatballs were tough. Crab artichoke dip was good. Other stuff was in the middle too.

HdMRPehMRb9LhomCFWAhFA.text: My family and I had the best lunch at Therapy! Georgie was awesome and gave us all her best recommendations. Thumbs up for Therapy and Georgie!!!

-miwdj62yAxdbAmAjN0qbw.text: So disappointing! The food looked great but they were so not a friendly staff- especially the stuck up host. Got seated after 10 minutes upstairs to " no mans land" with thrown together last minute place settings near the restrooms. Waited 20 minutes to take our order so we just decided to leave. The hostess didn't even bother to inquire why we were leaving. Wow!

wmmrsBaFfCyFmVvd_a9k8Q.text: What an amazing gastronomic experience! We had heard good things, but this subtle, humble gastro pub turned out to be one of the best meals we have ever had! My wife and I were visiting the LV area for the weekend with two great friends and decided to have dinner here on a Friday night. We were seated in a very comfortable spacious booth with a great view of the excellently appointed dining hall-like atmosphere. We started with wonders gin cocktails mixed with muddled fresh blackberries (our server's recommendation) and shared both a chorizo empanada and chicken meatball appetizer that were incredible! After another cocktail, my wife and I started with undoubtedly the best Caesar salad  we've ever had. Even though the menu is filled with tempting delights, our table settled on four different entrees. Our friends had the French Dip sandwich (OMG) and the Therapy Salad (generous portion and ultra fresh). My wife ordered the Red Velvet Chicken and Waffles (probably the best thing at the table--delicious!), and I tried the Wagyu Beef Burger with a fried egg and bacon on top (no words to describe except YUM!). We also had sides of the loaded mashed potatoes and 4 cheese mac--insanely good! This meal would have been $200 elsewhere (and worth it!) but it was literally half of that. I have been in the restaurant and food business for over 30 years and Therapy was one of the best meals I've ever had. Service great! Ambiance lively and great! Chef Talen's menu, quality, and presentation is to die for!!

VGu2BDv12WN2pFGPyZhEeg.text: Came here with a couple friends.. saw the pictures of the food.. looked great! We were just wanting a nice meal. We ordered Brussel sprouts, crab artichoke dip, man n cheese with chicken, and shrimp scampi,, well crab artichoke was great, the Brussel sprouts were WAYYY over cooked!! Yes it says "char" but they were ovvvver char for sure .. burnt crisp that's all u could taste!!! Then the man n cheese tasted like the white shells u buy in a box no extra flavor at all.. that was $11 PLUS $7 for a tiny piece of chicken!! So $18 mac n cheese u can make at home! Nothing special! Thennnn the shrimp scampi came out, my friends dig into the first shrimp, then saw MOLD on the shrimp!!! We called the waitress over she said it looked DISGUSTING and was as shocked as we were!  So the manager comes over, says okay well we took those items off but the Brussel sprouts are supposed to be "charred" and also that shrimp we char those too so that was a char mark, no other shrimp was "charred" Omg since when is a char mark in a circle and a green black color?? He just made an excuse and blamed it on charring.. basically didn't even say sorry..   The only good thing about this place is location atmosphere and our waitress took good care of us. Other than that, u would get better food elsewhere DONT WASTE UR MONEY THE FOOD IS NOT WORTH IT AND ARE TINY OVER PRICED PORTIONS!

UZYf5b4vO_ca0fal8kQCZQ.text: Met up with my friends for food and drinks before a night on the town (locals btw). We were luckily served by Michael (knowledgeable and gifted server), who knew that we needs drinks and appropriately delicious food. 5 stars from starts to finish. We'll be back. Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashioned, cold shot of tequila, and a moscow mule - TGIF!

yQhftcib2U_STmBHkXccVA.text: My husband and I saw this place in an article of places to try downtown. We are super happy we came. We had the Big Sexy Burger with fries and the Super Mac and cheese (we added bacon). Everything was so delicious and cooked to perfection. We shared the meal and it was portioned perfectly to do so where we were both satisfied and full. We will definitely come back. The only reason for a 4-star instead of a 5-star is the price was slightly over what we thought it should have been. That won't keep us from coming again, however.

53M9BcvblqCxtZzZYY49Uw.text: After 3 visits I feel the food and service here is consistently above average.  I enjoyed the  Portabello Mushroom Sandwich, the Braised Short Ribs and the Sliced Chimichurri Steak.  Their Caesar Salad is large enough to share.    There is no parking lot or street parking on their property.  However, I have not had any trouble finding street parking a block or two away (even on a Friday night).  And, there are parking lots nearby.  Located between the Fremont Street Experience and the Container Park makes this an easy walk from either direction.

tN4rMsSrCZ5N32fSdhQ76Q.text: First time in downtown Las Vegas and this was the first place to pop up on google. Amazing cocktails, and even more amazing service. Thank you Shannon and Blake!! Will definitely be here from now on during our stays in Vegas :)

ZUgP5m-4zCe3qaPLrTkEEw.text: After a few hours wandering and being touristy on the strip, we were questioning if we'd be able to find a truly local dinner spot in Las Vegas. Luckily we decided to head downtown earlier than originally planned and found this local hot spot. I felt immediately at home among the beards, thick-rimmed glasses and flannel diners. The food was delicious, the recipes unique and the drinks on point.

hhqgQfVTyFL9I7k4MEPz0g.text: Kim made an excellent beverage based on what I told her I liked.  Food was excellent!

3C174ayDQpVxacBtTt0bIw.text: Great staff. So friendly and helpful. Food has a beautiful presentation and is even more delicious. Id recommend it to anyone. Prices are so reasonable for the quality. Be sure to try the gnudi if it's still available!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnudi. Outstanding!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Smash! Cocktail

qIvUyKgdsau2uAGnrrJvOg.text: Kim is life!!!! The 4 days I stayed in vegas me and my friends stopped there everyday before we did anything! I'm not sure if it was for the great food and drinks or for kim lol but she always made sure we had a great time! I will deff return to the bar there whenever I go back to vegas. Sincerely row-bear-tow.

V9tHW3aoYe9yK8ps6ZA5Rg.text: My husband and I had dinner here on our last night before heading home.  I loved everything about this restaurant.  The food was amazing and we had the best waitress in the world,  her name was Chantay and she was very cheerful and attentive.  A good waitress makes a good meal even all that much better.  I will come back again,  that's for sure.

Yrf1QiQmRqixtVJBDDDOLg.text: Deliciousness-  Order to share tapas style: the charred brussel sprouts; the Chimichurri Steak; 'The Shorty' short ribs; the chicken meatballs; the beets by therapy; the spicey empanadas; and the oxtail empanadas.

4iUqwbMeonsHq7EEgztnHw.text: The best meal we had in Vegas! We came here because of Yelp and we were not disappointed! Everyone in our group argued about whose meal was better. You really can't go wrong. We recommend the Mac and cheese and the chicken and red velvet waffles! June was a wonderful waiter who gave great recommendations and made sure we were all satisfied with our meals. Next time we come to Vegas we are defiantly coming back!

9TgLlviRP-zds3iucyQ_pg.text: We had a reservation and we were seated immediately when we arrived. I really liked the decor and the style of the place. The location is a very short walk from the Fremont Street Experience area. The service was excellent and very knowledgeable about the menu. The food was great and we enjoyed the dining experience.

s5koKliTKis_vNzffwUIDg.text: Delicious salmon with micro greens and Pinot noir. The owner is super nice. Great atmosphere. Amazing carrot cake. Love!

F5SkU9722Oa0JA7XoVHqdw.text: Food is phenomenal!! Red velvet chicken and waffle sliders are amazing! Hands down best downtown eatery.

euYlAyXwzuQzRvl9ag0Psw.text: The food is progressive and so tasty.  We had the Ricky Ricardo and the Barramundi sliders.  They were fresh and had great flavor!

1-fOFJPlTBk05pEdK1rNZw.text: This place turned us into cavemen!  We simply grunted so as not to waste time getting the next bite in our mouths.  We enjoyed the food so much on Friday that we came back on Sunday.  Everything we tried was great.  Our absolute favorite was the Devils on Horseback.  Humbert served us both evenings.  Can't remember the last time we had better service.  We'll definitely be back during our next visit to Las Vegas.

kDgcyFQ2u_oqQ7ezYK8nJA.text: I was here on November 9th with my boyfriend. Our server was Roberto and he was excellent, he was able to answer all our questions and give us great suggestions. My boyfriend ordered the sliced chimichurri steak and I ordered the shrimp scampi. Both dishes were perfectly portioned and excellently made. We devoured our dishes and left as happy campers. We definitely will return and request for Roberto as our server again.

-E64POd5hJ-OksGzmaAuSg.text: Hands down best food I've had downtown. The service was great even though they were busy. Also a big fan of the ambiance. Super laid back, but welcoming. I will be back.   Also, do yourself a favor and order the CARROT CAKE.

OWsqbmHM3oNbSAy7ywjhXw.text: Nice, well balanced bites. We ordered multiple small plates and made a meal out of it. We brought our 2 & 6 year old... I wouldn't do that again. Go and enjoy this place kid-free to really appreciate it.

-8b4CF7FM70kXJV-3JJpKA.text: Very good food. Excellent service. Nice atmosphere. Seat by the window if you get a chance. Lots of fun cool people passing by.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YKz2IlNo-3X1tWtpi6-SgQ.text: I went to therapy for my first time the other night, I got the charred Brussels sprouts and filet mignon. Not only was my steak cooked to perfection and those were best Brussels sprouts I've ever tasted, but my server Chantay was so attentive and great at suggesting what to get. I will definitely being coming back to therapy again! I loved everything about my first experience there.

wkepno1YR8ZWBt9Wemv_PA.text: All I have to say is OMG. The flavors. The combinations of flavors.  I just ..... am having a foodgasm. MUST HAVE- Chicken and Ted Velvet waffle sliders.  Don't let the description put you off.  It's seriously drool worthy. Empanadas are all amazing. And the signature salad dressing.... I wish they bottled it.  Also you got to try the fried mac n cheese. Totally different than any other fried mac n cheese I've ever had, it has jam!!!!  Tried  the Mango Ricky drink and it was delightfully tasty!  Some stuff we picked on our own but our waiter Isaiah recommended others and he was spot on! And super nice and attentive.  I am going to be here a lot I think.

AENc69JgSaAHGMpYj6Yxcw.text: Great Food.  Killer Atmosphere.  Staff is friendly but focused, they're moving fast!  Although, that could have had something to do with visiting during the largest trade show in Vegas.  Bar is fun, full menu at the bar, nice sports were on, good drinks.  I will definitely be back, and this is a for sure stop if you're in Vegas and want to do some downtown dining.  Right across the street from the Griffin, which is a great second stop for some punk music and warm indoor fire places.  Check out downtown, it's happening.

1b0EZsWHuqO4CB3epQ6jqw.text: this was such a fun find, and food and service was excellent, price nicely.  Martinis with stuffed blue  cheese olives the best. We had the caesar salad that was perfect and the chicken and mashed and shared it and loved it, perfect portion size. This place was quite when we arrived and packed when we left, a really good sign.  DownTown Vegas needs to be acknowledged for all the good change that has been happening and how much better we feel going there. Each time its drawing a great crowd, and I hope these new restaurants  that are taking a chance know that we appreciate the efforts that the downtown project has produced and we appreciate them as well.  I see nothing but it getting better for Therapy and others in the future.  As we sat at the bar and saw the Therapy tee's for sale my hubby and I came up with a new logo for the tee.... it should say IVE BEEN TO THERAPY IN VEGAS .... and loved it..

uQbVmgH3vK_PBzvs1gxTcA.text: Had the Rickey Ricardo.  Great take on a Cuban sandwich.  Presentation and food 5 star for sure. Service a bit frenetic, but worth it for the chow. Great atmosphere, particularly for downtown vegas!

s4ZwCz7avogB-0sd0fE9UA.text: Amazing find in Las Vegas! Tried 3 different dishes, mac and cheese croquettes, red velvet waffle chicken sliders, and the Brussel Sprouts, and couldn't decide which was our favorite! Amazing Manhattan, as well, and wonderful staff throughout. Both Christine and Joanne were exceptional servers. Check it out; you won't be disappointed!

nEQFIBEE0US_ebg2ds6deg.text: I use to adore this place- however they changed the menu and got rid of the charcuterie platter. The price you are paying for the quality of food and service is too much. I ordered the tuna tar tar and the sour cream basically destroyed a wonderful dish. It is a nice spot for happy hour but I wouldn't recommend eating dinner.

rwWXlHhG-QN4u_UKjBpuLw.text: Signature salad is fantastic! My girlfriend has a severe dairy allergy and they were very accommodating and willing to make nearly anything on the menu without dairy for her and it was spectacular even without the dairy!  Excellent service and Kim makes the best shots. Will definitely be stopping by here again on our next trip to Vegas!

oC3wP0EsOjnDKXgnituIyQ.text: This restaurant came highly recommended from my father so I couldn't say no. Happy I listened. The oxtail empanadas are to die for. And I absolutely loved the Ricky Ricardo. Oh, can't forget the chicken and waffle sliders--perfection!!

Kg1G55NYhJUzLyBo-_JsyA.text: Very cool joint down on East Fremont St. Great selection of food and drinks. Excellent staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great dinner at Therapy. Very cool joint down on East Fremont Street.

UTHAWeNJPrvTEA-pOqVYAQ.text: I would love to be able to give this adorable restaurant 5 stars, it's a cute concept with a fresh menu. However, I might need "Therapy" after my lunch experience here. Started off great with a personable waiter, and drinks came out quickly but 45 mins into lunch my food came out and I had to sit and wait another 15 mins for my friends food to come out and when it did, it was cold! That being said my food, the Brussel sprouts and empanadas, were very tasty, but the kitchen needs some major help with their timing.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waited for my food for 45 mins and then waited 15 mins so I wouldn&#39;t be rude eating before the rest of my table.

rGTQKX0fbHvfB44daPS7Ig.text: So much amazing food I couldn't just pick one. The bread pudding at the end felt like a dream. Empanadas trio was great to share. My hubby got the Big Sexy and it lives up to the name. Great for lunch. Had a blast with the staff and just felt like it was a great place to hang. Coming back soon and deserves best of Las Vegas

GUPg1iSDvXnKR0KnZm-0sA.text: Had dinner here last night to celebrate a friends birthday the atmosphere in this place is awesome the seats are super comfy and the food was amazing! Everything we ordered was delicious they do a lot of Sharing style Plates but also have entrees they're portions were good we ordered the dates, the fig and cheese with almond crostini to start and added on the Mac n cheese and Chimichurri Steak we were 3 girls so we shared and actually got full! Our waitress Jordan was awesome super on top of everything my friend ordered a cocktail and didn't like it and she exchanged it no problem! Great service quick and amazing experience overall we will certainly be back again so many great dishes to try on the menu!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dates wrapped in bacon in a Romesco sauce

WVh8Cb-ceNC0NA4u_fhoBA.text: Had a great time in Therapy tonight. Dedinetly get the Downtown Manhattan so delicous and smooth!

OqbKJdPYT4j9zdJWBfsKYA.text: The second time we've eaten here in 3 days. The second time was for lunch. We received the same stellar service during the day as we did at night! The food the service and the atmosphere was wonderful. I can't believe how great their wait staff is! Jonathon was great on Friday and Spencer was also knowledgeable and friendly on Sunday! I hope they keep the wonderful menu, quality food and unbelievably great staff! I feel like I actually received Therapy! Thank you!

RoztNldLF33teEYblu24IQ.text: If you're a foodie and looking for a local restaurant near the main strip, I highly highly recommend therapy. Very good for a small meal or big.  Our server was Joanne, very very knowledgeable about the menu, ingredients and even how to eat it. There isn't many servers who are very eager to thoroughly explain each dish but so far in my life, Joanne is probably the best server i have encountered, all the recommendation she made was on point!   I would definitely come back to this place when I visit vegas again.  People say that food is terrible if the service sucks, but at therapy, they got a very high standards on the front of the house service and of course also the kitchen crew.  Thank you guys for an amazing experience.  You won't regret spending your money here!

RP6cS8PrkFXSkfOPY2w5Hg.text: Kimberly made our Therapy experience truly therapeutic! She even concocted a customs drink for me that was to die for.. thanks Kimmy

jKWsJEsuY_8ifntBl87jZg.text: My wife and I ate here on a Saturday night in January. We started with their mac and cheese.  It was gritty and plain.  I said nothing, but my wife said it tasted like a good quality mac and cheese from a box.  I agreed. Next our sandwiches arrived.  The Cuban was good, but the plantains were clearly burnt.  The Philly arrived and the chips were totally unseasoned.  When I asked for new plantains the manager asked me what was wrong?  I said they are clearly burnt.  sha asked if I wanted more since these seems overcooked. I said yes and quite a while later another set arrived burnt.  Everything is overpriced and nothing is better than ordinary.

wCfI7ylPdWSUm0sMihnvrw.text: Easily one of my favorite places to eat lunch when I am in the area. The quality of service, in conjunction with the echelon of food is simply perfect.   I believe I have had most everything on the menu and I have loved everything. My two items I liked best was the Red Velvet Chicken Sandwich and the French Dip.   Lunch can be busy; however, you can always eat at the bar.   Go try it, if you haven't.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Dip!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Chicken.

CRYOttdzwh-dvX33NCnxOw.text: This was probably one of the best meals of my life. I had the duck breast and it was cooked to perfection with a creative blood orange sauce and graceful supporting cast of vegetables. Desert was the Pot de Creme, sophisticated chocolate with freeze dried raspberries as a high note in flavors and marigold buds that were a delightful surprise to your palate.  Skip the casino restaurants and eat here.

94LIRQUQQ8lM9mx6yncicg.text: Best food! I had The Chick, and it was fantastic. Everything was full of flavor, great combinations, nothing too salty or tough. There is serious skill in the kitchen here. I took bites of some of the other meals my family members got, and everything was excellent. This is the best restaurant experience I have had in a very long time.   Oh, and we did bring our kids (8 and 10). I wouldn't bring kids much younger. This isn't the type of restaurant that has coloring pages and crayons or a kids' menu. But for us, this wasn't a problem. My daughter got mashed potatoes minus some of the toppings, and my son got a dry cheeseburger (The Sexy, swapped in cheddar and omitted all other toppings and sauces).

7L5KpSU8TMGUn0MDVAWVUg.text: Yummmmm! Loved the food, the bloody mary and the service. Safe for gluten free allergies too. Best burger we've had!

QRiEySRKRiNlXPnZ9uI_Eg.text: Great food, high quality, and great selection of choices to choose from on the menu. Prices are a great value compared to the overpriced restaurants on the strip. It's worth a Uber ride from the strip to old Las Vegas to see the carnival like activities there and have dinner.   Highly recommend going!

fxnTYPnS2jHglD0ISScJDg.text: Came here for my cousins wedding reception and it was so good!! I think my favorite thing was the Mac and cheese balls! I also loved the chicken and the s'mores! Since it was a pre picked menu I'm not sure what else was on there but we had a lot of options presented and it was delicious! Will definitely come back next time we are in town!

byDq9YPNpZYYSLLV-Tl6kA.text: I took my boyfriend and his parents here for lunch one day. We all ordered the Big Sexy burger and my oh my was it delicious! Our server was very kind and so was our host. The restaurant itself was gorgeous and I could see a lot of potential for events being hosted there. The only reason I am giving it four stars today is because the service was rather slow. There weren't many customers, so you would expect to have quick service, but I guess not. Besides that though, everything else was amazing!

xHlbOi-UeLqEreYLBxq44Q.text: I went to your establishment this weekend. Kristina was our bartender. The best service I've had in such a long time. She is a gem. Extremely knowledgeable about food choices and our cocktails. It was Date Night and she made it great. The food is it Exquisite there. I had the watermelon salad, the chimichurri steak and quite a few of the signature cocktails. Definite five stars. If you're downtown in Las Vegas you should definitely hit this spot up. Great decor great food and Kristina made our experience so wonderful!

AkqMp8pFWMbUDxIcvEsYhQ.text: Great place in Vegas in the up and coming hipster area dt. So fun. Great steak, drinks, service and vibe. Really fun staff that made the experience nice.

T6utH79Ro-H8YsJAtZsUDg.text: I booked Therapy as my reception venue for my Vegas wedding. I wanted  to choose something that fit both mine, and my husband's tastes.   Let me start by saying, this place had the perfect relaxed and industrial feel that I was looking for. We had a party of 35 and they accommodated us up in their loft, which was absolutely perfect.   The food was amazing. I ordered the mac n' cheese croquettes as an appetizer and shared them with my bride's maids. They were absolutely delicious, and the three of us enjoyed every single bite. My main entree was the french dip, and I wasn't disappointed. It was delicious and the housemade chips complimented it perfectly.   On top of the great atmosphere and the delicious food, the staff was extremely helpful. They were able to answer all of our questions about the drinks, and they managed our group with ease.   All in all, this place gets a very confident 5 star rating, and I'll definitely be back the next time I visit Vegas.   Thanks again, Peggy for coordinating this so easily, and thanks to the staff for handling our party with no issue. You guys are amazing!

DiRne1POPT0wWbr_yzCqfQ.text: Great food! I don't like chicken normally but their chicken nachos were the bomb!  Also the steak frites was awesome too! And their cherries were delicious haha  And of course last but not least, the adorable blondie!  Haha Joann was the best server in Vegas!  We were lucky to found her and Therapy by accident! Great comfort food!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Chicken nachos  Great cheese topping too

gzNCOAK6YpTI2tR3VZjAHw.text: Great location near Fremont Street. Decided to grub here with some friends before meeting up at a bar, and it's a great place to do so.   We were seated pretty quickly. Staff was very knowledgeable and helpful in helping me select some alcohol. They knew a lot about their food menu options as well.   Burgers come out to around $20 each, which is a little pricey.   Location is great but it can be a bit noisy for some.

DNmAhjbmtFP3-QhH_r_atQ.text: Super impressed with this restaurant. Decor is modern and fun. Located on the nicer, more low-key section of the ever emerging "new" Fremont area, Therapy is a good spot for dinner whether it be for pleasure or business. We went last night with two other couples and had a great table in the back by the kitchen. Our server was super friendly, attentive and accommodating.  Food was fantastic. We ordered apps, chicken meatballs with cilantro-jalapeno pesto, goat cheese stuffed dates, tuna tartare and chorizo empanadas.  Salads were Cesar and the delicious beet salad.  Dinner selections were salmon, fried chicken and red velvet waffles, roasted chicken with garlic mashed potatoes, Cuban sandwich, and fried mac and cheese croquettes with a spicy aioli. Sides were fries, mac and cheese, and loaded potato mash. Dessert was the chocolate-banana bread pudding and the s'mores skillet.  Everything was delicious, and we'd definitely return.  Total for food and cocktails, (minus tip) was $400-ish.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iGVa3B-SlD_dMJMpnFGukw.text: Had a decent snack and some great convo over here after work with only one noticeable set back... draft lines need cleaning. My two favorite beers right now are on tap at therapy: Founder Dirty Bastard Scotch Ale and Belching Beaver Fall of Troy Orange Vanilla Milkshake IIPA. Both were unfortunately victims of a less than amazing draft setup so they tasted a bit oxidized and flat. Clean those lines and step on it with those ipas boys. I'll be back soon! Thanks Elizabeth for being a great bartendy/ server.

x1xuwTa-JGwFWHCTQxDMKw.text: I was really hoping this place would warrant a five star review. It's close to work and part of the revitalized area of Fremont Street downtown near the Fremont Street Experience. I had a lunch date with a few friends and co-workers I hadn't seen in a while, so I was primed and ready to go. A short walk through the brisk mid-morning air had us all hungry and ready to get our grub on. We arrived shortly after their 11:30 opening time and were the only patrons in the restaurant. We were seated promptly and that's where the promptness ended.   I never figured out if one of our waitresses was in training or if there just wasn't enough to do, but multiple servers for our party of seven added to the confusion and lengthy lunch. The menu referenced "lunch", but the lunch specials are not listed on the menu. Had a few members of our party not been there before, I don't think we would have known about the lunch specials listed on the Therapy website. I opted for the French Dip lunch special which consisted of half a sandwich, french fries and a soda. The quality of the food is what is keeping this review a float. The french fries were outstanding and the French Dip was packed with meat and flavor. There is no ketchup on the table, so you are at the mercy of your server to put it in one of those little stainless steel cups and place it on your plate. Somehow I managed to be the only one who missed out on the ketchup. DL quickly rectified the situation and requested some from the server. Although the server took my soda order, it never arrived, and by the time I got her attention, the meal was winding down.  Our party was fairly diverse when it came to lunch choices with everything ranging from the Beet Salad, to the Chicken Fried Sub and the Super Mac. The lunch special, after tax, was just north of ten bucks, so this kind of Therapy won't break the bank. TD ordered a salad with his Super Mac, but probably should have just ordered dessert instead, as the salad must have been hanging out with my soda, as it too arrived at the end of the meal.  I will be back for another round of Therapy and hope any kinks they may have had with the service are worked out. If you are headed there for lunch and have any sort of time constraint to make it back to work, you might want to seek alternatives or at least be prepared to come up with some excuse for the boss man on why you are late. From arrival to departure we were there is excess of 90 minutes, much of which can be attributed to the service. All things considered, it was just an OK experience.

M4Obsgi-ElPkTYkYM4yKeg.text: The food was excellent and such a surprise! The service was great! You should make a reservation because this please fills up! I ordered the chicken meatballs my mom was not happy about my choice but when they came she couldn't stop eating the !! Kudos to the chief!

AHWL9eLxsJyTJ4gS7C039Q.text: I really wanted to try this place after reading all the awesome reviews and it did not disappoint! Ordered the Ricky Ricardo and the French dip during the lunch hour and both were excellent. We had A+++ service from our server Yesenia.  This place is a hidden gem and we will definitely return for more!

GSYJ2kVNca1gqEzmwErNbQ.text: I've been here two times. The first time I came here with my wife and we had a fantastic time. The second time I came here was on a business trip with a group of colleagues. It was during CES and they were obviously slammed. Unfortunately due to the crowded situation our service was terrible. If it wasn't for this I would've given them five stars.

SFXARj5h92ydclBAhPK40A.text: Had lunch at Therapy today with co-workers. It was my 4th time eating there. Food is always amazing, and Yesenia gives the best services making our dining experience pleasant and memorable.

oA-DbsyGxGd4DSU8mmiK7g.text: Excellent empanadas! Delicious Mac croquettes! Chicken meatballs are fantastic!  We really enjoyed our dinner.  Busy Sunday evening, yet attentive staff, fresh, hot, delicious food. Highly recommend!

rl3ZfaWPFCdscq-C5IgDSA.text: What a great place!  Just outside the Fremont St Experience with easy parking near the Container Park. Saw lots of people arriving in cabs/Ubers.  Not far from the Strip at all.  It almost feels like you are eating in a local neighborhood.  We sat right by the window and enjoyed all the people watching.  Good, classic Gourmet American type food.  Definitely try the crab dip--I will fly back to Vegas just for the crab dip.  We also had the Crostini, which has an interesting preparation.  Little pillows of ricotta baked together in stoneware and topped with fig jam and nuts.  You then scoop it onto delicious bits of crostini.  Split the Shrimp Scampi which was perfect.  Our server was nice enough to split it and was perfect after all the heavy food of Vegas.  Wine is reasonably priced and a good selection. Such a BETTER value when compared to the Strip.  And the food here was much tastier, better presented and in a better atmosphere when compared to a much more expensive, disappointing meal on the Strip. Shout out to Jason, who was an excellent server.  Pleasant, on the ball and checked on us often without being intrusive.

_VliuYNJGbeETBQg7r1SqA.text: Food, Cocktails & Service was amazing!  Came in for lunch & can't wait to come back for dinner with my friends.  I tried a little bit of everything & it all was delicious.  Must try, I highly recommend it!

3srABshJ-OJZ-GeRPS1nmw.text: Awesome place. Nice ambiance. Just the type of bar Vegas needs where you dont have to go to strip to have a good time. Food prices are okay. But the food itself is just so-so.

ejR0mp4SrhEJXjitvkwpHA.text: Last night I had the privilege to have a tasting menu @ Therapy!  Ummmm WOW!!!!  There is an impeccable array of choices and very unique dishes along with some classic favs!  Some of the things I may have never chosen on my own were just so yummy and popped with serious flavor!  This upscale bar/restaurant just raises the bar for Downtown Cusine/ hang out spot !!  As someone who is born and raised here in Las Vegas this is A MUST TRY!!!  A definite hands down positive recommendation!! From the food to the Staff..... Exquisite!!  You won't be disappointed!!!

0b4fh1t-VsfLZG3bJfx0DA.text: Service was bad, lights too bright and noise to loud to hold a conversation.

SMNiiozlmZg7MlABeRfDMQ.text: Great place. The ambiance is wonderful and the food is perfect for either a group party or a nice date night. Must try the oxtail empanadas.

hEyd-msqFsFetWY7r-yq7g.text: Went to Therapy last night for the first time. It was really packed but we expected that for a Friday night so weren't surprised. Took about 45 minutes to get our table which was still fine since we just walked across the street to get a drink. We would have had a drink at their bar, but ever single seat in the place was taken. That's fine though. We really were excited to see what all the hype on the food was. And we weren't disappointed!! My wife and I split three menu items and were so impressed. The best was the BIG SEXY burger. Damn that was delicious!!! Perfectly prepared!! Only complaint would be the caliber of drinks on the menu. The drinks were ok, but really needed to step it up to be in the same level as the food. Overall I will recommend to everyone! Nice work.

VVfUX4WXIZXy7rMDjI5tdA.text: The drinks are amazing and well worth the ~$10 each costs. The food was way too overpriced for what it was. Most of the menu is tapas style, aka tiny portions. The oxtail empanadas were tiny and not that flavorful. The corn on the cob, mac and cheese, and red velvet waffle sliders were good, but nothing to write home about.

4dxqd4ZhROWu1bYFFMCM7A.text: was excited to try this place. dropped in sat at the bar... took a few minutes before being acknowledged... ready to order, the bartender starts taking orders from other patrons after i have been wating for 10 min..  terrible service... not worth the hype..... lots of better places on fremont st.

ib7h42nwut8RNRbc1AZHYw.text: From the moment we sat down we feel in love with this place.  The food is very good and the drinks are awesome.  What makes the place special is the staff.  Blake and Jose made sure that our visit was relaxing and enjoyable.  Blake and Jose also offered up tons of information about the surrounding area in the way of "things to do."  If you are on Freemont Street stop in for a drink. YOU will be glad that you did.

zqIAisJIJFMzQhrzwdUq0g.text: I cannot get over how nice and accommodating the staff is at Therapy. Whether meeting up with clients or just dropping in for a quick drink, they are so pleasant! The food is also killer and meant to be shared which is great when you want to try a little of everything (which I strongly recommend).

wKyulfHu-ca_vYDFIX7F7A.text: What a cute place.  The food was good.  Had a girls day out here.  Manager was very attentive.

jz8Ec36Iy86aWyyi0sLNpg.text: I'm giving it 5 stars because of the French dip...it was actually my friends' dish...the chips were great too...my salmon was not so good, dry and pretty pedestrian...but the French Dip...oh man.

dgFrfFWXfyjwtIeyOARqbQ.text: Went here last night for dinner. We started with the deep fried pigs ear which was absolutely delicious! I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing. For the main course I ordered the bone-in pork chop and my companion ordered the shrimp scampi. Unfortunately my pork chop was overcooked, which made it hard for me to enjoy it even though they did an amazing job preparing the rest of the dish. The service was kinda spotty, maybe due to the large crowd that evening. We really had to work hard to get her attention when needed. There's a lot of other dishes I'd like to come back to and try, so I'd give them another chance to try and change my opinion of the place.

n0g-tN6RNKt0qsGM6zyG2Q.text: My wife and I decided we would try this place for a date night. It's located at the end of Fremont in an area that is being revitalized. We were quickly seated and provided water. We then waited a while to get our drinks. My wife ordered one of the sangrias which tasted amazing. Then we ordered the empanadas, flatbread and sliders. This is where things took a turn for the worse. We waited thirty minutes to get our empanadas and only after we asked the server. Next the flatbread. Both dishes were awesome and tasted better than expected. We had to ask the server again for the pork sliders which he was surprised we hadn't got. We finally got the sliders after an hour of waiting. Last, we had the carrot cake and ice cream which was also delicious. The service was slow and forgetful but in the end he took two of the meals off. I would eat here again because the food was delicious.

goLLtsc5pYrjAlpV2xmMUQ.text: Let say this, I was looking for a place to take my wife for a nice dinner and drinks.  This place is the bomb.  The food is excellent, not to mention the service is second to none.  A must try here, are the dates, macaroni and cheese and burgers.  Trust me these foods may sound like every other restaurants, however everything is made with a twist, and extremely tasty.  Extremely clean, a must visit when on Fremont.

vJ8h0upQV8QPf5CrQJKgOw.text: From our friendly greetings from Roxy the hostess and the attentive Jonathan ,our server, my wife and I had an unparalleled in years Las Vegas culinary experience. The food, atmosphere, and attention was truly fabulous. We had the homemade Sangrias to start which set a great tone for what was to follow. We had three Social Club entrees; the Chicken Meatballs, Red Velvet Chicken Waffle sliders and the Charred Asparagus. All three were unique collections of flavor and texture. Truly words are not enough to describe what awaits at Therapy.  Get there now before you can't get a table.

RdfqyrGSgpQxOBfe_3p7Og.text: Crappy experience on a Sunday night. What a waste of my cheat day. I don't know how they got so many good reviews. Drinks were watered down and frozen drinks were chunky. Food took fooooorever to get to us. I'd forgive them for that if the food was good. We got the pork chop which was overcooked, the salmon had a good crispy skin but was salty, the ahi tuna was salty, and the Ricky Ricardo sandwich just tasted like a mustard sandwich. The beers took so long to get to our table that they were lukewarm by the time that they got to us. The table next to us were so fed up with waiting that they left even after waiting such a long time to get to their table. They were probably understaffed. Never again.

naWDrMYb4jJTPw2Bkl1csQ.text: I love the atmosphere. Service was great!  Ordered: 1)the bacon wrapped dates 2)red velvet chicken sliders w/maple syrup. 3) Mac & cheese with bacon 4) smores  Everything mentioned above are highly recommended and delicious. By far one of the best Mac & cheeses I have had yet. The smores will blow your mind. =)   Thank you, therapy for keeping my tummy happy during the life is beautiful fest!

FPY_M8AcqmtjSztkCO0V6w.text: Great first time lunch experience, the service was promote and attentive. We each had a sandwich selection ,Gina had a red velvet waffle chicken that was super tasty served with maple syrup. I had my favorite BLT with chips. Both were large portions we brought some home. We will go back again just to sample more of the menu.

CiYSqVOYG4sTdROM24PYeA.text: So i saw the fun red velvet chicken waffles and had to come. And I'm so glad i did! The Red velvet chicken and waffles were so delicious! Perfect crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside waffle . The Crispy chicken inside the sandwich had the prefect crunch and juicy chicken inside. With a spicy kind if slaw which is to die for if you like a bit of kick. My next favorite was the fried Mac! Honestly wow crispy outside and ooey goey inside with a spicy tomatoe jam sauce. If you love spice definitely order one or two if your selfish. The meat and cheese platter is also a really good starter if you want something lite and tangy. The Bellini Mimosa also really good not crazy strong and the perfect amount of peach. Honestly you won't be disappointed. And what a great fun party atmosphere.

HaueRKlUA_OdbGTtvumd3A.text: Needing to escape therapy is usually a cure!  Cheers to the cure of therapy.  Therapy can come in many different forms, I plan to release some of my problems and woes in the bottom of a glass. That's right the glass started full, then got to half full, and finally empty. Am I cured? Let's find out. Another round if you please! Where else can one get a shot of therapy? Only in Vegas! Spencer will be my guide!  My most current issues melt away as I seek more and more shots of therapy. But let me explain, the therapy that I am experiencing comes in a shot glass, and is the flavor of pineapple upside down cake. My fabulous waiter Spencer is whom is administering my shots of therapy. Therapy is the name of the restaurant that I am enjoying. Who can go wrong with a restaurant that has been on the travel channel? Foodies have spoken, so here I sit gaining some light to the darkness that has filled my last few days.   One would never expect the style and class from the outside of building that Therapy calls its own! Trust me some of the best restaurants that I have enjoyed have the plainest outside decoration. Simple is best in my books. It's the quality of the food and experience that I am seeking. My visit was during the off hours when they are not very busy. Not too many seeking therapy at the moment. My guide through therapy is the amazing Spencer. He is going places and as my guide was more than helpful during my recent session. Assured that he was compensated well for his time too!  The menu that Therapy has to offer is way over the top! The sheer elegance of all of their sampling's are quite spectacular. Looking for just simple sampling's the fabulous Spencer advised me that most of the appetizers will fulfill these needs. Plus what ever was left over I could take home for later. The cuisine is truly no joke here. I cannot get over how special this restaurant really is. The menu here could stand beside most of those four star restaurants on the strip too. While the menu here is five stars the prices are those of a four star restaurant. Let's just say that while happy hour is advertised at the bar on beer and a few cocktails; it is not offered on their food. The quality of the food is that delicious and amazing that individuals pay full price every visit regardless!   If only there were more Spencer's in the world; it would be a much happier place. Spencer was genuine, warm, and cheerful making my visit here count. After having the day I was experiencing, Spencer returned that smile back to me. He helped through the whole ordering process with each of his recommendations perfect. The drinks that he brought were so delicious. In fact, Spencer offered me some other drink choice if I did not like what I choose. Where does that happen? Especially, if it's a customer mishap. The policies of Therapy are exceptional superb since they allow the employees to ensure that customers are happy, no matter what!   Now that we have covered the glorious customer service here, let's visit shall we, what I had to eat!  I sampled the Charred Brussels but with added bacon, and Devils on Horseback. Let me tell you, if you enjoy bacon, then they have you covered. Bacon is an incredible option as an add on for $3.00. Go ahead, get the bacon and spoil yourself. The charred Brussels with bacon were amazing. They were perfectly cooked too. The devil did not visit me, but it felt like I was sinning while eating this. The plate takes date and cooks them then the red wine sauce they come in is dangerously delightful. Then to wrap these devils bites up bacon is wrapped around it. Oh these are a must try. My drinks were the fabulous therapy shots which truly tastes like pineapple upside cake! Beyond these shots I enjoyed a Mezcali, which they make beautifully.   Now that my therapy session is coming to an end, we missed a piece that's essential. Yes, dessert. The dessert menu is not stellar here, but the few delicious desserts they offer are outstanding! I had Carrot Cake done therapy style. This is a mind blowing dessert. The carrot cake has the option of adding bacon too. Not wanting too many extra calories I passed on bacon for my carrot cake. The dessert is presented as cake crumbles with cream cheese at the end of each side, and topped off with walnuts and vanilla ice cream on top. There is even a real mini carrot too. Delicious truly, best cheese cake concept I have ever seen!   My session with Spencer is now over. Feeling fantastic I pass on this wisdom to you: Therapy is a great time, with enthusiastic employees, and delicious food. Come and try a therapy session for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Whiskey, Bacon, Beer &amp; YOU! What dream are made of!!&#34;
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels Charred with added Bacon!

c91v63nWiWF5FrOjI-BN1A.text: I spent a lot of time trying to choose restaurants that we wanted to try in Las Vegas. Being a foodie in a foodie city, this was a like an oasis to try new things. Naturally I turned to Yelp to look for a new experience. We booked Therapy a couple of weeks ago in anticipation of an awesome meal! The reviews were glowing!  We came for brunch/lunch on a Sunday and went with some of the recommendations: Chicken and Waffles slider (waffles are red velvet) and chicken fried chicken sandwich. The chicken and waffles slider looked awesome but was underwhelming when eaten. The chicken was great and the waffles were good but both had such subtle flavors that when eaten together, they canceled each other out essentially. The chicken fried chicken was good but not stunning. The bread to chicken ratio just needed some extra flavoring to make it pop. the spicy mayo provided didn't quite hit the spot. The chicken could use a bit of moistening and something to jump out at you. the truffle, parmesan fries were good though.  In the end, this was a 3 star experience for us. The service was great especially considering they were running a full joint with only 3 or 4 main waiters. Therapy is located in Downtown Vegas so away in the strip. Just take an Uber there because I think parking can be a challenge.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aVMs0ft8DZy266EdQKsNHw.text: Some of the best places to eat are off the strip and that's why we always try to make a trip to Downtown when we're in Vegas!  Glad we added this restaurant to our list of places to try!  First off we were able to easily make reservations ONLINE instead of calling, which I loveddd For appetiizers, we ordered the Fred and Mark Croquetes $14 , which is 3 pieces of mac&cheese (deep fried as a croquette) served in a pool of tomato bacon jam with sriracha aioli spread over the croquette only.  Although this was incredibly delicious, both my fiance and I didn't care for the tomato bacon jam it sat in.  We did finish off the croquettes itself tho!   We also ordered the Gnudi $13.  It came with 6 pieces of bread and a baked ricotta cheese spread.  There was a heavy spread of fig jam over the cheese, which my fiance thought was too sweet. Personally I still liked it but less would've been better.    For the entree we ordered the Senor Shorty $24 which was short rib seated in the middle of two pieces of bread? with black beans and corn.  It was unique and delicious as well.    Service was excellent too! our server kept checking up on us making sure everything was ok.  I definitely liked this restaurant and I wish I had come here less stuffed! Will definitely return with an empty stomach!!!

rz28Ba4wEcXwb3hH_ZdyLw.text: Francisco is the best and the happy hour and food was fantastic. We sat at the bar to take advantage of the happy hour food and drink specials, and still ordered some regular menu items - including the epic chicken and waffles. The hype is real -- do it! Happy hour drink specials are a dream. Come here!

2D9N-2xc04bNHmIOQpE8RQ.text: Yes, yes, yes!! Awesome menu, chill vibe, historic Fremont Street!  This is a foodie spot! A destination - just look at the menu. Red velvet waffles? Bacon wrapped dates? The Mac and Cheese bites are house made. Come here and eat! This place looks like nothing special and you can easily walk past, but don't.   The crab artichoke dip came piping hot with an incredible cheese crust! It's loaded with crab, artichokes, and was seriously rich and creamy!  The devils on horseback were a little over cooked, but still delicious. The bacon was crispy, dates warm and soft and the sauce had a slight heat.   The Cuban disappeared! Moist pork and house picketed onions!

9phB6780X3xGFQWhUKn1UA.text: This is an amazing place!!! Ty and Jonathan made amazing drinks, providing us with the best service. Plus the food is incredible. I had the shrimp tacos with super fresh mango salsa, and my boyfriend ate the Cuban sandwich. If you are in downtown Vegas, this is definitely the spot to eat and have drinks. Great service, great food, and great prices.

95H1x2a7D2K8OAQCXAYqmQ.text: Love this place. As I live in Vegas and work downtown, Fremont Street is my go to for great food and libations. Therapy has it all: excellent bar, great food, and attentive service. My friend and I shared several appetizers and had wine. We had the Brussels sprouts, In the Gnudi, and the Mexican Street corn. All 3 were amazing. My personal favorite were the Brussels sprouts. The street corn was delightful and In the Gnudi is a cheese dish...don't ask it was amazing. If you're a local, go. And if you're visiting my fine city please go and enjoy. Therapy is is one of the best places that Vegas has to offer.

U3DxNfH9S_pD8Dhu8tQvwA.text: This is a great place in downtown Las Vegas. They have a bar with a great selection of beers on tap. Most of the food is served in small plates almost as tapas style. However, they also serve full entrees. Every dish is delicious. One of my favorite dishes was the chicken meatballs and the crab dip. I also enjoyed the Cuban sandwich which comes with plantains.  The quality of the service was not very good, but food makes up for it!  If you are downtown and looking for good food, you must try this place!

GohSIOVsuVDuJfrdd1HQ3w.text: Came here for a bachelorette party and Jonathan was amazing! Everything was amazing and so quick and enjoyable. Loved the atmosphere and the overall experience! We will be back!

MebXrcCgT3LfCaJ11pxYMA.text: Really really nice experience  I made reservation throw yelp and everything was smooth and pretty easy!  The place wasn't crowded anyway .. our server was really friendly and helpful   The whole place looked great .. just my style.. loved it   Food was great  I ordered chicken meat balls and a side of loaded mashed potatoes  they were yummy  The pesto sauce on the meatball was really delicious   My drink was ok tho a little bit watery  My friend ordered the chicken and waffles and there were yummy I ate his leftover as my dessert ;)  Prices were pretty decent compering to Vegas prices  It's definitely worth the try!!
