30sGVSLL8czWo-dkByiN7w.text: This was our first time coming here. And, it was a little disappointing. There were two things that were pretty delicious but the bad outweighed the good. The chorizo empanadas were very good. We wanted there to be more of them.  The Devils on horseback which were the bacon wrapped dates were pretty good as well. The sauce didn't seem to go with the dates though. It was like a tomato sauce.   When I got my drink it all went downhill from there. It was the "Fremont on East" which was pretty delicious but there was barely enough. It was in a small glass and the ice was filled all the way up, like 10 sips or less. And when I told the waitress about it, she just said "well maybe you should get another one." Not cool... The Red velvet chicken and waffles was a disaster. The waffles have no taste. And the second waffle on the bottom was extremely soggy and mushy. It was unedible. And there was very little chicken. The coleslaw that was in the middle didn't really go with the dish.   Last but not least the S'mores was actually pretty good. But, we both burned our tongue on it. It's extremely hot and bubbly and even though we ordered it from the beginning, it took a long time to bring it out. I think maybe she just forgot about it. The waitress wasn't terrible but she wasn't that great either. It was a very short Hispanic lady with thick eyeliner. She could've been much nicer and friendlier. Rear the other reviews. That's what I did before I came here and that's why I avoided the crab dip and other things. See for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet chicken and waffles was terrible. The waffles didn&#39;t taste like red velvet &amp; bottom waffle was soggy. The coleslaw didn&#39;t go.
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chorizo empanadas were excellent. The bacon wrapped dates were pretty good but the sauce didn&#39;t really go.

dyO9UobOWZpLs8myFjcR2g.text: This was a great last-minute decision for a relaxing dinner. I got the Raspberry Rose with tequila instead of rum, my friend got the Mango Ricky, and they were both amazing. We got the Gnudi, the baked ricotta appetizer with truffle-fig jam- what an amazing flavor and texture combination! I got the Al Pastor tacos - they were good but I'd get something else if I'm able to go again. My friend is a vegetarian and got the veggie empanadas, she was very happy with her choice. The Gnudi and the atmosphere were the best parts about the experience. It's lively, fun, but still laid-back and not snooty. I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry Rose
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnudi

73tViMe7XfOKRRjAeedbmw.text: Great drinks, great food, great service! My friends enjoyed several cocktails. All with a great twist on the traditional liquor options. We enjoyed several of the dishes on the menu including the mashed potatoes, the big monster sandwich (it was crazy big!!) and steak. I would recommend the arancini appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with asparagus, cheery tomatoes and cilantro pesto.

QXO4B4LsgFOgouSilK0Shg.text: One of our local friend recommended therapy to us for a good burger. I was quite excited because the yelp review was positive and they seem to have selection of pub foods, and dinner entrees. We came in on a Thursday hoping for a great dining experience. Sadly, it was disappointing.   The stars I gave them is for their food. Our server Gloria was the best. I love their overall customer service. I really appreciate her taking care of our table with good details during our time there.   I ordered starters to begin. Steak tartare and Parmesan truffle fries. Hands down therapy serve the best fries I ever had. I would totally recommend those. Steak tartare came in a very small portion in a mason jar. The portion was surprisingly very small considering the price $17.   Moving on to their entree. Their sexy burger underdelivered. Buns were dry, and their meat was not as juicy as I expected them to be. I ordered my duck entree medium rare $26, and half of the breast came somewhat right and the other pieces were completely hard and overdone. I overheard the table next to mine also had the same issue with their medium rare request on a steak taken back to the kitchen because it was well done.   There's an apparent discord with front customer facing and the kitchen end at this restaurant. I'm not sure if I came in on an off day for the kitchen, but I spent a little over $80 for a dinner meal here and left disappointed.

gURJnepiI8CRo7D4H0Wk4Q.text: Came here after my husband and I got married with a party of 14. The restaurant did a great job accommodating us and ensuring we were comfortable.   They offer a great menu with elevated American cuisine. The food was flavorful. Nothing was overly "great" at this restaurant, but by no means was anything bad. Reason for the 4 stars. It was a solid restaurant.   I'd definitely come back for happy hour to enjoy lite bites and cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u3QFydYs-a0PRGBlgC47sQ.text: This place deserves 6 stars! Let's get to it! We had the social club part of the menu and I was truly impressed! The charred Brussel  was the most flavorful Brussel dish I've EVER had and I hate veggies but I tried to eat them all! The bacon wrapped dates were the food equivalent of sex... trust me on this  .  The portion sizes are above the regular tapas size but you will want to eat all of it!  This was on a Saturday night and although it was busy, there was no noticeable wait for the food which was beautifully presented and up there with a lot of Michelin star places. Our server Johnathan  made us very comfortable by being friendly and extremely knowledgeable. He was there but didn't hover and somehow knew exactly when to come by. Ask for him   He's super!  If you're on Fremont Street, make this your first stop. You will not be disappointed!!

BNkIwIavvWWv-qLdPgycMA.text: Michael is the best server ever! He worked our table every few minutes and was very attentive to our needs. We had the mac and cheese and ahi tuna and finished it off with the s'mores and deconstructed carrot cake. It was all amazing!  The atmosphere is real chill and relaxing. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

g56da46eTZKrFCWFWn29fw.text: So my wife and i come downtown occasionally just to mess around and have mindless fun while trying a new restaurant.  we tried therapy and the food was very good.  We would have gladly taken our leftovers if we werent staying down here for the night.  the chicken was a little dry but tasty.  The dates were amazing while the chimichurri steak was tender and juicy. The sauce was sublime.  With a side salad and an order of mashed potatoes the meal was too much to finish.  Very good and a gem from downtown.

BffgI9j7UCtQMxZ7BZhQ-w.text: If I could give 0 starts I would. But the servers deserve 5 they are the saving grace. Got the duck it was so salty that there was a joke that went around about the duck being from Death Valley.  The other dishes were barely edible.

FQp0icW5gxmCaeOJKdKQ9Q.text: Most of the dinner was fine. Service was very nice and professional. Good, but overpriced, choices for wines by the glass. We had the pork bao which was authentically prepared with spicy kimchee. The crab and artichoke dip with warm chips was excellent. We really liked the signature salad which was made with crisp greens and a perfect light dressing. Friends raved about the stuffed dates. The brussel sprouts were good although laden with fattening nuts and cheese.  My husband loved the pork chop and appreciated the gluten free designations on the menu. The only blip and a bad one was the duck confit. Highly recommended by the server it was so salty it tasted like meat on a salt lick. Unfortunately, it was my entree. The duck looked strangely dried out when presented, that explains it. In reading prior reviews there are lots of complaints about the overly salty duck. I have made duck confit. Chef - if you must brine the duck, rinse thoroughly prior to rendering the fat. Better yet just remove it from the menu.

_NTc4rZLqK_oV0KyWnCQVw.text: The food and drinks are delicious when you finally get them. We were there for 10 minutes standing by the door plenty of tables available. Three employees walk past us, look at us but do not say anything.  We finally get a table then we wait another 20 minutes still no one says we will be with us shortly. Finally one of the bartenders stops says she will be with us after she drops off a drink for someone. She then passes us 3 times to do other things before coming to take our order. Then we waited and our food came out before our drinks had shown up. I had ordered the truffle fries instead of the chips that came with my order. My order came out with the chips no truffle fries. I asked for the fries they brought me reg fries. The last thing the waitress said was well we didn't expect to be busy at lunch on a weekend in Vegas. All I can say is I'm glad the food was good but their service leaves something to be desired.

tYME5IUZzScObN4hRSBtHw.text: What a nice surprise near Freemont St. Don't look anywhere else. I had the pork chop but the mashed potatoes were so good I threw out my no carb diet! My wife had the Ahi tuna and will go back tomorrow for the same thing. Just go there! I went back on a Tuesday and they had live music. The girl behind the mic had the voice of an angel. Oh and The Perfect Cure is a menu item you should try!!! Loved every morsel.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful ambiance, not your typical Las Vegas restaurant, in all the good ways!

HNyi9eHFwb9dySrUeeLNiA.text: One of the best meals since we've been in Las Vegas. Do not skip the Brussel Sprouts. I had the Cuban and my friend had the French dip. Both were fantastic. Really generous portions. They were amazing! Great vibe, friendly servers, amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban sandwich. Perhaps the best Cuban I&#39;ve ever eaten!  We started with the amazing Brussel sprouts. I will absolutely visit Therapy again.

nUuiuKKTtmka_7Cybgu_SA.text: Accommodated our party of 20. Everyone loved the meal and our server was wonderful. Bartender not so friendly. Other than that everything was great! We will be back!   Thank you for fitting us in on short notice!

Tmb4e2NHFGOHJbmu8F3NBg.text: What a nice gem in the middle of Fremont. Never expected to find a cool place like this on Fremont.  They have a great eclectic menu hard to describe but really good. Service was good. Atmosphere is casual upscale, great beer & wine list. All in all a really nice dining experience.

FXmnzeTXSfzKQpLtDMnGJQ.text: I decided to try dinner at Therapy before a night out Downtown. The service was great, very helpful when suggesting food and drink options. The cocktails were delicious and refreshing. The fried Mac with tomato jam was so good! I would love to eat it again. The truffle fries were amazing as well as the red velvet chicken and waffles. Overall, it was a great dining experience. I would highly recommend to anyone and want to come back again. There are a lot of food and drink options for everybody.

1oObXGQfmwLRN10MwqCItQ.text: Had my birthday dinner here about a month ago and had a lovely experience. The food is AMAZING. We split some truffle mac and cheese and artichoke dip. The dip was a tad salty, but the mac and cheese was the real winner here.   Pro tip: split an entree. My fiance and I got the French dip sandwich and it was huge!   We ended the evening with the s'mores skillet. Super tasty, but needing just a bit more chocolate.   I'd definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

s_vI9CNcgFJU4zN0tw1Xyg.text: Some of the best burger I have had in my entire life. And trust me, I had quite a few. Prices are very reasonable. Kitchen was just slightly more slow than we would have hope for but I highly recommend the place.

p08ZfFK5g1DIpgBbMnDhlg.text: Michael at the bar was awesome. Made great drinks and recommended amazing food. Sweet guy!  Definitely come back.

w08nt8sNk8tUfXKQsKVlPg.text: Wonderful service from Michael! Best appetizers and cocktails . Love the Devils on Horseback!

lNK_UiIwpTeErFGjHg8tig.text: Great food with Excellent service! We will be coming here on our next visit to Vegas!

W8Hn4AejYKFejEbqRIO2Mg.text: We found this place on Yelp during our Vegas vacation July 6th, East Freemont we walked in the door the place was nice and inviting has a great vibe, and it only got better from there. We like to try the specialty cocktails when dining out so when we got our drinks they were very very good with a good amount of alcohol (rare these days) I ordered the Ricky Ricardo Cuban, was pretty much the best Cuban I'd ever had. The flavor was amazing. Also highly recommend the crab artichoke dip super good. Not only was everything perfect but the service was friendly and prompt. I would highly recommend Therapy it will always be a must for us while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rtpjg_YCNK37UYQTeNCjDw.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas....the food we ordered was:  In The "Gnudi" - Very interesting dish that had that cream cheesiness, sweetness, and smooth crunchy texture. Reminded me of a sweet and fluffy Thanksgiving stuffing....  Oxtail Empanadas - Very good with excellent flavor  Fire Roasted Street Corn - Can't go wrong with this...  Super Mac - Again can't go wrong with this...  Filet Tartar - Fire and on par with most beef tartars...  Shrimp Scampi - That sauce was very good and the shrimp were generous portions...  Scottish Salmon - Can't believe it wasn't butter! Rich and smooth   Jocelyn's Organic Lemon & Herb Chicken - That chicken I had was cooked to perfection. You know it was cooked well when you get past the skin and the chicken still has the same flavor and not the only seasoned on the outside bs...  Overall very much a social dinner environment compared to a let's order our own entrees and not share (but who does that nowadays anyways?)...

OxCKgEW850mo-i_rLxAVUA.text: Loved the food and service! I want to shout out Nigel and Zack specifically! They were so great. Definitely will be coming back!

f1Hv75bXy808voZ7za-iDg.text: I stopped in since I was in the area and had good things about it.  Happy hour was going on so I got a beer and decided to try the oxtail empanadas.  They were fantastic with a crispy crust and full of meat.  The sauce was a perfect accompaniment as well.    Since I hadn't eaten anything today I needed something else so went for the charred kale salad.  Fantastic!  This is definitely going on my places to take my family list.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtail empanadas
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charred kale salad
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour, some good stuff

5A1wDZgKvzDRXtzZXxKGNg.text: Trendy place with some excellent food. I'm pretty sold on this place when I'm in the area and in the mood to get off the strip (which is almost always). I emailed them for a reservation of 14 for dinner a few weeks before our trip and it was totally fine. Very prompt response. They sat us on a long table and we decided to split the check three ways inside our group to make ordering a little easier.   Parking: They don't have a parking lot, but you can probably find street parking somewhere close by.   Ambiance: Clean, trendy, welcoming. Slightly dim.   Food:  - Roasted Street Corn: Their take on elote. So good! We kept talking about it on the way back, It's a must get. It was so yummy that we got another order.  - Chicken and Red Velvet Waffle Sliders: These are actually kind of large. I was trying to figure out how to eat it without getting my lipstick everywhere. It was pretty tasty, but I do remember the chicken being a little dry. We cut each side in half and shared between the four of us in our mini group.  - Shrimp Ceviche: Really yummy! Not too acidic either. I was a fan. Shrimp was nice and  fresh too.  - Korean BBQ Porkbelly: So delicious and mouth-watering. Must order! - In The Gnudi: I was sort of surprised by how much I liked this dish. It was a nice break from all the savory since it was also sweet. I'd def order this again. - Big Sexy: The patty was juicy and it the bun was nice and wasn't soggy.   Cocktails:  - Nice and strong. I was able to try "The Smash" and "St. Therapy". Both were really refreshing and had good flavors.   -Service: The only reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars is because they messed up our check 3 times (which took about 20 minutes to rectify) and I was getting agitated because we were on a tight schedule. Our waiter was very nice though and he checked in on us in a timely manner. Also, the host was really nice too. He was able to accommodate our large party even when I called to change our reservation to an earlier time.   TL;DR: Totally going to be coming to this place when I can. Also told my friends who just moved here to check it out. The corn is awesome.

ZPjvYp2JNA9MUToQI4lL7Q.text: Reasonably priced food and drinks in a good setting. Our server Roberto was excellent and gave good suggestions. Would definitely come again!

__UtBMMgZnxBu3mwPILu8Q.text: Clean, hip ambiance. Wait staff attentive. Small beer selection on tap. Way bigger selection in bottles. Smaller cocktail menu than I anticipated....what else to serve as Therapy?!  The prime rib dip was pretty typical. House made chips needed more seasoning. The sandwich needed something else too. Especially for the price. Thus the three stars.

694vQ1nYlWfEjSjs-XzJSw.text: I love, love, love this restaurant!!  I come here for lunch every few months. The food is so fresh. Brussels sprouts are a must!  I had the salad with steak last time and the steak just melted in my mouth. The chicken and waffles were so good and great for a group to share. I need to get here for dinner sometime so I can try their cocktails.

nm6vviRsb_KkKzu5xlxmlw.text: The food was bland but the service was excellent from the ONE  server/bartender.   There was an additional wait staff that worked his butt off as well.  Two gentlemen that appeared to be part of the establishment ate their own lunches while the wait staff got slammed!   We were really looking forward to eating here.   Definitely disappointing.  I had the Cuban sandwich, it was bland and needed some additional sauce or something.   I had to ask for hot sauce.  I think a nice mustard would've helped.   The plantains were fried perfectly and tasted delicious.  My fiance had the Mac n cheese.   It wasn't anything to write home about.   I would've given 2 stars based on the food and management but the wait staff was great.     Dear manager-  Give Mariana a raise because she took care of 8 tables (40 people), while you did nothing but sit there.   Shame on you.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban sandwich with plantains

Ah21zuUfcEnRsBgesz44vg.text: Excellent place. The wait staff was top notch and very timely with our order. The food was delish...I recommend the brussel sprouts as an app.

0kPXzrqDwrAS1O-ktOCYmw.text: I wish I can give this place 10 stars! The food here is out of this world. I highly recommend the Oxtail Empanadas!! I still can taste that awesome flavor of the meat, and the sauce on the side is yummy. It's worth the time leaving the Las Vegas strip and heading downtown for some great food and drink at this place. I will definitely be going back!

c72fkgSk5jGfA6XViGz0BA.text: Thank you for making our bachlorette's night !  Jason was the perfect host giving us excellent recommendations and providing perfect service. We will be back !

KljzWTYwXkTjzteGhL7KkQ.text: Amazingly renovated space. You'll never believe this place in DTLV used to be a mini-mart! The inside certainly has that "wow" factor, and the soft, cushy seats are a HUGE plus.  I ordered the The French Dip, which came out on a grilled hoagie roll - which gave it a crisp bite, but enough soft-insides to be good for soaking up au jus. The only thing I did not like about the French Dip was the au jus served alongside it. It was much more gravy-like than au jus, so the bread didn't soak it up very well. When I think of a French Dip, I want regular au jus to soak into the bread, not just a dipping sauce. However, I have to admit the gravy had great, deep flavor, and the meat inside the sandwich was succulent, with very little fat. Chips came with the sandwich, and were crunchy, salty, and tasty.  Overall I was impressed at their lunch offerings. I would certainly go back. Prices are a little on the high side (especially for lunch), but the food is quality.

32fTMYXGDIc06-CNfuhpZA.text: Traditional American doesn't apply here. Don't get me wrong that's a good thing in my book. Where do you traditionally get red velvet waffles and fried chicken or oxtail empanadas, French dips and burger ok.   The food is good and atmosphere is pleasant, but I do have a few quibbles to air. Cole slaw with chicken and waffles is a nice idea but poorly executed here ( either too old or too finely cut to maintain any texture) the French dip has some of the finest meat available (and I'm a butcher) but the Demi (not au jus) is straight up number 10 can of knorr powder. Grilled carrots are uninspiring and over use of arugula garnish plagues many dishes.  But with some wise choosing on your part and solid dinning experience with a stellar server in Krysten

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TT_sD2ySxdmO4978BfTjxA.text: Amazing!  Our top choice of the trip.  Great food, wonderful service!  Great tapas, fun place!

osfahTkR3mMnqYDT4n5knQ.text: Super fun! Super tasty new Downtown spot! We had a blast here.  We had Kirsten for our server, and she so great! We felt like we were visiting a friend we had not seen for a while!  We sat down and saw so many yummy things on the menu we decided to order a bunch of small family style plates form the "Social Club" section of the menu.  Here are my quick hits on food.... - Oxtail Empanadas - Loved them! The sauce had some delicious creamy heat!  -Roasted Cauliflower - The dates were the best part, the cauliflower was fine but a tiny bit blah in the flavor department.  -Mac & Cheese - Truffleliscious! It was really awesome, the smoked bacon was a great add.  -Street Corn - I loved it! a bit too citrusy for other peeps on the table, so I ate theirs! YUM!  -Gnudi - Very tasty!  We all decided we would happily go back any time! The dining room is sexy and comfortable, the food is truly social!

jFEkUhtEy8mhMB-6LsV9mw.text: Did not really care for it. The menu did not offer anything that I felt like I had to have so I ordered the signature salad. It was mixed greens from a bag of salad with minimal other ingredients and dressing--not cool.

aFo9cUnwTdu9a6R48Qx9vg.text: Didn't see what the big deal was. We waited for almost 30 still no one came to take our order. We had to ask for another server. Then after we ordered it took about another 45 minutes for the food to come. We got the chicken waffles, which was bland as hell; the Brussel sprouts were whatever; the fire roasted carrots were decent.   Our second server had the decency to apologize for everything which meant a lot. But took forever to refill my Diet Coke. Sigh

dN2gGKZ0dHIULuaHRJoSOQ.text: I wanted to try something new and was visiting from out of town. I live in Orange County so I visit often but had never tried Therapy. The food was amazing and definitely the type of feel I was looking for. The staff was great, very friendly. Our waitress, Georgie was extremely cheerful and definitely made our experience fun. She actually seemed to genuinely enjoy where she worked and was on top of it the whole time. She was even able to recommend things around town we didn't know about. We didn't have dessert but overall it was a great experience. We will definitely be coming back next time we're in town!

zBV2SOopDyThbqglSqm2Sg.text: Amazing tasting of appetizers, cocktails, chicken & red velvet waffles with a twist and a unique carrot cake desert to top it off. Great new DTLV restaurant. Walking distance from the Container Park. A fresh look for Downtown with good lighting and high ceilings. The private loft on the 2nd floor gives it a VIP feel that's perfect for a group or larger party. The bar is comfortable with a wide variety of drinks including a few frozen cocktails - try the frozen mango sangria, spa looking with fresh fruit garnish- refreshing and smooth. Lots of parking near by and tons of foot traffic around.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Red Velvet Waffles with a twist!
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Therapy drink menu - wide variety of cocktails
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen fruit sangria at Therapy $12

7dZXz1Dsf_2SlBQqy8rmXQ.text: My wife wanted to try the crispy fried ears but they dont have it anymore :( but its one of the best restaurant ive been to in las vegas. We ordered kale salad, dates, chicken and carot cake soo yummy! I cant think of any negative things to say. They deserve more than five stars for their great service. My wife and I left the place with a happy tummy and a happy face :) i would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake is the bomb

Gj3Waov-xxgzuMZUPgarmA.text: Came here the first or second week of opening and wasn't a fan of the food overall.  Tasted bland and I thought the menu was a knock off of Carson's (which is better imo).  The decor is really nice, fancy even and looks like a good place for date night. they also have TV's at the bar which is scarce on the East.

b7Kkw-gNQYG4DJ1a_Opycw.text: We were excited to try this place out especially since it was so close to our hotel. We were seated right away, up stairs. We thought the lady who say us was our waitress but we waited almost 30 minutes and no one ever took our order even after we told two other people we needed help. They both went to go get her but no one ever returned so we got up and left. First time I have ever left but we really didn't want to support the business anymore after that. Worst dinning experience ever,  didn't even eat.

TPU-3bYAb6_zZ3r_bh_Mug.text: I was visiting Las Vegas for a few days and decided to head towards Downtown. I stumbled across this place and decided on drinks and a few appetizers. Delicious!! I had the oxtail empanadas and the "gnudi" dish. My toddler gobbled up the fried mac & cheese. Our server was also really attentive. I hope to visit again before I head back to LA.

f2nt6ixdbfuJzLdxftHyfQ.text: In town for a conference and found this gem near the Fremont Street Experience  (thanks, Yelp!).  Wow. Best mac and cheese ever. Really the whole meal was fabulous. The service and overall vibe was fun and funky. Lots of love in the food. Awesome stuff! If we're in Vegas again, we'll be back.

FbqBxJ_WmFNQbo3LgSphJg.text: Excellence from the moment we walked in the door. The hostess was a beautiful gem and so friendly. The bartenders were top notch. Josh especially. And the food, my god the food. It was absolute incredible!! We're from Nebraska and the filet was to die for. The shrimp ceviche was amazing. The filet tar tar..I mean get out of my life...sooooooooo freaking good!! And the BEST thing I've ever eaten...the Brussels sprouts. Seriously THE best thing I've ever put in my mouth. Highly recommend this place. You will NOT be disappointed!!

d1CiORydwML0L891tFxB2w.text: Loved it!! Joanne was a delight and we will be back!! The service, the food, the drinks... WONDERFUL!! Thank you Joanne for a great dining experience.

Brz4fpVoH7Ll_nR8tWoqEA.text: Great food, especially the steak tartar and pork chops AMAZING!!!!!! Great beer selection. Cool place to celebrate your birthday

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G6sV5C8dmxLHPcDedDOw0g.text: This place is amazing! The food, the service, EVERYTHING! Just what I needed after a long day at CES

H-yaudJHLIeR12PvI6smZA.text: Slow service... it took over an hour to get a chicken Cesar salad... when I asked the waiter how much longer her said "it's coming now" as if it was a HUGE inconvenience that I even asked. Some of our group received their appetizers after 45 min. The food is ok... but the kitchen obviously has serious issues.

97Qq_lMtQNjtzm2OU6HeyA.text: Great food with a fun and eclectic menu.  Prices were very reasonable especially for Vegas.  Great atmosphere with a soft and beautiful singer playing guitar in the background.  My waiter Humberto was very attentive even though he had another large party and the maitre d' Jason checked in on us several times to be sure we were doing well.  What a great experience not to mention super yummy food topped by an amazing cheesecake dessert.  I don't come to Vegas more than once a year but I'll be sure to get to Therapy again.

FpQnR7migS3Rt1pJhOZ60w.text: We're from out of town as most people are around here. We came because Yelpers rated it high and for good reason. The food was PHENOMENAL, we ordered the trio of empanadas, Mac and cheese, braised short rib dinner, and pork belly dinner. I can't explain how delicious the food really is, I highly recommend the braised short rib dinner I inhaled it because it was cryingly good. The customer service is amazing and drinks just top it off.

yDQPBnPPUDGLor7aNNW-fg.text: Delicious! loved the mac & cheese and the red velvet waffle chicken sandwiches.

xC5OYYa_04QbeWgkc0dilA.text: Solid 4 stars, excellent craft cocktails and inventive menu. A great place to go if you're used to the LA standard of quality

UQd3n5lmBzqmI0Di5XKUzA.text: Therapy was a lovely place to dine. Me and my significant other went on a Sunday night for dinner. Our service was wonderful. Our server was named Gloria, she gave us wonderful recommendations. Drinks were delicious and the food was spectacular. I highly recommend it to everyone.

01rdhsFBzfyiTuvd-Zfdmg.text: I come here every time I'm in town. I still love their "The Smash" They gave me a tiny shot of Smoke Wagon which was really good. I had the Therapy Smoke Wagon, which was fruity but tasty. A bit on the sweet side for me but still good. I had the oxtail empanadas and they are good. Till next time Therapy.

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O8D6ozpw7ZkqSkOyD4Zmrw.text: In Vegas for a long weekend with a friend from back East. Wanted some place NOT on the strip. Hotel front desk gave us several recommendations in the Fremont district. Checked some Yelp reviews and ended up at Therapy. Great service started with the hostess; there was a mix up with our reservations so she comped us a round of drinks at the bar. Then the bartenders were so personable (Michael and Michael, ha!) we just decided to eat at the bar. Dirty vodka martini was well made and food recommendations were right on. Roasted beet salad, bacon wrapped dates with goat cheese, and even the chicken breast dish were great. Would I go back... Yes. Would I recommend it... Yes! Nice refreshing atmosphere to get away from the "new" strip.

QoeMjn7exhUQ9ehodgqcbA.text: I tried the red velvet chicken and waffles and oxtail empanadas.  Ridiculously tasty!!  Everytime I think of that waffle I'm like I have to go back.  The vibe of Therapy is laid back but they don't skip on service. My server Jonathan made sure my wife and are were well taken care of.  There was no robotic automated answers you get from some servers.   He was funny as well as genuine.  The food was served promptly as well as drinks.   I'm a beer drinker so I felt at home with there selections.    Next time I am in Vegas this will be one of my first and last stops.

AzdJVQwhuwEuWfYoQTcNgQ.text: Absolutely gourmet menu, really good food for extremely reasonable price! Positive reviews on Yelp are accurate. This place has a laid back vibe. You would be comfortable in a 3 piece suit as well as jeans and a tee!  Great layout, not over crowded, and chefs stay really busy in the kitchen. This would be a great place for small groups, especially friends from out of town that are sick of the Strip. They also have a huge loft available for private events overlooking the entire place, really cool!   Would be great place for a big rehearsal dinner of some work event, etc...

jCsTny2caNLkV-_oM1yT1g.text: We had the charred kale, the charred brussel sprouts, and the filet tartar to celebrate my birthday. The flavor and fusion of ingredients was absolutely off the charts! Enjoyed a fabulous signature cocktail - The Smash! - during dinner that I loved because it was bold with just a hint of sweetness. It was fun, too, because the blackberry puree at the bottom of the glass made for a quasi dessert! The atmosphere was lively and charming, and the service was superb. Highly, highly recommended!

QquFh56PditYg8cEHaPZhw.text: So satisfying!!! We got the Therapy salad, oxtail empanadas, and shrimp ceviche. It was all so so delicious! Food came out pretty quick and the service was really good also.

tVszvZRrFeNax7purEUnQQ.text: Great service great food great drinks one of my favorite local spots in downtown mornings are my favorite time to go in Kimberly and Joanne always are attentive, friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu. We enjoy coming here for lunch. The carrot cake is a must try as well as the oxtail empanadas and Brussels sprouts.

ZQRYw8AbyRcKADPeeORa-g.text: This place was an awesome atmosphere to spend your birthday!! Food was deelish and the Cuban sandwich is a must!!

TVzMjQPA3pfGAmomurmfHg.text: Service takes a little longer than anticipated, but food is quality and consistent :) YUMMY and best location.

cQRbIBa3ZxVp_pJ_t-Odsg.text: The food was great. We had the Empanadas Trio, Chicken meatballs, and Devil's on Horseback, and they were all amazing. They all came with their own sauce and they were a great compliment to the food. DELICIOUS!!

r2Emd4Y30z-hEzxXb90tdw.text: Great food and a great atmosphere.  We will return the next time we are in Las Vegas.  The specialty cocktails were amazing.

8V1N8nls-c2-ML2qv9L7AQ.text: Foodie heaven alert! One of my absolute favorite places I've been to in Vegas to eat. Apparently they were featured on the travel channel for their red velvet waffles and chicken. I tried the salmon which was incredible (wish I can go back eat it while typing this haha). The ambiance is incredible they were playing very good EDM music. The wagyu burger and fries were delicious as well! Will go back :)

EwjewmSyLsDSPFK4Fwk6hg.text: Highly recommend!  We tried the Chicken & Waffle Sliders, Smack Yo Mama Croquettes, Creamy & Crabby Dip, the Ricky Ricardo Cuban and finished with the Pot de Creme.  All were delicious and would order again - although the other options on the menu sounded great too!  Beyond the food, the atmosphere / decor was wonderful and the service was superb.  Our waitress helped out with suggestions and was friendly and attentive.  I don't go to downtown often, but am definitely willing to make the trip for this restaurant!

5mdpJoi33n4F48rFvbuwnw.text: Had dinner there last night and enjoyed the amazing bacon wrapped dates; the crab dip and blue corn chips; the fire cracker shrimp taco special and the amazing filet.  The food was outstanding but it was made so much more enjoyable by our amazing server, Michael. Not only was he very attentive, he made wonderful suggestions for our food selection. I was really thirsty-3 glasses of water and two adult beverages. No problem , Michael was right there.  Michael May be the manager but if he is not, he should be.

8p5zMA2kTqm-32DOZsGWWg.text: This place is always fun. The empanadas are awesome and I've gotten it every time I come here. Service is excellent and their drinks are delicious!!  A nice place to relax and unwind after walking awhile in Las Vegas.

6nuLEI80unahTaMW55dpMQ.text: THIS PLACE WAS LIT last Saturday night.  We walked here from another place around the corner after finding it on a quick yelp search. We were seated immediately, but at the very last available table available in the entire place snuggly set up in between two other tables so close we felt like we were on a double date with the couple to my left, lol!  Normally this might have bothered me, but I actually found it to be a little fun.    We ordered the deep fried brussel sprouts and the mac and cheese croquettes.  Since it was so busy, food was coming out slowly and we found out that the kitchen ran out of the  mac croquettes shortly before our table neighbors got what was probably the last batch delivered to their table.  My wife and I had a good laugh, because of course they'd run out and we'd have to watch the table next to us enjoy the last batch!   I'm not mad though, the deep fried sprouts were fantastic!  In lieu of the croquettes we ordered a side of mac and cheese, which was delicious, but since it was a side, didn't have any frills- but still very delicious.     Service was good, despite the big crowds and the long waits, we were checked on regularly and taken care of well.  Overall I liked this place.  I think I will like it better if I ever get a chance to come here when it isn't packed, but I understand- it was a Saturday night in Vegas on a holiday weekend.  I'm impressed they held it together as well as they did.

2D_-EZeRW1Q8UqH52KvVaw.text: Playing craps will make you hungry. This is the go to spot for everything delicious in DT Vegas. There are plenty of food options in the area but if you want some great food and want to show your crew that you have mad yelping skills then you need to bring them here.   They take reservations or you can walk in and sit at the bar like we did. No Dodgers available in case you're interested.   Mauro at the bar was super awesome. Talk about 5 star service, that guy was the epitome of what great service is supposed to be. He knew everything about the menu and made some recommendations.   I had to go with the big sexy burger. OMG, it was cooked perfectly. Comes with fries. I didnt stop there. My friend and I had to order the pork belly. Best pork belly I have ever tried. It was cooked perfectly. Right between solid and melting. It literally melts on your tongue. You need to at least try it.   Overall, great place to stop if you're in DT Vegas near Fremont street. Give them a try. Happy eating/ drinking!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly. Perfect. Order it
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big sexy. Oh so delicious
Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ricky Ricardo sandwich. Delicious

P6cDuX8x898A2k9i2u6qUQ.text: Phenomenal! Traveling solo, I ate at the bar. The Devils on Horseback rivaled those at The Spotted Pig in NYC. The Chimmichurri steak was enough for two people, but I ate every bite and nearly licked the plate clean. I can't remember the name of the drink I had, but it was basically a bourbon-based blackberry mojito, and it went down easy. I should say *they* went down easy. And I put down a few bites of a delicious s'mores skillet too. There's so much good food in the Fremont East area. Like, really good. Break free from the tourists and casino fare!! So worth it.

2SyHNAzZRYFGMp83MeP7Wg.text: I went into Therapy on Monday night and the food and service was excellent! Me and my buddies went in and sat at the bar to have some cocktails and appetizers. I had the crab dip which was exceptional and the chimichuri steak, as recommended by the bartender Christina. Who was also exceptional.   There was some type of party going on when we got there and the bar was packed, but we were still tended to in a timely manner & christina made me the best old fashioned I've had downtown. As a fellow industry worker and bartender in Las Vegas, I can understand a bar being busy and the staff becoming overwhelmed. But she did not and was super attentive and friendly to us the entire time. I will most definitely be going back again! Thanks therapy!

_2dFze_hp5lJ7mBCrUoPNQ.text: We went last summer and had an amazing experience with the food and the atmosphere. Our server was John and he was amazing and attentive. We recently visited Las Vegas for New Year's Eve and had to go back. Our server was John again and he not only remembered us, he was just as amazing this visit too.   Definitely a must try restaurant if your ever in Vegas. Food and service (John) will not disappoint!!!!!

Pl00vbRW4oEtCM9VAwSVlA.text: This was probably the best place I have been too in a long time. Our server Michael was super kind and willing to take the time to explain drinks and food in a way that was perceptive to all. I can't wait to come back and experience Therapy again.   Michael, thank you so much for the time you spent to serve us with kindness and honesty. Your service was much obliged.

clVvzEs12mPt0mKXi6AanQ.text: A necessary stop on any DTLV bar crawl.  Comfortable, contemporary eatery fitting of urban renewal that, while not as innovative as before, still dishes out solid, tasty grub.  Tip:  Share everything (but take a bite of the sandwich and put it back on the plate instead of cutting off a piece and I'll stab you with a fork).  The filet tartar topped with shaved parm ad a raw (uncured) egg yolk, as good as any (though not as good as when they used hangar steak).  Coarse beef, gentle seasoning that relies on the parm for salt and earthiness.  Mix, spread on the charred toast, add a bite of vinegary pickled veg to brighten it up.  No complaints.  Oxtail empanadas definitely work.  Tasty, gelatinous oxtail and a hint of fresh jalapeno chili flavor and heat in a puffed, crisp shell.  A dip in the earthy, zesty harissa lime sauce balances the flavors.    Equally satisfying, the charred Brussels sprouts.  Buttery, cashews for texture, mustard for zest, shaved parm for earthiness all serve to enhance the bitter sweetness of the sprouts.  Perfect cocktail / beer food.  The tender grilled octopus and zesty shrimp crevice (to be scooped up on blue corn tortilla chips) both good choices.  Limited but well chosen selection of craft beers and wines by the glass and bottle.  Well made craft cocktails (Downtown Manhattan baby).    Tip:  HH Mon - Thurs 14:00 - 17:00; reverse 21:00 - 23:00.  Good discounts and f&b pairings.  Very friendly, off Strip service.  Still solid but seriously, crispy pig ears, how I miss thee.

PVPlHm625zMwEx_0vOiP4w.text: Had a great lunch for my friend's bachelorette while exploring downtown. Terrance was very attentive, made us custom drinks and deserts, and put up with our shenanigans. Delicious food and wonderful ambience. Would definitely come again. Get the bacon dates.

SUh-xzTC3H4WHF5fe8Nfwg.text: It's rare that my baby mama and I get a day date, but when we do, we try and dine somewhere we've never been. Therapy was an easy choice when looking at all of my Yelping compadres reviews & pics.   Our meal started with the crab & artichoke dip. Honestly, one of my favorite app's I've ever had. I could have ordered this as the appetizer. Another order for the entree. And a third order as my dessert. Gadzooks was it good! Rich & creamy, the blue corn tortilla chips that came with it complimented the dip perfectly. Buyer beware, it comes out like molten lava, but once it cools down you can't shovel it in fast enough.  For our entree's we shared the mac & cheese and a cheeseburger. Both were very good. I'd probably try something different on my next go-round as neither blew me away. The mac & cheese was really good. We ordered just the small side order portion. Per our waiter, it's exactly the same as the entree (and less expensive). The kobe beef burger was good, but a burger, not too exciting. I'd probably get a little more exotic with my entree next time.  For dessert we rolled with the Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding. Definitely enough for 2-3 people to share. Being totally honest, I was so full by the time this came out that my flavor sensors were probably stretched to their limits. It was a good dessert, the house made banana sorbet was definitely the highlight. I'd order this again for sure, but would have to be mindful of how much I ate beforehand so I don't tap out after a few bites.  Great spot for lunch or dinner, casual dining. Awesome location downtown near all the action on Fremont. Will be back soon!

4Q5T5iXRN10WvZ9lWar7Gw.text: Service and follow up is great here.  The drinks were excellent. My Pina colada was so creamy. The Brussel sprouts appetizer was the best I've had. I also had the red velvet waffles with chicken and it was so good.  The macaroni dish was a little sparse. My dad has the tartare Fish and the presentation was excellent. It's not his usual dish but he ate most of it.  I'd definitely make another visit to try other tasty offerings

GITIthBT4c1xtcvUPKQavw.text: During my most recent trip I met up with some local friends who decided on Therapy as our meeting spot for dinner. This was an excellent choice!   We went on a Friday night around 7:30 and had reservations to get in which Is definitely recommended. We had a very nice waiter. I did not catch his name but he was everything you could ask for. He was very attentive and took care of our every need very promptly.   We all started with the Red Velvet Chicken and Waffle Sliders, The Chorizo empanadas, and the Creamy and Crabby served with Blue corn chips. Everything was definitely legit and very tasty. I don't recall what everyone had for their entree but I had the Ricky Ricardo. This is their version of a Cuban Sandwich. Not a traditional one by any means but still an extremely delicious sandwich which was served with some of the best plantains I've ever had. I did not get pictures of anything as we all just dug right in. There are plenty of pictures here on Yelp and a good video of the Chicken and Waffle sliders from when Therapy was featured on Travel Channel's Food Paradise.   If you are thinking of going I would definitely recommend. I am not a local but when I return to Vegas I will return for sure!

Ie2l356_nbss1JDHSjanUQ.text: My buddy recommended this place and he is usually spot on. Came with very high expectations and unfortunately the service kinda ruined the whole experience.  Servers were running around frantically, wasn't incredibly busy and didn't understand what the issue was?  When you see a place with 1500+ reviews at a 4.5 star average you have to wonder? I am sure it must have been an off night and I will for sure come back as the food was just too delicious to let go.

jKFWxCWvOMQ34lRr8xZtQQ.text: Being in Vegas almost a week we hadn't had a meal that had been worth what we were paying and great quality, until we dined at Therapy!   The prices were very reasonable and the portions were decent as well. Had I known of Therapy we would have dined there every chance we got while being on Fremont.   Very nice environment, music was so pleasant. Bachata was playing. Our server was Jonathan. Since being in Vegas we had not received the service Jonathan gave us. He was very friendly and patient. I never felt rushed or uncomfortable. He was just the right attentiveness.   Over all mine and my husband's experience at Therapy was amazing! Great and delicious food is what we had and we will be coming back for sure next time we come back to Vegas!   Husband had firecracker shrimp tacos & truffle parmesan fries. I had the Senor Shorty and we shared an order of charred brussel sprouts. Everything was absolutely delicious! We also took dessert to go. We got the yummy crumbled carrot cake. Cutest tiny carrot as garnish.   Overall our experience was wonderful!

naeeqxFgctF3pSTrmMLB9g.text: Therapy is my favorite bar in downtown Las Vegas. I had some friends visiting from out-of-town and deemed it essential to bring them here.  Therapy is unique to all other bars downtown, largely because of its menu. The food is a step up from regular bar food and the drinks are often unusual and unique. I was the DD, so I didn't get to sample a lot this time. But I did have a blueberry upside down cake Therapy Shot. The Therapy Shots are switched out every so often. I believe this one was some sort of vodka-based concoction. Overall, therapy is a must-visit for tourists and locals alike!

sEFzrSrmGhLE2ZaiIRVd2w.text: One of my favorite spots during my visit was easily Therapy. This is a tapas style restaurant and they do them well. We went for dinner and they weren't too crowded so we were seated immediately. The staff and service were good and we ordered several different things. The stars of the night were the Fried Mac & Cheese Croquettes With Tomato Bacon Jam & Sriracha Aioli. These were so good we almost ordered another other. The smores dessert is also a must order! Great visit.

7mxy0sos--i0EfzGOwxEGw.text: My mind still thinks of downtown Las Vegas as an option for the budget-conscious. I really shouldn't be surprised by the Strip-like prices; they really have successfully gentrified and revitalized the area. Still not the safest part of Vegas, but ya know... I'm sure they're working on it.   Therapy is a cool, trendy little restaurant/bar. Their menu is a limited collection of elevated bar food made with higher-end ingredients like wagyu, truffle, and foie gras. Food was well executed and delicious. Prices were just a little bit too high.

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Glutinous. Combination of flavors and textures is drool-worthy

RKST3zOzcLYypyAPt-sQiQ.text: This restaurant is located right downtown just a few steps from the Fremont Entertainment area.  I quite liked this place.  I ordered the Duck Confit Hash and was not disappointed. Preparing good duck confit is not every cook's cup o tea. But the kitchen nailed it. The meat was tender and flavorful. Many people avoid duck because of it's gamey taste (I have no problem with it). I could not detect any gaminess. So try it and you will like it.  My dining companion ordered the Relapse 518 Lox. He was pleased with it. I got a bite and I gave it high marks.  I loved the ambiance. Open and airy with a lively vibe about it.  Long live these wonderful eateries off the strip. Go to the strip only if money is burning a hole in your pocket and you are yearning for poor service with an attitude.  Viva Las Vegas!!

QDUCcAsgcSuS0MNqdFr9gw.text: The atmosphere is off the hook; the food is fantastic ! I wish we found this place earlier

Huy1VCJq42nDxsoYwepGBA.text: THE BEST THERAPY is exactly what this food was!! ABSOLUTELY MIND BLOWING.  Came here on our way out of Vegas!! Stayed on the strip for a week and decided to come up to Fremont on my way out. Found this spot via yelp and now i know why the reviews are soo good!!  Ordered the chicken and red velvet waffles, the fried Mac and cheese, and the fried chicken sandwich.   EVERYTHING was divine!  The chicken and waffles were sooo good! Loved that it came in a sandwich style! Although the portion looks small, it was super filling! My boyfriend could barely finish, he was so full! The Mac and cheese-- OMG. Other worldly! Never had fried Mac and cheese that was so good! The sauce on it and under it was just amazing!!! Paired really well. My chicken sandwich was heavenly!! I love fried chicken, I've tried multiple restaurants and this was a definite winner. I loved how they didn't give a huge portion of French fries because it would have gone to waste so I really appreciated that actually!   Louis was my waiter and he was FABULOUS! Great customer service! Made us feel so welcomed and he was so so nice. Definitely makes me want to come back even more! Great service always goes a long way so I applaud y'all for that.  Left Vegas with a BANG! Can't wait to come back

C5KIqGVc3H6Bq4x-4z6Tvg.text: So glad I found this restaurant on yelp! I highly recommend coming here, the food is delicious and the customer service is excellent!  Stopped by for a Therapy session before heading back to reality (last day of vacation in Vegas) and it was the best decision I've made all week.   We sat outside with a great view of Fremont. We also were allowed to bring our pup with us. We had the nicest waiter ever, Louis, who was super friendly and quick. He was very efficient and attentive, he even offered my pup some water. I'm grateful he was our waiter and he deserves a promotion/raise!   We ordered the chicken and red velvet waffles, fried Mac and cheese croquettes, and the King! Literally everything was bomb! The fried chicken for both dishes were finger-licking good! The waffles were delectable, very fluffy and cooked well! The fried Mac and cheese was interesting, in a good way. Never had Mac and cheese like this but it was so good. The jam it comes with makes it even better. Presentation was awesome as well!   I definitely will come back here next time I'm in Vegas!

Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The KING!

DP0kn-BtwXCgx1e5AVcdNg.text: Perhaps dumb luck, or the unlikely result of having recently seen former Chef Daniel Ontiveros at Scotch 80 Prime, but whatever the reason it was Thursday evening that two guests sat down to dinner at Therapy. exactly four years (to the day) after the first time, though much has changed both for the Restaurant and DTLV since.  Now old enough to be considered one of East Fremont's staple eateries, the lengthy build-out of a space formerly housing a Dollar Store still looking fresh and attracting crowds of tourists for both Food and Drink, it is under the direction of General Manager Maria Horta that day-to-day activities are coordinated, and thanks to the spaces' "Relapse Nightclub" those hours frequently extend well past midnight.     Offering lunch and dinner, plus recently weekend Brunch, it was at the tail-end of Happy Hour that business began to pick up, service friendly yet professional while offering their suggestions as well as thorough explanations of plates from recently promoted Executive Chef Chris Robyn.  Originally themed as a gastro-pub, but since taking on global influences spanning from Mexico to the Native American Cuisine Chris has been cooking for several years as a corporate Chef for one of the Nation's largest casino groups, it is rightfully with Cocktails that many nights at Therapy. begin, both a $12 Mango Ricky and frozen Pina Colada performing well and pairing nicely to the "Signature Salad" of Apples, Candied Nuts and mixed Greens plus Bleu Cheese.  Still maintaining several day one dishes, both Devils on Horseback and tender Chicken Meatballs highlighted by vibrant housemade Sauces, it was unfortunate that "Birria" Empanadas featuring Beef rather than Goat were strictly one note inside over-thick Pastry, though "Fred & Mark's" Croquettes offered three fun bites thanks to fried Pasta topped in smooth Sriracha with a sweet and savory reduction beneath.  Moving next to "Creamy & Crabby," at $17 not cheap but entirely justified by its sharable size and plenty of freshly picked Meat, suffice it to say that time plus an appearance on "The Travel Channel" have seen Chicken & Waffle Sliders improve tremendously in terms of taste and texture, though if one is looking for Therapy.'s best dish that honor still belongs to "In The Gnudi" with creamy gobs of Ricotta made sticky with Figs.  Not about to forget Chef Robyn's years as Corporate Executive Chef for Bachi Burger, The "Big Sexy" featuring eight ounces of expertly-cooked Wagyu on a springy Bun with Brie and Scallion Mayonnaise, it is in strong competition with The Kitchen at Atomic that Therapy.'s Pork Chop finds itself for best in town, though the "Mustard Mash" can at times be a bit overpowering.  Onward to Dessert, and showing off Indian Fry Bread served as part of the recently-debuted "Senor Shorty" en route, Therapy. currently features two old and two new sweets, the Campfire S'mores in cast iron decidedly rich in comparison to deconstructed Carrot Cake that rivals any in Sin City, though the real showstopper is titled "My 3 Best Friends" and features Chocolate, Peanut Butter and Strawberry Belgian Waffles heaped with nine scoops of Brown Sugar Gelato plus a trio of Sauces, Nuts, Fruit and Whipped Cream.  FOUR STARS:  Somewhat forgotten with the abundance of recent openings in Las Vegas, Therapy. nonetheless continues to lure in guests with fair prices and food that doesn't take itself too seriously, the promotion of Chris Robyn to Executive Chef promising good things to come given his interest in both Hawaiian and Native American culture.

a6TzCiM9ALJzjpqXJS6nTw.text: Nothing special.  Was just okay but pricey.  We went here pre- Smith Center and were very disappointed.  Burger was bland and tacos as well.  Appetizers were okay but not for the money.

17e9obPu_h33f5yGqP750g.text: Mood-  lunch  Ive seen this place many times while I was in the area. Today was the day to come and try it out.   Upon entering we waited for a little bit until greeted. The restaurant wasn't packed but there definitely was patrons. After being greeted we were led to our booth and given lunch menus.   We ordered the steak frites, wagyu hamburgers with bacon,  chicken fried chicken club, French dip, truffle fries as an upgrade, several sodas, and water with cucumber/ lemon.   Our server/hostess/ greeter/ busser- truly was a one lady show. She had to work the whole inside plus tend to the patrons sitting outside. So yes the food took a bit, but after watching that it was understandable. After awhile they finally had 2 other people come out to help her.   Each person at my table had their own ideas regarding the food. I know for the French dip, chicken fried chicken club, and one of the burgers was hit, plus those truffle fries stole the show.   Interior is modern with plenty of table and booth seating. Plus seating outdoors. The bar was well stocked, with some racing playing on the televisions. They have a house DJ - who was playing songs that brought back some good memories.  Pricing is reasonable as it is in a tourist area.   Location is Freemont/ Las Vegas Blvd-- parking is streets, garages, or lots.

YlX2aBXYNnUkFJgUCPNKfQ.text: We came in on a Tuesday afternoon around 4 PM. There was not very many people in the restaurant which was nice because I was hungry and I was not looking for a crowd. The atmosphere seems like it would be fun place in the evening and they had great music playing during the afternoon. Our server made great suggestions and we took him up on a couple of his ideas.  The gnudi Is a complete must! If you don't plan on ordering food get this anyway. If you do plan on ordering food you have to eat this. It is so rich and perfect for sharing! They are small portions but it is very rich so it satisfies your appetite.  The carne Asada tacos were not my favorite. I took one bite and that's all I could handle. There is some sort of sauce that tastes like pesto and I do not like pesto. In my opinion I would not order the tacos again.  The chicken and Red velvet waffles were good but they could have used more sauce. I wish I would have asked for more syrup because they were a bit dry but very tasteful.  The sliders were very tasty! The meat seemed like it was higher grade and it was very moist.  I definitely suggest stopping by this place either for a drink or for food

pT7cwff7Axj0mFovcYFh6g.text: Great venue, I was here for Techno Taco Tuesday. Inside is spacious. Friendly bar staff. Good that smoking is outside. Nice patio for that to hang out. Only minor issue is that there's only 1 bathroom for each gender. Drinks are affordable. I did not try the food.

siEeJOpNRZizDOfEZ5HWxQ.text: Had this place bookmarked as I wanted to try it out sometime and last night was my opportunity!! Had a friend in town so we walked up at 730pm on a Friday and was promptly seated without needing a reservation.   Inside was bigger than I had expected and decor was modern and music was great!  Our server was great, very attentive, dressed very well and when I couldn't choose between drinks and a meal he suggested which was better and I was very pleased!  I ordered the Mango Ricky and it was perfect!  Dinner I had The Chick and it was UH-Maze-ing!! Legit the chicken was PERFECT!! It was not over cooked, it was juicy and crispy. The sweet potato mash was sweet and yummy (could have been warmer but it was very flavorful), the broccolini was also cooked perfectly but wasn't very warm but I love broccoli so it didn't bother me and the sweet chili mole was to die for!!! Love love loved that sweet chili mole that gets 5 stars for sure!!  The service was slow but we were not in a hurry to get anywhere.   I'll be back - there's other food items I want to try and definitely more drinks I want to try :-)

WR1tn9ZwhMfFIfv_9mR-kw.text: Would definitely come back!!!  Humberto HOOKED IT UP!!! Asked for his suggestion on what I should get and he was right!!!! Chimichurri steak was amazing!   Atmosphere of this place is awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chimichurri Steak... AMAZING!

Ndlh5tf1O3JFu9bikSEynQ.text: When planning a place to meet up for dinner with friends, one of my girlfriends suggested Therapy. I had never heard of it (I do tend to live under a rock though) so I immediately Yelped it and found that it had great reviews. Sweet, let's go!  Let me just say, I do not like going downtown usually. It's a pain to get to, the street directions can be confusing, there's always construction, heavy traffic and parking is a pain in the butt. Well (praise be) I got there super fast, did not get lost, and there was a parking lot (pay to park on 6th St just south of Fremont) just across the street a little ways. So it was super easy and not a pain at all! We were there this past Saturday evening, Michael was our server and he was wonderful. He had great suggestions and his favorite drink ended up being the best one we tried! Raspberry Rose, it's so good! We also had The Smash and Mango Ricky which were both really really good too.   For food we ordered: Devils on Horseback-AMAZING and def my fav! The Gnudi-this was really good but not something I personally would get again Creamy and Crabby-delicious, I love chips and dip and this was so creamy cheesy and crabby! Yum! The Big Sexy-pretty dang good tasty burger, I did have to squish it down quite a bit just to fit it in my mouth! To conclude, all four of us enjoyed all of our selections and vowed to come back and eventually try everything else on the menu!

Q5NAyOelr9QnfJO7PEKHAg.text: After scrambling to find a place in downtown Las Vegas, I finally settled on Therapy, as it seemed to have the widest array of food options for my group of 4.   We were seated upstairs relatively quickly, but the area upstairs feels kinda cut off from the rest of the restaurant. The downstairs dining section is very open and bright while the upstairs felt kind of intimate and packed; the ambiance certainly felt different upstairs.   We ordered 4 items off the menu: Red Velvet Chicken and Waffles, Charred Brussel Sprouts, Chorizo Empanadas, and the Filet Tartare.  I would say that the best dish was the Brussel sprouts. They had a nice flavor but were a bit softer than advertised: the crunchiness of the cashews helped to make up for this. The red velvet waffles were certainly an eye-catcher and make for a cool photo, but taste-wise, these chicken and waffles felt like a very standard interpretation of the dish. Somewhat difficult to eat I will admit, as gripping a waffle is very different than gripping a bun, but I like the creativity of using the waffle differently!  I wasn't a fan of the batard bread that the filet tartare came with, as it was somewhat tough to chew. The chorizo empanadas were average, nothing necessarily bad or great about them.   Our service was a little disappointing, as it took quite a while for our dishes to come out. Considering the size of the plates, I was surprised by the total amount of time it took to have them sent out from the kitchen.   I think there are definitely some solid plates to be had at Therapy, but my overall experience didn't match the expectations I had. I think it's a place worth giving a try though, as downtown Las Vegas needs some places that can match the excitement of the dining options on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Therapy-Relapse Night club - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet chicken and waffles

AaSwQYu20QravjMQwT3iJg.text: It was my first time dining here, I went with my friends about a week ago after an event I went to at the Golden Nugget. I like the location of this place, great for downtown/freemont st. crowd.   We ordered the Fried mac and cheese, korean BBQ bao buns, Brussel sprotus, and Cast iron smores for dessert. I also had the Mango Ricky for my cocktail.  The mango ricky was good, I wished it was presented in a different glass, but that's just me being picky.  The fried mac & cheese is very different, but good! It was on a bed of tomato-bacon jam, which was a little too sweet for me, and there was a lot of it. Although it looked great as a presentation for the jam to be spread on the plate with the mac and cheese on top, I would have preferred the jam to be separated on small dish on the side. I also thought that the lump of sriracha aoli on top was too much, maybe a little less would be better, since the mac & cheese is already good and full of flavor.  The Brussel sprouts with bacon tasted very good, however, I would have liked it to be a little more crispier.   The cast iron Smores is probably my favorite dish of the night! The marshmallows were toasted perfectly, and was not burned, and the amount of graham and chocolate at the bottom was a perfect amount. Be careful touching the cast iron, because it comes out very hot!  5 start because the food was great and the service provided by our server, Michael(?), was excellent. He welcomed us, asked if we had questions, took our drink and food order on time, recommended items from the menu, answered our questions, and assisted with a friendly manner. Great service definitely makes a good restaurant!

BlNeZujdmTjdJbDfDHgiHA.text: Unbelievably good food and wonderful service! Our server Jordan was friendly, explained any questions we had about the menu, and the restaurant is accommodating to special diets. Start off with one of their wonderful sangrias. The tomato soup with bacon bites was outstanding! The gnudi appetizer was also incredibly delicious! I highly recommend the chimichurri steak. It is mouth watering. For fun, try the Ricky Ricardo! Desserts also don't disappoint! From the rum raisin gelato, to the waffle brownie, to the carrot cake, they are all delicious! You cannot go wrong with anything you order!

5SoaesHZbl8vN4WKZdfBEA.text: This place is amazing.  Great food and great service. My wife and I dined here for our 19th anniversary.  The food/atmosphere was perfect.  Jared the owner came by our table to make sure everything was ok and to converse with us. One of our top places to eat in Vegas.  And we've been here since the 70's.

U2ZtG5DXFh6tZViD2MC-Ow.text: Awesome, ouch. This gem of a restaurant is stellar. Mind blowing food the crispy skin on the hunters chicken and the perfect center, Demi with mushrooms OMG. I started with the off the rails roasted carrots with feta and maple syrup. 4 huge carrots roasted to perfection. Shrimp Scampi perfectly cooked and deveined with delicious velvety lemon beurre blanc and crisp toasties, Angels on horseback the texture was perfect the Romesco sauce such a nice compliment and I loved the crispy rich texture of the bacon. All of this with a bottle of Pine Ridge Chenin Blanc/ Viognier, crispy floral notes with a great back bone. These Sonoma County girls cal only say, great job well done. Totally surprised a shout out to our waiters/ bartenders because we sat at the bar Mike and Manny. We even got to schmooze with Mr. Big Sexy himself Roger, hell of a guy.

DN35xEiuzmFBqUlaLDyaEw.text: So I am not sure what people are talking about when they are saying good value.  Does this mean that the portions are big, or the price vs. what you get is comparable to other DTLV?  Because that is not the case.    First of all let me say that I am not the type of guy to walk into a restaurant and base it off of how much food you can serve up onto a plate...this is ridiculous and the reason we have major health and obesity issues in our fair country...well along with a lot of other reasons but it is a strong contribution.  Therapy has come into the DTLV area and with the first restaurant under the owner's belts it falls short on a few things.    Let's focus on what they are doing right first, because I'm not here to bash, I'm here to help the readers make good decisions on their dinning experience and go to a place that is True to what you read.  The space is amazing.  Exposed beams that were stained walnut and were a discovery while demoing the room for the new restaurant, a brick south wall that ties in the exposed ducting and ventilation to make the place seem huge and open.  The place breathes and the 130 seats fit nicely within the walls.  Nothing is cramped, it was an impressive renovation and detail was attended to...nice job gents!  Chef Daniel Ontiveros who hails from Comme Ca as the Executive Chef in the Cosmopolitan has taken over the open window kitchen and has serious chops.  His menu has been sliced and diced though due to the size of the kitchen...which is the only thing in the restaurant that is small.  9 menu items have already seen the chopping block due to the sheer need for more space and prep.  On the DL he had more to his menu in the beginning and that was put by the wayside for a more "American Tapas" style.  What the Hell does that even mean..."American Tapas"?  They are more of a shared small plate style and do have a few larger entrees that look like they might fit into a more traditional meal style establishment.  The Bartender was super friendly and tried to guide me in the best way she could through the menu, although she really didn't have a good knowledge base of the beers they had and had no idea where to find them in the cooler....I actually had to point them out to her.  Not a big deal, but if you are new, and you have put all this money into a new venture, let's start paying attention to detail folks and train your staff.  The food...well it was good, nothing to write home about but tasty enough. But do you go to a restaurant to have just OK food?  I mean I like to walk away and be like, "I can't wait to go back and try more dishes!"  which is how I felt about Carson's Kitchen and the newly changed menu at RCP, all in the same area.  The dishes were also a bit overpriced for Downtown. The asparagus, country ham and shaved Parmesan with a poached egg is what really tweaked my britches though.  I never send stuff back, mostly because I have worked in the food industry and there are some shady buggers in the back that get peeved and do not so nice stuff to the food...maybe not in these types of places but enough to make me worry just a bit..ever seen "Waiter"...yea.  The soft poached egg came out, the first time, hard and not a bit of yolk to spill out over all the yummy goodness that I was expecting after the the GM prepared me for what was to come.  So, I sent it back and received a new one.....DAMMMMIIITTTTT!!!  It was the same bloody thing.  Ugh!!!! I asked the GM if they suveed their eggs or cooked them to order and he told me that they did them to order, and then proceeded to tell me that this was the way it should be even after telling me that it should run over the asparagus and soak into the dish like a pretty little yolk blanket (my words not his).  So I ate it and...well meh.  The Oxtail empanadas were pretty good though, the oxtail meat is braised apparently for 12 hours and the empanada dough is home made by the pastry chef in back who also does their bread in house. Chef Daniel came out to apologize for the mistakes and that made most of it all better for me, I love when a Chef has the newtons to come out and take the beating for what is being created in the back..good for you Chef.    So, I will probably go back just to try it out and see if it all was just growing pains and I will bring a bigger wallet and maybe a rich friend to pay for it all.  The last thing is, Owners, please don't lurk, I know this is your first venture but creepy is not a good way to keep people coming back.  Thanks Chef Daniel I know you have the chops to make this place better, please, please don't let the menu fall into the Bar and frozen drink category of Freemont street, seriously guys...frozen drinks on your cocktail list...wow.

6KkLoPPYGmxWffCgcaxx7g.text: My first thought when I walked in was, "this place a great" nice and modern with 3 tv screens to watch the game. We were seated in a timely matter. The inside is very clean. We have been here a few times for lunch with a wonderful female server and for dinner. We had the - in the 'Gnudi', short ribs, Scottish salmon, shrimp ceviche, oxtail empenadas and the summer squash flatbread. I would definitely oder the squash flatbread again and the gnudi. I am looking forward to dining here again and trying the rest of the menu.

KEcKLsDnMu7CUxNyNp-DaQ.text: Went on a date night with hubby everything was great. Food was delicious!. Customer service was everything you would expect. Our server name was Jonathan and he was nice and helpful. We'll  definitely  be doing another date night here.

QnCsHW0DAk2yY3Epv8FQ9g.text: As far as downtown/ Fremont goes this place is great. We had great service and good food. Prices are fair. The steak tar tar was awesome and the Mac was really good. Hungry and downtown I highly recommend.

U9uLcRJZdiIOO2oekO95Uw.text: Therapy is located in between RCP Pizza and The Beat coffee shop. Therapy moved into  the same location as the dollar store. I remember the Dollar Store, so when I walked into Therapy last night I was very impressed with the look and feel of the place. Therapy has a very natural, modern look with a lot of natural light coming in. The ceilings are arched and raised and the flooring is a beautiful tile that looks like wood. One of the servers advised that the ceiling was there since the 50's as well as the block brick wall. I was shocked, the dollar store covered the beauty with dry wall. I went last night for dinner with a group of 9 people. We made reservations in advance. When our group arrived we were given a friendly greeting by the staff and shown to our table in the back by the kitchen. At first we were apprehensive about sitting so close to the kitchen. One of the servers advised that we would not even know they were there, they were right. Our friendly, pretty server explained the menu and asked if we wanted to bring out the food as its ready or eat at the same time. We were hungry so we agreed to get the food as it was ready. I ordered the Chicken meatballs and the Corn, it was very good. I also tasted the carrot cake crumble dessert which was also amazing. Our server also went above and beyond in splitting our bill at the end of dinner, we were happy that she was able accommodate us. A lot of restaurants refuse to split checks for groups so we were very pleased. I also tasted other entrees that other people ordered. It was very good. We will return!
